analyzed: gis rtags gzung zhing 'brel ba dran pa'i rjes la dpog pa de ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The inference is the cognition that occurs after the sign has been apprehended and the relation [between the sign and the property to be established] has been recalled.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni stobs mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni stobs mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: The word “and” indicates that the two are equal in strength.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag bsdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag bsdud pa'o //
translated: The word “only” is added to indicate that there are no other means of valid cognition besides perception and inference.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i sgra nges par bya ba'i don yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgra de ltar gyi don te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i sgra nges par bya ba'i don yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i sgra de ltar gyi don te /
translated: When the word “two” is taken to mean “only,” then the word “only” has the meaning of “in this way.”

original: de ni de ltar rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: The means of valid cognition are only two in this way.

original: sgra dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //🔽ci ste 'jig rten gyi don rtogs pa la grangs kyi tshig nyid yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgra dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no // ci ste 'jig rten gyi don rtogs pa la grangs kyi tshig nyid yin pa de'i tshe zhes bya'o //
translated: They are not two in terms of sound, measurement, and so on.🔽If the word “only” is taken to mean that the means of valid cognition are complete,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: then the word “only” has the meaning of “entirely.”🔽The means of valid cognition are entirely only two.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni 'di gnyis kho nar zad kyi gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni 'di gnyis kho nar zad kyi gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: There are no other means of valid cognition besides these two.

original: gal te dngos po'i de kho na 'dzin pa nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i de kho na 'dzin pa nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid yin nam /
translated: If the apprehension of the reality of things is itself right knowledge,

original: 'on te gzung ba'i dngos po thob par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba'i dngos po thob par byed pa yin /
translated: or if it causes the attainment of the apprehended thing,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang rjes su dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang rjes su dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not right knowledge, because inference does not apprehend a thing.

original: ma bzung ba thob par byed pa nyid kyang yang dag pa'i shes pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ma bzung ba thob par byed pa nyid kyang yang dag pa'i shes pa yin na ni /
translated: If the mere cause of the attainment of the unapprehended is right knowledge,

original: chu'i shes pa las kyang ma bzung ba'i smig rgyu thob pas 'ga' yang yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la ;
analyzed: chu'i shes pa las kyang ma bzung ba'i smig rgyu thob pas 'ga' yang yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la ;
translated: then no knowledge would be wrong knowledge, because the knowledge of water causes the attainment of the unapprehended mirage.

original: 'dod pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show that right knowledge is accepted in this way, he says, “because these are non-deceptive,” etc.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis slu ba med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag gis slu ba med de /
translated: Because these are non-deceptive,

original: dgag pa gnyis kyis mi slu ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgag pa gnyis kyis mi slu ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that they are non-deceptive by a double negation.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, these are right knowledge.

original: mi slu bar byed pa nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: mi slu bar byed pa nyid yang dag pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: That which causes non-deception is right knowledge.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten na khas blangs pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa mi slu ba yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yang bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed pas mi slu bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten na khas blangs pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa mi slu ba yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yang bstan pa'i don dang phrad par byed pas mi slu bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as in the world, that which causes one to attain the intended object is non-deceptive, so too, knowledge should be seen as non-deceptive because it causes one to attain the object as taught.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: dngos po 'dzin par byed pas ni yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po thob par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin par byed pas ni yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po thob par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is not that right knowledge is merely the apprehension of an entity, but rather it is the attainment of an entity.

original: de gang las she na /
analyzed: de gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: don bya ba la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don bya ba la zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said: in the performance of an object's function.

original: de la don ni gtso bo la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'o //🔽de'i bya ba ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la don ni gtso bo la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba'o // de'i bya ba ni byed pa ste /
translated: There, the object is the primary principle, etc., which is to be accomplished.🔽Its function is the activity.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: It is the activity of the agent.

original: 'dir @8b byed pa po nyid la brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir @8b byed pa po nyid la brjod do //
translated: Here, the agent itself is expressed.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i nus pa'i yul la mi slu ba de ni de la ltos nas thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub pa'i nus pa'i yul la mi slu ba de ni de la ltos nas thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it is in relation to the object that has the capacity to achieve the goal that it is nondeceptive, and it is in relation to that that it is said to be a means of obtaining the goal.

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis /
translated: Because those who are rational and who seek the goal

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig don du gnyer ba de 'dra ba nyid kho bo cag gis kyang brtag par bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig don du gnyer ba de 'dra ba nyid kho bo cag gis kyang brtag par bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: must investigate just what kind of valid knowledge they should seek.

original: de dag kyang don byed pa bsgrub pa la 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de dag kyang don byed pa bsgrub pa la 'jug pa na /
translated: And when they seek to achieve a functional thing,

original: de thob par rung ba 'jug par byed pa'i shes pa nyid tshol gyi dngos po 'dzin pa tsam ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de thob par rung ba 'jug par byed pa'i shes pa nyid tshol gyi dngos po 'dzin pa tsam ni ma yin te /
translated: they seek the very cognition that engages in obtaining it, not just the apprehension of the thing,🔽because the latter is not a means of achieving a functional thing,

original: don byed pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang ; de thob pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: don byed pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang ; de thob pa yang ma yin la /
translated: because it is not the obtaining of that,

original: de thob pa'i thabs kyang ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa las kyang thob pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pa'i thabs kyang ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa las kyang thob pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is not the method for obtaining that, and because it is possible to obtain it from an inferential cognition that is a conceptual thought.

original: don byed pa thob pa'i rang bzhin don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang don byas zin pa nyid kyis rtog pa dang ldan pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos las kyang zhar tsam du
analyzed: don byed pa thob pa'i rang bzhin don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang don byas zin pa nyid kyis rtog pa dang ldan pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir bstan bcos las kyang zhar tsam du
translated: The consciousness that appears to perform a function, which is the nature of having attained the performance of a function, is not to be analyzed by those who are endowed with thought and who seek the goal, because it has already performed its function.

original: dpyod pa yin gyi de'i don du ni bstan bcos ma yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa yin gyi de'i don du ni bstan bcos ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise does not analyze it incidentally,🔽but it is not a treatise for that purpose.

original: de'i phyir dngos po 'dzin pa nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po 'dzin pa nyid ni yang dag pa'i shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of things is not right knowledge,

original: 'on kyang de thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: but it is the means of attaining it.

original: gal te de ltar na yang mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i don ni thob par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na yang mngon sum gyis gzung ba'i don ni thob par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if that is so, the object apprehended by direct perception is not suitable to be attained,

original: skad cig ma nyid yi pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yi pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary.

original: rjes su dpag pas gzung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gzung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it apprehended by inference,

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhe na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du zhe na yin la /
translated: Thus, conceptual thought is the desire for a meaning that is a meaningless appearance.

original: rnam pa rtog pa rnams kyi yul yang zhen par byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa rtog pa rnams kyi yul yang zhen par byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: The object of conceptualization is also a conceptualized object.

original: rnam 'grel las /🔽nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las / nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //
translated: As it is said in the Pramānﬁ avārtika:🔽How can that which is not ascertained

original: de ni ji ltar de dag yul //🔽zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar de dag yul // zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: By the ascertained be its object?

original: sgro btags pa yang phyi rol gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: sgro btags pa yang phyi rol gyi dngos por yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: Superimposition does not exist as an external object.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kyis don byed pa gang zhig thob par byed ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kyis don byed pa gang zhig thob par byed ce na /
translated: Therefore, by means of the two valid cognitions, what object that functions is obtained?

original: 'jug pa na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jug pa na zhes gsungs so //
translated: When one engages in it.

original: tshad ma'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of valid cognition is twofold:

original: gzung ba ste so sor snang ba'i don dam pa'am /
analyzed: gzung ba ste so sor snang ba'i don dam pa'am /
translated: The object that is apprehended, that is, the individual appearance, is the ultimate object.

original: sgro btags pa dang zhen pa'i yul lo //🔽de dag las shes @9a * //
analyzed: sgro btags pa dang zhen pa'i yul lo // de dag las shes @9a * //
translated: The object of superimposition and conceptualization is the conventional object.

original: bas gang la 'jug pa'i yul de la /
analyzed: bas gang la 'jug pa'i yul de la /
translated: Among them, the object in which consciousness engages🔽is the object that is obtained.

original: thob pas mi slu ba yin gyi gzung ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pas mi slu ba yin gyi gzung ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not deceptive with respect to the apprehended object.

original: gnyi gas kyang dngos po nyid la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang dngos po nyid la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Both engage with the thing itself.

original: rnam par rtog pa de las ni dngos po nyid la 'jug go zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de las ni dngos po nyid la 'jug go zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is said that conceptualization engages with the thing itself.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul gyi dngos po thob par gnyi ga khyad par med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul gyi dngos po thob par gnyi ga khyad par med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between the two in terms of obtaining the object that is the object of engagement.

original: tshad ma gnyi ga dngos po'i yul can zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyi ga dngos po'i yul can zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Both valid cognitions are said to be “having a real object,” as will be explained.

original: ma bzung ba 'jug pa'i yul yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma bzung ba 'jug pa'i yul yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to the objection that if the object of engagement is not apprehended, there is a logical fallacy,

original: don yongs su bcad nas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don yongs su bcad nas zhes gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, “Having ascertained the object.”

original: 'dis sngar yongs su bcad pa la ltos nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis sngar yongs su bcad pa la ltos nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: This indicates that engagement depends on prior ascertainment.

original: nges pa dang 'jug pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa dang 'jug pa dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus it teaches that ascertainment and engagement are cause and effect.

original: des na don yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes pa nyid la 'jug par byed par brjod do //
analyzed: des na don yongs su gcod par byed pa'i shes pa nyid la 'jug par byed par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that ascertains the object is said to be the engagement.

original: gal te yongs su bcad pa'i don nyid 'jug pa'i yul yin gyi gang yang rung ba ma yin pa de ltar na de rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yongs su bcad pa'i don nyid 'jug pa'i yul yin gyi gang yang rung ba ma yin pa de ltar na de rigs pa yin te /
translated: If the object that is ascertained is the object of engagement and not just anything at all, then that is reasonable.

original: de'i phyir yongs su bcad pa ni 'jug pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su bcad pa ni 'jug pa'i yul yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of ascertainment is the object of engagement.

original: yongs su gcod par byed pa ni 'jug par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pa ni 'jug par byed pa nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascertainment is the engagement.

original: gang gi phyir shes pas skyes bu la gnas bzung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pas skyes bu la gnas bzung ste /
translated: Because the cognition, having been generated in the person,

original: 'ga' zhig tu 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: does not engage in any object whatsoever.

original: 'on kyang 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: But rather, it reveals the object of engagement.

original: de'i phyir yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin par rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su gcod par byed pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the ascertainment itself is the engagement.

original: yongs su gcod pa tsam 'jug par byed pa yin pa na yang /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa tsam 'jug par byed pa yin pa na yang /
translated: Even if the mere ascertainment is the engagement,

original: gang gis dang po 'jug pa'i yul bstan pa de nyid kyis gzhan la ltos pa med par skyes bu bcug pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i don la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dang po 'jug pa'i yul bstan pa de nyid kyis gzhan la ltos pa med par skyes bu bcug pa'i phyir rtogs pa'i don la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: since the very one who reveals the object of engagement at the outset engages the person without relying on another, the object of understanding is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te khong du chud pa las 'jug par byed pa nyid gzhan yin na ni gzhan gyis khong du chud pa la yang 'jug par byed pa gzhan tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te khong du chud pa las 'jug par byed pa nyid gzhan yin na ni gzhan gyis khong du chud pa la yang 'jug par byed pa gzhan tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If the engagement is different from the understanding, then the engagement of another person who understands would be a valid cognition.

original: thob par byed pa nyid ni 'jug par byed pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: thob par byed pa nyid ni 'jug par byed pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The act of obtaining is nothing other than the act of engaging.

original: gang gi phyir thob par byed pa'i shes pas don gyi yul du skyes bu gtong bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thob par byed pa'i shes pas don gyi yul du skyes bu gtong bar byed pa'am /
translated: Because the consciousness that obtains does not cause the object to be sent to the domain of the person,

original: skyes bu'i yul du don 'gugs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i yul du don 'gugs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: nor does it cause the person to be sent to the domain of the object.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu 'jug par byed @9b pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu 'jug par byed @9b pa yin no //
translated: However, it causes the person to engage.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa la 'jug par byed pa las thob par byed pa'i bya ba gzhan med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa la 'jug par byed pa las thob par byed pa'i bya ba gzhan med la /
translated: Because the act of obtaining is nothing other than the act of engaging the object in consciousness,

original: 'jug pa yang khong du chud pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang khong du chud pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: and engagement is nothing other than understanding.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma thams cad ni ma rtogs pa'i don can kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma thams cad ni ma rtogs pa'i don can kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore all valid knowledge has an object that is not understood.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dang po'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i skad cig ma nyid kyis don byed par nus pa'i dngos po'i rgyu na nges pas 'jug pa'i yul du byed par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dang po'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i skad cig ma nyid kyis don byed par nus pa'i dngos po'i rgyu na nges pas 'jug pa'i yul du byed par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: For that reason, the first moment of direct perception and inference is able to engage the object that is able to perform a function, because it is ascertained by the cause of a real thing.

original: de'i rgyun du gyur pa grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad ba phyi ma rnams tshad ma yin pas spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyun du gyur pa grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad ba phyi ma rnams tshad ma yin pas spangs pa yin no //
translated: and the subsequent cognitions that are of the same nature as the first one are valid cognitions.

original: yongs su bcad pa'i don 'dug pa'i yul thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: yongs su bcad pa'i don 'dug pa'i yul thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes smras pa na /
translated: If you say that a valid cognition is that which causes one to attain the object that is its object of engagement,

original: dung la ser por shes pa dang / nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag kyang tshad ma ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dung la ser por shes pa dang / nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa dang / shes pa'i rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag kyang tshad ma ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: then a cognition that perceives a conch as yellow, a cognition that perceives the luster of a jewel as a jewel, and other such cognitions would be valid cognitions.

original: de nges pas gzhan nges so zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nges pas gzhan nges so zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: You cannot say that one ascertains another object by ascertaining one object.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa tha dad pa yang gzhan kho na'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa tha dad pa yang gzhan kho na'o //
translated: Objects, times, and aspects that are different are different.

original: de dag kyang tha dad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag kyang tha dad par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are what make the difference.

original: gzhan du na tha dad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na tha dad pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no difference.

original: dkar po yang ser po las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: dkar po yang ser po las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: White is different from yellow.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las don byed par nus pa yang sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par kho na yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las don byed par nus pa yang sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par kho na yin par mthong ngo //
translated: And it is seen that only the particular, such as the blue, is capable of causal efficiency, both in the forward and reverse order.

original: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ngo bo nyid de nyid de nyid ni spyi'i chos su gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ngo bo nyid de nyid de nyid ni spyi'i chos su gnas pa yin la /
translated: The reason for the reverse order is that the very nature of the particular is the universal, and the universal is the nature of the particular.

original: don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi phyir ni yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi phyir ni yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: The reason for causal efficiency is existence,

original: gzhan du na don byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na don byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise causal efficiency is impossible.

original: de gzung ba na gzung bar gyur pa 'khrul pas ma nges pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de gzung ba na gzung bar gyur pa 'khrul pas ma nges pa ni tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: When it is apprehended, the apprehension is uncertain because of error, and it is ascertained by another valid cognition,

original: dper na dngos po'i skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dngos po'i skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the momentariness of things and so on are.

original: mang po rnams shes pa gcig la snang ba na ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs tshogs pa'i yul la rnam par gnas pa ni so sor snang ba'i chos yin gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir dkar po ma bzung na de'i chos sam gzhan gyi chos kyi
analyzed: mang po rnams shes pa gcig la snang ba na ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs tshogs pa'i yul la rnam par gnas pa ni so sor snang ba'i chos yin gyi dngos po'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir dkar po ma bzung na de'i chos sam gzhan gyi chos kyi
translated: Therefore, if white is not apprehended, the shape that is its property or the shape that is the property of another is not apprehended.

original: dbyibs ma bzung bas na slu ba yin pa'i phyir ser por shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs ma bzung bas na slu ba yin pa'i phyir ser por shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Since it is deceptive, the cognition of yellow is not valid knowledge.

original: don thob pa ni 'jug pa gzhan las yin par smra'o //
analyzed: don thob pa ni 'jug pa gzhan las yin par smra'o //
translated: Obtaining the object is asserted to be from another engagement.

original: 'jug par byed @10a * //
analyzed: 'jug par byed @10a * //
translated: The cognition that engages

original: pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i don thob par 'dod pa'i bya ba dang lhan cig pa'i blo ni 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i shes pas nye bar bstan pa'i don thob par 'dod pa'i bya ba dang lhan cig pa'i blo ni 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The cognition that engages is the cognition that is concurrent with the action of desiring to obtain the object that is indicated by the engaging cognition.

original: de ni yod dam med kyang rung ste nges par byas pa'i dngos po de nyid la mthar thug pa'i phyir sngon po'i shes pa ni sngon du 'gro ba'i 'jug pa ni rnam pa gzhan thob pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod dam med kyang rung ste nges par byas pa'i dngos po de nyid la mthar thug pa'i phyir sngon po'i shes pa ni sngon du 'gro ba'i 'jug pa ni rnam pa gzhan thob pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: Whether that exists or not, the cognition of blue is not the cause of obtaining a different aspect because it definitely ascertains that very thing that was previously ascertained.

original: 'thob pa ni shes pa gzhan kho na las yin te /
analyzed: 'thob pa ni shes pa gzhan kho na las yin te /
translated: Obtaining is by other consciousnesses alone.

original: tha na reg bya 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tha na reg bya 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: At the least, it is by one that apprehends tactile objects.

original: nges pa 'thob pa ni nges pa'i yul la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges pa 'thob pa ni nges pa'i yul la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Obtaining ascertainment is mistaken with regard to the object of ascertainment,

original: dper na chu'i shes pa las smig rgyu'i shes pa yin zhing /
analyzed: dper na chu'i shes pa las smig rgyu'i shes pa yin zhing /
translated: just as the consciousness of water is mistaken for the consciousness of a mirage.

original: des na de nyid nges par 'thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid nges par 'thob pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is like obtaining ascertainment of that.

original: de bzhin du yul tha dad pa'i nor bu thob pa ni 'jug pa gzhan kho na las yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul tha dad pa'i nor bu thob pa ni 'jug pa gzhan kho na las yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that obtaining a gem of a different object is by another engagement.

original: 'di rgyas par ni tshad ma brtag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rgyas par ni tshad ma brtag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be seen in detail in the Investigation of Valid Cognition.

original: de ltar na yongs su bcad pa'i 'jug pa'i yul thob par byed pas yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid du 'di gnyi ga bye brag med do //
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su bcad pa'i 'jug pa'i yul thob par byed pas yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid du 'di gnyi ga bye brag med do //
translated: Thus, these two are not distinguished as valid knowledge because they obtain the object of engagement of determination.

original: de ltar na ni ci zhig ltar 'jug pa'i yul thob par mi byed pa gang yin pa de tshad ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na ni ci zhig ltar 'jug pa'i yul thob par mi byed pa gang yin pa de tshad ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then whatever does not obtain the object of engagement in any way would be valid knowledge.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin pas gang gi phyir tshad ma'i bya ba ni 'jug pa'i yul ston pa tsam yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin pas gang gi phyir tshad ma'i bya ba ni 'jug pa'i yul ston pa tsam yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the function of valid knowledge is merely to reveal the engaged object,

original: bden te ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir gcig tu don thob pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa phyi ma ni snga ma'i yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir gcig tu don thob pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa phyi ma ni snga ma'i yang dag pa'i shes pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: that is true, but the subsequent cognition that has the nature of attaining the object is not the valid knowledge of the prior cognition, because it is not of the same nature.

original: 'on kyang thob par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang thob par nus pa nyid do //
translated: However, it is capable of attaining.

original: de'ang thob par bya ba'i don las bdag nyid thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin pa'i phyir 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang don thob par rung ba yod bas na de la'ang tshad ma kho na'o //
analyzed: de'ang thob par bya ba'i don las bdag nyid thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin pa'i phyir 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang don thob par rung ba yod bas na de la'ang tshad ma kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is the cause of attaining the object that is to be attained, it is not engaging, but since it is suitable to attain the object, it is also valid knowledge.

original: nus pa nges pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang don byed par snang ba'i mngon sum ni rang kho na las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nus pa nges pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang don byed par snang ba'i mngon sum ni rang kho na las 'gyur ro //
translated: The ascertainment of capability is from inference and from the perception of functioning.

original: 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum yang la la ni rang kho na las te /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum yang la la ni rang kho na las te /
translated: The perception that engages is from itself in some cases.

original: 'khrul pa'i dogs pa mtha' dag bsal nas rang bzhin gyi khyad par khong du chud pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dogs pa mtha' dag bsal nas rang bzhin gyi khyad par khong du chud pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Having cleared away all doubts about error, one understands the distinction of the nature of things.

original: 'di ltar sgron mas gsal bar byas pa na sngon po yang dmar po nyid dang / mig ser gyis nyams pas dkar po yang ser po dang / thag ring po nas chung du yang chen po dang / gnyid kyis thams cad kyang phyin ci log tu @10b mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgron mas gsal bar byas pa na sngon po yang dmar po nyid dang / mig ser gyis nyams pas dkar po yang ser po dang / thag ring po nas chung du yang chen po dang / gnyid kyis thams cad kyang phyin ci log tu @10b mthong ste /
translated: Thus, when something is illuminated by a lamp, blue is not red, white is not yellow when impaired by jaundice, small is not large at a distance, and everything is seen incorrectly in a dream.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig rmi lam la sogs pas shes pa ma bsnyad pa dang / yul nye ba dang / gsal byed mi mthun pa ma yin pas dngos po gzung ba ni de'i rang bzhin myong ba nyid kyis don bden par nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig rmi lam la sogs pas shes pa ma bsnyad pa dang / yul nye ba dang / gsal byed mi mthun pa ma yin pas dngos po gzung ba ni de'i rang bzhin myong ba nyid kyis don bden par nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when an object is apprehended by a cognition that is not impaired by any of these, by being close to the object and by not being impaired by a cause of error, it is ascertained as a true object by the experience of its nature itself.

original: de lta bur gyur ba ni 'khrul pa med par lan cig ma yin par mthong nas tha snyad goms pa la mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba ni 'khrul pa med par lan cig ma yin par mthong nas tha snyad goms pa la mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is seen repeatedly without error and is designated by the convention of familiarity.

original: des na rang gi ngo bo las don med na mi 'byung bar grub pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bo las don med na mi 'byung bar grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the effect does not occur without the cause.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin dang chos mthun pa las de ltar rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin dang chos mthun pa las de ltar rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference that understands that way through similarity of nature with the prior cause,

original: don lkog tu ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don lkog tu ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: because the object is not hidden.

original: nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i gzugs rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i gzugs rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the understanding of the form of a jewel, silver, and so on.

original: de bzhin du me dang 'brel pa shes pa'i me ma mthong bar du ba la me'i 'bras bur rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du me dang 'brel pa shes pa'i me ma mthong bar du ba la me'i 'bras bur rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the understanding that smoke is the effect of fire when fire is not seen in connection with fire is not inference.

original: gang yang rjes su dpag par bya ba las ma 'das so zhes bya ba de ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i blo'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su dpag par bya ba las ma 'das so zhes bya ba de ni rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i blo'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: Also, the statement that it is not beyond being an object of inference is made from the perspective of a mind that does not experience it in one’s own and others’ continuums.

original: yul nyams su myong ba las ma rtogs pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba las ma rtogs pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said that it is not understood from the experience of the object.

original: gang yang rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: gang yang rnam 'grel las /
translated: Also, Dharmakīrti’s Commentary on Dignāga’s “Compendium on Valid Knowledge” says:

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa las the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de ni dogs par 'gyur ba'i yul gyi shes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa las the tshom du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de ni dogs par 'gyur ba'i yul gyi shes pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement that doubt arises from a similar aspect is explained from the perspective of the cognition of the object of doubt, not from every perspective.

original: la la ni don med na mi 'byung ba gzhan las nges par byed do //
analyzed: la la ni don med na mi 'byung ba gzhan las nges par byed do //
translated: Some ascertain from another that the object does not occur without it.

original: gang gis na med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za ba /
analyzed: gang gis na med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za ba /
translated: How could there be doubt that it does not occur without it?

original: don mi nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: don mi nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ba /
translated: Because the object is not ascertained, it would not be a valid cognition.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa med na mi 'byung ba'i don mthong bas nges pa tshad ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa med na mi 'byung ba'i don mthong bas nges pa tshad ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as seeing an object that does not occur without inference is a valid cognition that ascertains it,

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang bdag nyid don med na mi 'byung bar nges par byed pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang bdag nyid don med na mi 'byung bar nges par byed pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: direct valid cognition is not ascertained from the perspective of its own object not occurring without it.

original: 'on kyang snang ba nges par byed pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba nges par byed pa las yin no //
translated: However, it is ascertained from the perspective of the appearance.

original: don thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: don thob par byed pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: The valid cognition that obtains the object

original: de yang 'jug par byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jug par byed pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: is that which engages it, not anything else.

original: 'jug par byed pa yang 'jug pa'i yul ston pa nyid yin par brjod do /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yang 'jug pa'i yul ston pa nyid yin par brjod do /
translated: And the initiator is said to be the one that reveals the object of engagement.

original: des na snang ba nges par byas pa ni bstan pa yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul la tshad ma'i bya ba yongs @11a * //🔽su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na snang ba nges par byas pa ni bstan pa yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul la tshad ma'i bya ba yongs @11a * // su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the ascertainment of the appearance is the teaching, the activity of the valid knowledge is completely finished with regard to the object of engagement.

original: gang yang snang ba dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa nges pas gnod pa bskyed pa de ni tshad ma'i bya ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang snang ba dang 'gal ba'i rnam pa nges pas gnod pa bskyed pa de ni tshad ma'i bya ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: And that which generates a contradiction by ascertaining a form that is contrary to the appearance is not a valid knowledge because the activity of the valid knowledge is not complete.

original: dper na smig rgyu 'dzin pa'i shes pa la chur nges pas 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu 'dzin pa'i shes pa la chur nges pas 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition apprehending a mirage that engages by ascertaining it to be water.

original: med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za bas ni nam yang mngon sum gyi bya ba la gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za bas ni nam yang mngon sum gyi bya ba la gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: And when there is doubt about the invariable concomitance, it never contradicts the activity of perception.

original: 'ga' zhig yod par zhen par byas pa'i yul can ci me 'di ba bden nam 'on te ma yin zhes med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za ba 'di la yang /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig yod par zhen par byas pa'i yul can ci me 'di ba bden nam 'on te ma yin zhes med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za ba 'di la yang /
translated: And even in the case of the doubt about the invariable concomitance in the case of the subject that is ascertained to exist, “Is this fire that exists true or not?”

original: bdag nyid thams cad gzhan las tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad gzhan las tshad ma yin no //
translated: it is a valid knowledge in all cases with regard to the other.

original: yang 'ga' zhig lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan ba la sogs pa'i spyi shes pa la khyad par gyi yul la the tshom za ba dper na ci 'di dha ba'am 'on te pa la sha zhes bya ba lta bu de la yang spyi ni rang las yin
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan ba la sogs pa'i spyi shes pa la khyad par gyi yul la the tshom za ba dper na ci 'di dha ba'am 'on te pa la sha zhes bya ba lta bu de la yang spyi ni rang las yin
translated: Also, some who know the universals of possessing leaves and so on doubt the specific object, for example, thinking, “Is this a dhava tree or a palasha tree?”

original: la / khyad par ni gzhan las yin te /
analyzed: la / khyad par ni gzhan las yin te /
translated: The universal is in the self-isolate and the specific is in the other-isolate.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis don byed pa'i dngos po bzung nas shing ngo zhes nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis don byed pa'i dngos po bzung nas shing ngo zhes nges pa yin la /
translated: Because having apprehended the object that performs a function by means of direct perception, one ascertains it to be a tree.

original: don byed par nus pa yang khyad par yin te /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa yang khyad par yin te /
translated: And that which is able to perform a function is a specific tree.

original: des na 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa'i shing gi rang bzhin ni khyad par nyid yin pas /
analyzed: des na 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa'i shing gi rang bzhin ni khyad par nyid yin pas /
translated: Therefore the nature of a tree that is the object of engagement is a specific tree.

original: de la yang 'jug par byed pa ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la yang 'jug par byed pa ni de nyid yin no //
translated: And that which engages it is a specific tree.

original: de'i shing sha ba nyid kyi khyad par med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ni gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: de'i shing sha ba nyid kyi khyad par med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ni gzhan las yin no //
translated: The ascertainment that the specific tree is a dhava tree is from another.

original: ji ltar thun mong du gyur pa'i shing nyid ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid kho nas don byed pa yin pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i thun mong ba skad cig ma nyid kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar thun mong du gyur pa'i shing nyid ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid kho nas don byed pa yin pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i thun mong ba skad cig ma nyid kyang /
translated: Just as wood that is shared in common performs a function by virtue of its specific nature, so too, the shared, momentary nature of blue and so on is also the basis of the imputation of the term “blue.”

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis don byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis don byed pa yin no //
translated: Just as a tree that is common to all is functional only by virtue of its particularities, so too, the commonness of “momentariness” in blue and so on is functional by virtue of the nature of blue and so on.

original: de nas gal te mngon sum gyis skad cig ma nyid gzung ba ma yin na ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyi mthar thug bas de la tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas gal te mngon sum gyis skad cig ma nyid gzung ba ma yin na ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyi mthar thug bas de la tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: If direct perception does not apprehend momentariness, then it would be valid knowledge in regard to the final nature of blue and so on,

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyis don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyid kyis don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because blue and so on are functional.

original: khyad par 'dzin pa ni sngon po la sogs pa don byed pa mthong ba na thun mong du gyur pa skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa nges pa ma yin pa de'i mthar thug pas tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par 'dzin pa ni sngon po la sogs pa don byed pa mthong ba na thun mong du gyur pa skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa nges pa ma yin pa de'i mthar thug pas tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: If it apprehends the particularities, then it is not valid knowledge in regard to the final nature of blue and so on, because it is not ascertained in regard to the commonness of momentariness and so on, which are seen to be functional in blue and so on.

original: mthong ba'i dngos po la sogs pa kho nas don byed pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dngos po la sogs pa kho nas don byed pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function is complete just by seeing the entity and so on.

original: de'i phyir spyi'i ngo bos don bya ba byed pa gzung ba nas khyad par gyi mthar thug pa ni tshad ma nyid gzhan las nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi'i ngo bos don bya ba byed pa gzung ba nas khyad par gyi mthar thug pa ni tshad ma nyid gzhan las nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the performance of a function by a universal is apprehended, and the ultimate particular is ascertained by another valid cognition.

original: @11b khyad par gzung ba na yang so sor snang ba'i stobs kyis spyi nges na ni de la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: @11b khyad par gzung ba na yang so sor snang ba'i stobs kyis spyi nges na ni de la tshad ma yin te /
translated: Even when a particular is apprehended, if a universal is ascertained by the power of the appearance of the particular, then that is a valid cognition.

original: dper na shing nyid la shing sha pa 'dzin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na shing nyid la shing sha pa 'dzin pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like apprehending a particular tree as a tree,

original: gzhan du ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a valid cognition in any other case.

original: skad cig ma nyid ni de ltar khyad par ma yin zhing /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ni de ltar khyad par ma yin zhing /
translated: Momentary existence is not like that, it is not a particular,

original: khyad par snang ba las nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par snang ba las nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not ascertained from the appearance of a particular.

original: de'i phyir de 'dra ba ni tshad ma gzhan kho nas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dra ba ni tshad ma gzhan kho nas sgrub par byed do //
translated: Therefore, such a thing is established by another valid cognition.

original: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa lhan cig rgyu ba tha dad pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa lhan cig rgyu ba tha dad pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the simultaneous and different contact and so on.

original: don byed pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig las nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig las nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained from a cognition that performs a function alone.

original: 'on kyang med na mi 'byung ba'i don 'ga' zhig mthong ba las kyang yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang med na mi 'byung ba'i don 'ga' zhig mthong ba las kyang yin no //
translated: However, it is also the case that some things are seen to be invariably related.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i the tshom ni thams cad kyang snang ba'i rang bzhin nges pa'i 'og rol du yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i the tshom ni thams cad kyang snang ba'i rang bzhin nges pa'i 'og rol du yin te /
translated: This kind of doubt is in all cases subsequent to the ascertainment of the nature of appearance.

original: de ma nges na yul de la 'dzin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma nges na yul de la 'dzin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if that is not ascertained, it is not possible to apprehend that object.

original: de'i phyir the tshom ni mngon sum gyi bya ba nges pa la yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom ni mngon sum gyi bya ba nges pa la yin te /
translated: Therefore, doubt is with regard to the ascertainment of the activity of perception.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: Dharmakīrti’s Exposition of Valid Knowledge says,

original: mngon sum gyi bzung ba dang ma bzung ba ni snang ba'i dbang gis yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi bzung ba dang ma bzung ba ni snang ba'i dbang gis yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: “The apprehension and nonapprehension by perception is due to the power of appearance.”

original: snang ba yang rang nyid nges pa'i rang bzhin de kho na bzhin du nges pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba'i the tshom ni phyi nas 'byung bas mngon sum gyi bya ba mi 'gog go //
analyzed: snang ba yang rang nyid nges pa'i rang bzhin de kho na bzhin du nges pa'i phyir med na mi 'byung ba'i the tshom ni phyi nas 'byung bas mngon sum gyi bya ba mi 'gog go //
translated: And appearance is ascertained in just that way, as having the nature of ascertainment. Therefore, since doubt that is invariably related to that arises later, the activity of perception is not blocked.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don bzhin du rang nyid las nyams su myong ba nges pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo la yang mngon sum de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don bzhin du rang nyid las nyams su myong ba nges pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo la yang mngon sum de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when there is no self-experience of the object, which is the nature of the object, then the nature of direct perception is that it is a valid cognition.

original: gzhan las ni phyis 'byung ba'i the tshom sel ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: gzhan las ni phyis 'byung ba'i the tshom sel ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: But when there is another [cognition], it is only the subsequent arising of a cognition that removes doubt.

original: 'di ltar shes pa phyi ma gang yin pa des ni shes pa snga ma 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa phyi ma gang yin pa des ni shes pa snga ma 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the later cognition does not apprehend the earlier cognition.

original: rtags kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a reason,

original: de skyes pa tsam gyis the tshom sel ba'i phyir dang / khyab pa dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyes pa tsam gyis the tshom sel ba'i phyir dang / khyab pa dran pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere arising of that [later cognition] removes doubt, and because there is no recollection of the pervasion.

original: gzhan du na nyams su myong ba'i yul gyi shes pa'i gsal ba shes pa phyi mas tshad mar rjes su dpag ba'i phyir yul nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs pa zhes mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyams su myong ba'i yul gyi shes pa'i gsal ba shes pa phyi mas tshad mar rjes su dpag ba'i phyir yul nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs pa zhes mi gsung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, because the clarity of the cognition of the object of experience would be inferred by the later cognition, he would not say except for the experience of the object.

original: de'i phyir snang ba nges pas mngon sum gyi bya ba rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba nges pas mngon sum gyi bya ba rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the function of direct perception is complete through the ascertainment of the appearance.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis yul rnam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis yul rnam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
translated: Conceptual thought does not posit objects by the power of appearance,

original: 'on kyang nges pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: but rather by the power of ascertainment.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says:

original: nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //🔽zhes @12a * //🔽bstan to // de la rtags med pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang // zhes @12a * // bstan to // de la rtags med pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni /
translated: Ascertainment is not non-ascertainment.

original: nges par byed pa med pa'i phyir gzhan du dogs pa ma bzlog pas the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: nges par byed pa med pa'i phyir gzhan du dogs pa ma bzlog pas the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Thus, all conceptual thoughts that are not based on evidence are uncertain, because they do not eliminate doubt about the possibility of otherness.

original: de yang ma nges par don yod par zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang ma nges par don yod par zhen pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, they are not ascertainment, because they are adherence to the existence of an object that is not ascertained.

original: de 'dra ba'i don yang med pas thob par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i don yang med pas thob par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And since there is no object that is such, they do not bring about attainment.

original: rtags las skyes pa ni dngos po'am dngos po med pa gcig tu nges par ston pa yin la /
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa ni dngos po'am dngos po med pa gcig tu nges par ston pa yin la /
translated: Those that arise from evidence show either an existent or a nonexistent thing with certainty.

original: de yang thob par nus pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma'i bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba mthong ba las thob par bya ba'i don bstan pa yin zhing mngon sum gyi bya ba ni snang ba nges par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang thob par nus pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i tshad ma'i bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba mthong ba las thob par bya ba'i don bstan pa yin zhing mngon sum gyi bya ba ni snang ba nges par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is possible to obtain it. Therefore, the function of conceptual valid knowledge is to teach the object to be obtained from seeing the invariable concomitance, and the function of direct perception is to ascertain the appearance.

original: the tshom ni de'i bya ba dang 'gal ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: the tshom ni de'i bya ba dang 'gal ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Doubt is not incompatible with its function,

original: 'on kyang sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: but it is superimposition.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: As Dharmakīrti’s Exposition of Valid Knowledge says:

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis //
translated: If, due to the reason of error,

original: yon tan gzhan sbyor mi byed na //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan sbyor mi byed na //
translated: one does not apply other qualities,

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: that is what is explained.

original: des na goms pa ma yin pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa de ni ma 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: des na goms pa ma yin pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa de ni ma 'brel ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, what was explained, that “one who is not habituated does not engage in valid knowledge,” is unrelated,

original: tshad mar ma nges pa las zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad mar ma nges pa las zhes brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: because it should be said, “from that which is not ascertained as valid knowledge.”

original: gang du gzhan las tshad ma yin pa de la 'jug pa dang gnyis phan tshun bstan pa'i nyes pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du gzhan las tshad ma yin pa de la 'jug pa dang gnyis phan tshun bstan pa'i nyes pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The fault of mutual contradiction in the explanation does not exist in the case of engaging in that which is valid knowledge from another.

original: the tshom las kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang yang nye ba'i dngos pa la mi slu ba las dbang po skyon med par nges shing //
analyzed: the tshom las kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro // gang yang nye ba'i dngos pa la mi slu ba las dbang po skyon med par nges shing //
translated: because one engages in it even with doubt.🔽And it is not so that one engages in it only after ascertaining the valid cognition of the sense faculty, which is nondeceptive with regard to the object at hand.

original: des na tshad ma nyid du nges pa kho na 'jug pa yin no zhes brjod pa de ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des na tshad ma nyid du nges pa kho na 'jug pa yin no zhes brjod pa de ni yang dag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because that is not so,

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i dus na yang nam mkha' dri ma med pa la sogs pa la mi slu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i dus na yang nam mkha' dri ma med pa la sogs pa la mi slu ba'i phyir te /
translated: because even when there is the appearance of two moons, the sky is nondeceptive and so on.

original: yul nges pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nges pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is ascertained, there is error.

original: gang yang 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa la rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid dang / pha rol dang rnam par shes par smra ba dag la yang tshad ma khyad par med par brjod ba'i don du /
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa la rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid dang / pha rol dang rnam par shes par smra ba dag la yang tshad ma khyad par med par brjod ba'i don du /
translated: And it is not so that the statement “Having ascertained the object” is made in order to indicate that inference is valid cognition for the Lokāyata and that there is no difference in valid cognition for the proponents of external objects and consciousness.

original: 'di dag gis don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag gnyi ga yang ma 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis don yongs su bcad nas zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag gnyi ga yang ma 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Because both of those are unrelated.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dang rnam par shes par smra ba'i dbang du byas pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa dang rnam par shes par smra ba'i dbang du byas pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The discussion of the Lokayata and the Vijñanavada will be explained later.🔽In this chapter, whatever is explained should not be applied to the Vijñanavada,

original: rab tu byed ba 'dir gang cung zad bshad pa de thams cad rnam par shes par @12b smra ba la yang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byed ba 'dir gang cung zad bshad pa de thams cad rnam par shes par @12b smra ba la yang sbyar bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: because it is not in accord with the Vijñanavada,🔽such as the following:

original: don gyi mthu yis ni /
analyzed: don gyi mthu yis ni /
translated: “Because of the power of the object,

original: yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro //🔽zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par shes par smra ba'i tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam pa gnyis zhes grangs nges pa ma bzod nas gal te zhes smras te /
analyzed: yang dag skye ba yin phyir ro // zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par shes par smra ba'i tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa gnyis zhes grangs nges pa ma bzod nas gal te zhes smras te /
translated: there is correct arising.”

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yang khas blang ba'o //🔽sgras bskyed pa lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa ni sgra'i tshad ma ste /🔽mngon sum don min dngos po la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yang khas blang ba'o // sgras bskyed pa lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can gyi shes pa ni sgra'i tshad ma ste / mngon sum don min dngos po la /
translated: If one cannot accept the definite number of two, then one might say, “What if there were another valid cognition besides direct perception and inference?”🔽A cognition that has as its object an obscure object generated by a word is a valid cognition of verbal testimony.

original: sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa gang //
analyzed: sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa gang //
translated: A cognition that arises from a word is not direct perception with regard to a thing.

original: zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la 'dra bar yongs su gcod pa yang nye bar 'jal ba ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la 'dra bar yongs su gcod pa yang nye bar 'jal ba ste /
translated: Analogy is the determination of a similar object through a hidden object.

original: dper na ba man mthong ba las srog chags 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang ngo zhes lkog tu gyur pa'i ba lang la 'dra bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dper na ba man mthong ba las srog chags 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang ngo zhes lkog tu gyur pa'i ba lang la 'dra bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: For example, having seen a gavaya, one grasps the similarity of a hidden cow through the statement, “A cow is like this animal.”

original: sogs pa smos pas ni don gyis go ba dang / dngos po med pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni don gyis go ba dang / dngos po med pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes inference and non-existence.

original: sgra la sogs pa 'di dag ni gzhal du khong du chud pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa 'di dag ni gzhal du khong du chud pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin na /
translated: If these, sound and so on, are valid cognitions because they cause understanding,

original: nges pa de gang las she na /
analyzed: nges pa de gang las she na /
translated: then what is the certainty from which they arise?

original: tshad ma zhes smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma zhes smos te /
translated: The phrase “valid cognition” is stated.

original: kho bo cag sgra'am nye bar 'jal ba zhes bya ba'i ming la ni rtsod bar mi byed do //
analyzed: kho bo cag sgra'am nye bar 'jal ba zhes bya ba'i ming la ni rtsod bar mi byed do //
translated: We do not argue about the names “sound” or “analogy.”

original: 'di dag gi nang na yang tshad ma yin pa ni 'di gnyis kho na'i nang du 'du la /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nang na yang tshad ma yin pa ni 'di gnyis kho na'i nang du 'du la /
translated: Among these, only these two are valid cognitions.

original: gang yang nang du mi 'du ba de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang nang du mi 'du ba de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not included in these two is not a valid cognition.

original: des na tshad ma rnam gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: des na tshad ma rnam gnyis kho na'o //
translated: Therefore there are only two valid cognitions.

original: ci ltar bstan pa'i don thob par byed pa'i skyes bu mi slu bar byed pa ni tshad ma zhes grags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar bstan pa'i don thob par byed pa'i skyes bu mi slu bar byed pa ni tshad ma zhes grags pa de bzhin du /
translated: The person who causes one to attain the object that is taught is known as a valid person.

original: shes pa yang bstan pa'i don thob par byed pa mi slu ba ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yang bstan pa'i don thob par byed pa mi slu ba ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, consciousness is valid knowledge because it causes one to attain the object that is taught without deception.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa yang mi slu ba nyid la brjod de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa yang mi slu ba nyid la brjod de /
translated: Also, right knowledge is said to be nondeceptive.

original: des na tha dad pa med pas yang dag pa'i shes pa'i skabs su tshad ma zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa med pas yang dag pa'i shes pa'i skabs su tshad ma zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since there is no difference, valid knowledge is explained in the context of right knowledge.

original: de ni 'di ltar gzhan yin na ni tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzhan yin na ni tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: If it were like that, it would not be valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma yin na yang gzhan ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yin na yang gzhan ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa yin no //
translated: If it is valid knowledge, it is not like that.

original: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa ni tshad mar brjod la /
analyzed: gzhal bya'i rang bzhin yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa ni tshad mar brjod la /
translated: That which causes one to attain the thing that is the determination of the nature of the object of comprehension is called valid knowledge.

original: gzhal bya yang tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir tshad ma la yul dang ldan pas khyab po //
analyzed: gzhal bya yang tshad ma'i yul yin pa'i phyir tshad ma la yul dang ldan pas khyab po //
translated: Also, since the object of comprehension is the object of valid knowledge, valid knowledge is necessarily endowed with an object.

original: des na gang yul dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni tshad ma ma @13a * //
analyzed: des na gang yul dang ldan pa ma yin pa de ni tshad ma ma @13a * //
translated: Therefore, that which is not endowed with an object is not valid knowledge.

original: yin te / dper na nam mkha'i autpala bzhin no //
analyzed: yin te / dper na nam mkha'i autpala bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a sky-lotus.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las gzhan pa'i shes pa yang yul dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las gzhan pa'i shes pa yang yul dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa med pa'o //
translated: And there is no other cognition apart from perception and inference that has an object. This is the absence of the pervader.

original: de bzhin du tshad ma'i dbye ba ni yul gyi dbye ba las yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshad ma'i dbye ba ni yul gyi dbye ba las yin te /
translated: Similarly, the division of valid cognition is due to the division of objects.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma'i dbye ba ni rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma'i dbye ba ni rgyu mtshan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because the division of valid cognition is based on reasons.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa nyid na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa nyid na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were no reasons, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir pha rol gyis kyang tshad ma rnams ni yul gyi dbye ba las brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir pha rol gyis kyang tshad ma rnams ni yul gyi dbye ba las brten pa yin no //
translated: And because another reason is not tenable, the opponent also accepts that the valid cognitions are based on the division of objects.

original: yul la ltos nas kyang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul la ltos nas kyang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And because of being valid or invalid in relation to the object,

original: yul la ltos pa kho nas de dbye bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yul la ltos pa kho nas de dbye bar bya ba yin no //
translated: it is to be divided only in relation to the object.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma'i dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan ni yul gyi dbye ba tsam yin pa'i phyir de'i dbye bas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma'i dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan ni yul gyi dbye ba tsam yin pa'i phyir de'i dbye bas khyab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason for the division of valid cognitions is merely the division of objects, and so the division of valid cognitions is pervaded by that.

original: des na gang zhig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i don las tha dad pa'i yul can ma yin pa de ni de dag las gzhan pa'i tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gang zhig mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i don las tha dad pa'i yul can ma yin pa de ni de dag las gzhan pa'i tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which is not a subject that is different from the objects of perception and inference is not a valid cognition that is different from those two.

original: dper na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de dag nyid mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gzhan las sam /
analyzed: dper na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de dag nyid mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gzhan las sam /
translated: For example, those two, perception and inference, are not different from other perceptions and inferences.

original: dper na 'khrul pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'khrul pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a mistaken consciousness.

original: tshad ma la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don las tha dad pa'i gzhal bya yod ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don las tha dad pa'i gzhal bya yod ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: Also, with regard to valid cognitions, there is no object of comprehension that is different from the objects of perception and inference.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir gzung ba'i yul gyi dbang du byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir gzung ba'i yul gyi dbang du byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because here it is not from the perspective of the object that is apprehended.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object of inference.

original: 'jug pa'i yul yang yod pa dang med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul yang yod pa dang med pa'o //
translated: The object of engagement is both existent and nonexistent.

original: de las gang thob bar nus pa'i yod pa de nyid tshad ma'i khyab par byed par nye bar gnas pa'i yul du 'dod do //
analyzed: de las gang thob bar nus pa'i yod pa de nyid tshad ma'i khyab par byed par nye bar gnas pa'i yul du 'dod do //
translated: That which is capable of obtaining an existent is the object that is the pervader of the valid cognition.

original: mi dmigs pa yang med pa sgrub par byed pa ni dgag par bya bas stong ba'i sa phyogs la sogs pas bsdus pa thob par bya ba nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang med pa sgrub par byed pa ni dgag par bya bas stong ba'i sa phyogs la sogs pas bsdus pa thob par bya ba nyid ston par byed do //
translated: Nonobservation is also the proof of nonexistence, which is the object to be obtained, such as the place devoid of the object of negation.

original: med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yang tha snyad du rung ba yin pa'i phyir thob par bya ba'i yul nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yang tha snyad du rung ba yin pa'i phyir thob par bya ba'i yul nyid do //
translated: The proof of the term nonexistence is also the object to be obtained, because it is suitable as a convention.

original: gang yang mngon sum ma yin pa ste /🔽thob par nus pa'i yul mngon sum ma yin pa'i don de ni 'dra ba'i bdag tu ste /
analyzed: gang yang mngon sum ma yin pa ste / thob par nus pa'i yul mngon sum ma yin pa'i don de ni 'dra ba'i bdag tu ste /
translated: That which is not direct perception🔽is the object that is capable of being obtained but is not a direct object. It is understood by means of the mode of the similar nature,

original: dpe la mthong ba @13b dang thun mong du rtags kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis rtogs la de yang 'grel pa gzhan las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dpe la mthong ba @13b dang thun mong du rtags kyis rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis rtogs la de yang 'grel pa gzhan las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: which is the commonality of seeing the example. This is also found in another commentary.

original: rtogs phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: rtogs phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: Because of understanding is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i don de rnam pa gcig nyid du spyi'i tshul nyid kyis rtogs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i don de rnam pa gcig nyid du spyi'i tshul nyid kyis rtogs la /
translated: Because that object which is not directly perceived is understood as a single aspect by the mode of generality.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: And that is inference.

original: de'i phyir yul gzhan med pas yul can gyi tshad ma yang gzhan med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gzhan med pas yul can gyi tshad ma yang gzhan med de /
translated: Therefore, since there is no other object, there is no other valid cognition as subject.

original: des na gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs grub pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na'o //
translated: Thus, because the reason is established, there are only two valid cognitions.

original: gal te 'di snyam du de lta na yang don gang zhig rnam pa du mar rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni yul gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du de lta na yang don gang zhig rnam pa du mar rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni yul gzhan yin la /
translated: If you think that even so, the object which is understood in many aspects is another object,

original: gzhan gyi yul can yang tshad ma nyid yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul can yang tshad ma nyid yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: and the subject of another is also valid cognition,

original: don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'o zhes smos so //
translated: it is said that the object is twofold: directly perceived and hidden.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i don ni mngon sum nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i don ni mngon sum nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that since direct perception and non-direct perception are mutually exclusive, an object other than non-direct perception is direct perception itself.

original: gang cung zad mngon sum ma yin pa de kho na tshad ma'i yul nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang cung zad mngon sum ma yin pa de kho na tshad ma'i yul nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is not direct perception is not the object of valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang don byed par nus pa'i lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du mngon sum ma yin pa'i sgra'i don lkog tu gyur par brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang don byed par nus pa'i lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du mngon sum ma yin pa'i sgra'i don lkog tu gyur par brjod do //
translated: However, in order to indicate that it is a hidden object that is able to perform a function, the term “not direct perception” is used.

original: mdo las ni gang mngon sum ma yin pa de ni mngon sum nyid do zhes phan tshun spangs te gnas par brjod pa'i don du mngon sum ma yin pa zhes smos so //🔽'di snyam du rnam pa du mar rtogs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: mdo las ni gang mngon sum ma yin pa de ni mngon sum nyid do zhes phan tshun spangs te gnas par brjod pa'i don du mngon sum ma yin pa zhes smos so // 'di snyam du rnam pa du mar rtogs par 'gyur ba /
translated: In the sūtra, the term “not direct perception” is used in order to state that which is mutually exclusive, namely, “that which is not direct perception is direct perception itself.”

original: mngon sum gang yin pa nyid la tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum gang yin pa nyid la tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Fearing that one might think that there is room for another valid cognition in regard to that which is direct perception,

original: mngon sum gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nges par bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nges par bstan pa'i phyir de la zhes smos te /
translated: in order to indicate the ascertained aspect of the apprehension of direct perception, it says “in regard to that.”

original: shes pa'i snang ba bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mthun pa rtogs par byed pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i snang ba bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mthun pa rtogs par byed pa'i don gang yin pa de ni mngon sum mo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of “realizing” is that the appearance of consciousness conforms with the presence or absence of the object.

original: 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam ni shes pa'i snang ba gang zhig yod pa dang / med ba dag gi rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tsam ni shes pa'i snang ba gang zhig yod pa dang / med ba dag gi rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the mere fact of cause and effect is understood by the mere fact that the appearance of consciousness conforms with the presence or absence of the object.

original: rjes su mthun par byed pa zhes sbyor bar byed pa po'i don brjod pa ni rgyu du ma nyid na yang so sor snang ba gang gi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa @14a * //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par byed pa zhes sbyor bar byed pa po'i don brjod pa ni rgyu du ma nyid na yang so sor snang ba gang gi gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa @14a * //
translated: The meaning of “conforming” is expressed by the one who applies it. Even if there are many causes, the one who applies it is the one who has the appearance of each one.

original: de mngon sum yin no zhes ci nas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum yin no zhes ci nas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is direct perception because it is understood that it is dependent on the other.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sbyar bar bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang mi 'byung la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i sbyar bar bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa yod kyang mi 'byung la /
translated: The object that is dependent is not produced even if the sense faculties and so on exist.

original: don yod na 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir de yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba nyid so sor snang ba de la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don yod na 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir de yod pa tsam gyis 'byung ba nyid so sor snang ba de la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: If the object exists, it is produced, and it is produced in dependence on the mere appearance of the object, which is produced by the object.

original: dbang po la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not produced in dependence on the sense faculty, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don las ni de dang 'dra ba nyid ces de don gyis byas par brjod do //
