analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don las ni de dang 'dra ba nyid ces de don gyis byas par brjod do //
translated: For this reason, it is said that the object is the cause of the cognition, because it is similar to the object.

original: don gyi bdag nyid du zhen pas don gyi phyogs su gzhag pa'i phyir yang de dang 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid du zhen pas don gyi phyogs su gzhag pa'i phyir yang de dang 'brel ba yin te /
translated: It is also related to the object, because it is posited as the side of the object by the adherence to the nature of the object.

original: des na don mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: des na don mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the object is the direct object of the cognition,

original: gang la so sor snang ba rnam pa gnyis ma 'brel pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la so sor snang ba rnam pa gnyis ma 'brel pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but the sense faculty, etc., are not the direct object, because the two kinds of appearance are not related to them.

original: sngon po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum yin gyi skad cig ma nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum yin gyi skad cig ma nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the cognition is the direct object of the cognition, because it is the nature of the cognition that appears, not its momentariness.

original: rang bzhin gang gis snang ba nges pa'i don gyi rang bzhin de ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis snang ba nges pa'i don gyi rang bzhin de ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: The nature of the object that is ascertained by the appearance of the object is the direct object of the cognition,

original: nges pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ascertainment is related to it.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis ni snang ba nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis ni snang ba nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But the momentariness of the object is not ascertained by that perception.

original: thob par bya ba yang 'dir 'jug pa'i yul nyid la nges par brtag par bya ba yin la 'jug pa'i yul yang nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thob par bya ba yang 'dir 'jug pa'i yul nyid la nges par brtag par bya ba yin la 'jug pa'i yul yang nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: And here, the object of engagement must be ascertained as the object of attainment, and the object of engagement is ascertained.

original: skad cig ma nyid ni dngos po la snang du zin kyang nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid ni dngos po la snang du zin kyang nges pa ma yin no //
translated: But the momentariness of the object is not ascertained even though it appears to cognition.

original: des na tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma gzhan gyis nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it must be ascertained by another valid cognition.

original: smig rgyu'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid gzung du zin kyang shes pa'i snang ba la smig rgyu'i rang bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir smig rgyu'i mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i rang bzhin mtshan nyid gzung du zin kyang shes pa'i snang ba la smig rgyu'i rang bzhin du ma nges pa'i phyir smig rgyu'i mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: Even though the nature of a mirage is apprehended, since the nature of a mirage is not ascertained in the appearance of cognition, it is not a direct perception of a mirage.

original: rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Other such cases should be understood in the same way.

original: snang ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i mngon sum 'di nyid kyang rtogs par byed pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: snang ba rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i mngon sum 'di nyid kyang rtogs par byed pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: This very direct perception that engages with the conformity and reversal of appearances also depends on realization.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs par byed pa'i snang ba gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i don de rtogs pa'i rnam pa ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs par byed pa'i snang ba gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i don de rtogs pa'i rnam pa ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni med do //
translated: The meaning of the cognition that follows the appearance that is the nature of cognition is the form of the object that is realized. There is no other.

original: snang ba don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa la yang thams cad mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: snang ba don gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i shes pa la yang thams cad mngon sum yin te /
translated: Also, with respect to the cognition that follows the appearance that follows the object, everything is perception,

original: gzhal bya mngon sum pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya mngon sum pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the object of comprehension is perception.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig tshad ma du ma'i yul du 'gyur ba mngon sum gyi don la rnam pa du mar rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig tshad ma du ma'i yul du 'gyur ba mngon sum gyi don la rnam pa du mar rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of perception is not realized in many ways by many valid cognitions.

original: snang ba smos pa ni shes pa'i rgyu @14b thams cad mngon sum yin pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: snang ba smos pa ni shes pa'i rgyu @14b thams cad mngon sum yin pa bzlog pa'i don du'o //
translated: The mention of appearance is for the purpose of refuting that everything that is a cause of cognition is perception.

original: snang ba ma smos na ni shes pa gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa de mngon sum yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snang ba ma smos na ni shes pa gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa de mngon sum yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If appearance were not mentioned, then because whatever follows the appearance and the cessation of cognition is perception,

original: dbang po la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that the senses and so on are perception.

original: snang ba smos na ni shes pa'i khyad par la brten par 'gyur la /
analyzed: snang ba smos na ni shes pa'i khyad par la brten par 'gyur la /
translated: If you say that it is an appearance, then it would be based on a specific consciousness.

original: khyad par yang shes pa la brten pa'i lhan cig byed pa so so la tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yang shes pa la brten pa'i lhan cig byed pa so so la tha dad pa yin no //
translated: And the specific would be a different cooperative condition based on consciousness.

original: snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de yang yul kho na las yin gyi /
analyzed: snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de yang yul kho na las yin gyi /
translated: And that specific characteristic of appearance is from the object alone,

original: dbang po dang de ma thag pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang de ma thag pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: not from the sense faculty or its immediate antecedent.

original: de bzhin du shes pa ma smos na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa ma smos na yang /
translated: Similarly, even if consciousness is not mentioned,

original: gang cung zad 'dra bar brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan de nyid mngon sum du brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang cung zad 'dra bar brtags pa'i rgyu mtshan de nyid mngon sum du brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: the reason for the slight similarity that is imagined would be stated as direct perception.

original: shes pa la gnas pa'i 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan can yang mngon sum yin par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa la gnas pa'i 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan can yang mngon sum yin par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And that which has the reason of similarity based on consciousness is also asserted to be direct perception.

original: gal te dngos po log tu zin kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos por snang ba mi ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te dngos po log tu zin kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs kyi dngos por snang ba mi ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if the thing has ceased, the appearance of the thing in the state of conception does not cease.

original: ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa'i shes pa'i snang ba 'ga' yang med pa nyid ma yin nam //
analyzed: ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su byed pa'i shes pa'i snang ba 'ga' yang med pa nyid ma yin nam //
translated: So is it not the case that there is no appearance of consciousness that conforms to the positive and negative concomitance?

original: dngos po nye na rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i snang ba mthong ba la 'di ni sngon po'i zhes zhe na par byed pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa'i gnas skabs de nyid na /
analyzed: dngos po nye na rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i snang ba mthong ba la 'di ni sngon po'i zhes zhe na par byed pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa'i gnas skabs de nyid na /
translated: When an object is near, the aspect of the cognition that is present in the nonconceptual cognition that sees the appearance is the very state of the aspect that is ascertained as “blue.”

original: sngon po nyid du nges par nyams su myong ste de'i phyir rtog pa med pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i rnam pa sngon po nyid du nges par byas pa dag ni gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon po nyid du nges par nyams su myong ste de'i phyir rtog pa med pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i rnam pa sngon po nyid du nges par byas pa dag ni gcig pa yin la /
translated: At that time, blue is definitely experienced. Therefore, the aspect of the cognition that is present in the nonconceptual cognition and the aspect of the cognition that is present in the conceptual cognition are ascertained as blue. They are the same.

original: gcig pas kyang dngos po la 'khrul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig pas kyang dngos po la 'khrul pa'i phyir /
translated: And because they are the same, they are mistaken with regard to the object.

original: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid las dngos po'am shes pa mngon sum nyid yin zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid las dngos po'am shes pa mngon sum nyid yin zhes dogs pa la /
translated: How is it that the object or cognition is a perception because it conforms with what is present and what is absent?

original: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: With regard to this point, it is said, “It is the uncommon nature of the object.”

original: don 'di yin te de dag tha mi dad pa zhen par byas pas ni gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te de dag tha mi dad pa zhen par byas pas ni gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. By apprehending them as not being different, they are not the same.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i snang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la gnas pa'i snang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du nyams su myong ste /
translated: Because the appearance that is based on a nonconceptual consciousness is experienced as a unique nature.

original: 'di ltar bum bzhi dag tu bum pa nyid du khyad par med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum bzhi dag tu bum pa nyid du khyad par med de /
translated: Thus, a vase is not distinguished as a vase in four parts.

original: bum pa so so la snang ba khyad par can du yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa so so la snang ba khyad par can du yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of each vase is correctly known as a unique particular.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi snang ba ni dngos po du ma la thun mong nyid du nges bar byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi snang ba ni dngos po du ma la thun mong nyid du nges bar byed de /
translated: The appearance of an object of conceptual consciousness is ascertained as a commonality in many things.

original: sngos po gcig la yang bum pa la sogs par brtags pa na /
analyzed: sngos po gcig la yang bum pa la sogs par brtags pa na /
translated: When a single blue thing is imagined as a vase, etc.,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba @15a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba @15a * //
translated: the appearance of the conceptual consciousness

original: nas skabs du ma'i thun mong nyid yin no //
analyzed: nas skabs du ma'i thun mong nyid yin no //
translated: is a commonality in many things.

original: mngon sum gyi snang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi snang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The appearance of a direct perception is not a commonality.

original: phyir thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i yul nyid kyis de dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i yul nyid kyis de dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are different because of the objects of a commonality and a noncommonality.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yul du snang bas ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'i dngos po ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yul du snang bas ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'i dngos po ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The direct perception is the entity which is engaged in the forward and reverse order of sequence, because it appears as the uncommon object.

original: yul de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa thun mong du snag bas ngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang // ldog pa'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir snang ba gzhan dag tu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa thun mong du snag bas ngos po'i rjes su 'gro ba dang // ldog pa'i rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir snang ba gzhan dag tu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa med par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The other appearances are not understood to be engaged in the forward and reverse order of sequence, because they are not engaged in the forward and reverse order of sequence of the entity, since they appear as the common object, not as the nature of that object.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yang mngon sum du 'dod do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yang mngon sum du 'dod do //
translated: The uncommon nature of the entity is also accepted as direct perception.

original: thun mong ma yin pa brtags pa ni ma yin no //🔽'di snyam du gal te thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa brtags pa ni ma yin no // 'di snyam du gal te thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis /
translated: The uncommon is not imagined.

original: snang ba tha dad pa dag tu rtog na /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa dag tu rtog na /
translated: If one imagines the different appearances by means of the uncommon and common,🔽then the uncommon would not be direct perception.

original: dngos po gcig nyid la nye ba dang ring ba'i bye brag gis lta ba po gnyis kyi shes pa dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid du tha dad par snang ba yang yul dngos po gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid la nye ba dang ring ba'i bye brag gis lta ba po gnyis kyi shes pa dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid du tha dad par snang ba yang yul dngos po gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the two consciousnesses of the two viewers, due to the difference of near and far with respect to a single thing, appear to be different, clear and unclear. Also, the object would not be a single thing.

original: ci ste de la dngos po gcig tu lhag par zhen pa las yul gcig pa nyid yin na ni 'di la yang yul gcig pa nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de la dngos po gcig tu lhag par zhen pa las yul gcig pa nyid yin na ni 'di la yang yul gcig pa nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that the object is the same because of the adherence to a single thing, then in this case also there is the same object,

original: dngos po gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: because of the adherence to a single thing.

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par snang ba dag don byed nus pa dang / mi nus pa dag gis tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs te /🔽thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par snang ba dag don byed nus pa dang / mi nus pa dag gis tha dad par bstan pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes gsungs te / thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: To respond to this qualm, he says “own characteristic,” in order to teach that the common and uncommon appearances are different because of their ability and inability to perform a function.🔽The nature of an uncommon thing is its own characteristic.

original: rang bzhin gang gis bdag nyid mtshon pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis bdag nyid mtshon pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid la /
translated: That by which one’s own nature is characterized is one’s own characteristic.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid ni don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshon pa'i phyir de la rang gi mtshan nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid ni don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshon pa'i phyir de la rang gi mtshan nyid ces brjod do //
translated: The nature of a real thing is indicated by its ability to perform a function, and therefore it is called its own characteristic.

original: de nyid de don dam par yod pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de don dam par yod pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: That is the nature of a real thing that exists ultimately.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of this passage.

original: de dag snang ba ni don byed nus pa dang mi nus ba dag gis tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag snang ba ni don byed nus pa dang mi nus ba dag gis tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The appearance of those two is differentiated by their ability or inability to perform a function.

original: thung mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thung mong dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not differentiated by mere generality or non-generality.

original: thung mong gi yul du snang ba ni don byed nus pa dang bral ba'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: thung mong gi yul du snang ba ni don byed nus pa dang bral ba'i yul can yin la /
translated: The appearance of a common object is a cognition that is devoid of the ability to perform a function.

original: gcig shig ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig shig ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The other is the opposite of that.

original: de nas de dag ni yul gcig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas de dag ni yul gcig nyid ma yin te /
translated: Then, those two are not one object,

original: gcig ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i @15b phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ma yin pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i @15b phyir ro //
translated: because the reason for their non-difference is just this.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba dag ni yul gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba dag ni yul gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The appearance of the clear and the unclear is one object,

original: don byed nus par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed nus par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in their ability to perform a function.

original: de'i phyir yul de snang ba ma yin pa 'khrul pas yul de'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yul de snang ba ma yin pa 'khrul pas yul de'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the object is not an appearance, the error of the appearance of the object’s nature is not an error. Thus, it is established as direct perception.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don yang rnam pa gcig nyid du rtogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don yang rnam pa gcig nyid du rtogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that a hidden object is also understood in a single aspect,

original: rab tu byed pa'i 'grel pa gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i 'grel pa gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The other commentary on the treatise . . .”

original: 'di ni 'di lta bur gyur ba'i don ni re zhig mngon sum la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di lta bur gyur ba'i don ni re zhig mngon sum la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: A direct object is an object that is present.

original: de'i rang bzhin dang bral ba gzhan ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dang bral ba gzhan ni lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhes lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni /
translated: A hidden object is an object that is absent, that is, an object that is devoid of the nature of a direct object.

original: mngon sum spangs pas yod pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mngon sum spangs pas yod pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, he demonstrates that a hidden object exists because it is excluded from being a direct object.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa de 'di nyid kyang rtogs pa po gcig la ltos pa'i phyir 'chol pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa de 'di nyid kyang rtogs pa po gcig la ltos pa'i phyir 'chol pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, direct and indirect perception are not confused because they depend on a single cognizer.

original: gzhan de yang rtogs par mi 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan de yang rtogs par mi 'thad pa yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that another is cognized.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir sgo nas de la rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum snang ba'i shes pa bskyed pa'i phyir sgo nas de la rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa 'jog pa ste /
translated: Because it is posited as the nature of that which is the cause of generating a consciousness that is the appearance of direct perception.🔽

original: gtong ba'i nus pa de la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtong ba'i nus pa de la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the capacity to posit or to posit as its own nature that which generates a consciousness that perceives it does not exist for that.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i rang gi ngo bo rtogs par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to understand it as its own nature.

original: gal te lkog tu gyur pa nyams su myong par bya ba ma yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur pa nyams su myong par bya ba ma yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it is not possible to experience the hidden,

original: gzhan mthong ba na ma mthong ba yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba na ma mthong ba yang rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: when one sees one thing, one would understand the non-seeing of another.

original: gzhan mthong ba na gzhan ma mthong ba yang rtogs par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba na gzhan ma mthong ba yang rtogs par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: When one sees one thing, it is not reasonable to understand the non-seeing of another.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: gang cung zad cig mthong ba la mthong ba thams cad brtags par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang cung zad cig mthong ba la mthong ba thams cad brtags par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The consequence is that whatever is seen would be investigated as all seeing.

original: gal te gzhan mthong ba na lkog tu gyur pa brtag par mi rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan mthong ba na lkog tu gyur pa brtag par mi rigs pa yin no //
translated: If when one sees one thing, it is not reasonable to investigate the hidden,

original: 'o na ni rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, inference also would not be a valid cognition,

original: de yang lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de yang lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
translated: because it has the nature of understanding a hidden object.

original: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To respond: “That” and so on.

original: mthong ba gzhan de med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ste /
analyzed: mthong ba gzhan de med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin na ste /
translated: If seeing is not arisen without that,

original: mi 'khrul pa nyid yin na'o //🔽skabs kyi rtogs par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni 'brel pa can du shes par byas te /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa nyid yin na'o // skabs kyi rtogs par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni 'brel pa can du shes par byas te /
translated: if it is nondeceptive,🔽the object to be understood, the hidden object, is understood to be related.

original: rtogs par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don la mi 'khrul pa'i don mthong ba las ni rtogs par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don la mi 'khrul pa'i don mthong ba las ni rtogs par rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that the object to be understood, the hidden object, is understood from seeing the object that is nondeceptive.

original: @16a * // khyad par 'di nyid bstan pa'i don du yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: @16a * // khyad par 'di nyid bstan pa'i don du yang zhes smos so //
translated: This very distinction is stated by “also.”

original: gal te med na mi 'byung ba mthong ba las kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te med na mi 'byung ba mthong ba las kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not arisen without it, then even from seeing that which is not arisen without it, the hidden object is not understood.

original: dngos po 'di thams cad ni dngos po gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: dngos po 'di thams cad ni dngos po gzhan gyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Because all these things are the effects of other things.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa la lkog tu gyur pa'i don du rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /🔽de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa la lkog tu gyur pa'i don du rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na / de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: But it is not the case that the object that is hidden is understood as not established as the entity of cause and effect.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i don gzhan de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i don gzhan de /
translated: The response to that is “Because it is seen that . . .”

original: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa ji lta bu'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa grub pa ste /
analyzed: btso ba dang bsreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa ji lta bu'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa grub pa ste /
translated: Because the object that is seen is related to the aspect of the object that is to be cooked, burned, and so on, it is established, it is well established, that the object that is seen is related to the aspect of the object that is to be cooked, burned, and so on.

original: rab tu grub pa de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid dpe la mthong ba dang 'dra bar phyogs gang du dngos po gzhan de mthong ba'i phyogs der nye ba nyid du go bar byed de /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa de lta bu'i rnam pa nyid dpe la mthong ba dang 'dra bar phyogs gang du dngos po gzhan de mthong ba'i phyogs der nye ba nyid du go bar byed de /
translated: In that way, just as in the example, the object that is seen is understood, is comprehended, as being present in the place where the object that is seen is present.

original: khong du chud par byed kyi rang gi ngo bo mthong bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khong du chud par byed kyi rang gi ngo bo mthong bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that its own entity is seen.

original: rnam pa 'dis kyang tshul gsum bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis kyang tshul gsum bstan te /
translated: By this method, the three modes are presented.

original: rtags su gyur pa'i dngos po de gang du mthong zhing tshad mas yul du byas pa der bsgrub par bya ba'i don nye ba nyid du go bar bya ba de nyid de dag gi chos can yin no //
analyzed: rtags su gyur pa'i dngos po de gang du mthong zhing tshad mas yul du byas pa der bsgrub par bya ba'i don nye ba nyid du go bar bya ba de nyid de dag gi chos can yin no //
translated: The evidence is the thing that is seen and is the object of the valid cognition. It is understood to be the presence of the probandum. That is the subject of those [evidence and probandum].

original: grub pa smos pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa nges pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa smos pas kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa nges pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: By mentioning the establishment, the nature of the pervasion and the certainty of the relation are also expressed.

original: des na med na mi 'byung ba ni sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis go bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na med na mi 'byung ba ni sgron ma la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis go bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the invariable relation is not understood by its own nature, like a lamp, etc.

original: 'on kyang med na mi 'byung ba nges par byed pa nyid kyis de sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu brjod la /
analyzed: 'on kyang med na mi 'byung ba nges par byed pa nyid kyis de sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag tu brjod la /
translated: However, it is stated as a part of the proof by the certainty of the invariable relation.

original: dpe la mthong ba'i dngos po dang 'dra bar lkog tu gyur pa'i don nges pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid du zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe la mthong ba'i dngos po dang 'dra bar lkog tu gyur pa'i don nges pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid du zhen pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of the hidden object is like seeing the example, and is the apprehension of the general nature.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'jug pa'i yul ni nges par byas pa nyid du brjod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'jug pa'i yul ni nges par byas pa nyid du brjod la /
translated: Moreover, if the object of engagement is stated to be ascertained,

original: nges pa'i yang spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa'i yang spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a definite cognition, it is a cognition of a universal.

original: mngon sum yang 'jug pa'i yul la ltos na spyi'i yul can nyid yin pa de lta na yang mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i zhen par byed pas don de rgyud gzhan gyis rang bzhin gyi dben par yul du byed la /
analyzed: mngon sum yang 'jug pa'i yul la ltos na spyi'i yul can nyid yin pa de lta na yang mngon sum gyi rjes la byung ba'i zhen par byed pas don de rgyud gzhan gyis rang bzhin gyi dben par yul du byed la /
translated: Although direct perception is a cognition of a universal in dependence on its engaged object, it is not a cognition of a universal in dependence on its object of adherence, which arises after the direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i nges pas ni 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rgyud gzhan las log pa'i tha dad pa'i bdag nyid khyad par can rnam par 'jog par mi nus te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i nges pas ni 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rgyud gzhan las log pa'i tha dad pa'i bdag nyid khyad par can rnam par 'jog par mi nus te /
translated: The ascertainment of inference cannot posit a specific identity that is a different object from the specific characteristics that are its engaged object and that is devoid of a different continuum.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus na mthong ba'i dngos po dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus na mthong ba'i dngos po dang mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it engages in a nature that is similar to the entity that is seen when it apprehends the relationship.

original: des na rang gi mtshan nyid kyang @16b 'jug pa'i yul du nye bar gzhag pa na /
analyzed: des na rang gi mtshan nyid kyang @16b 'jug pa'i yul du nye bar gzhag pa na /
translated: Therefore, when specific characteristics are posited as engaged objects,

original: nges par tha dad pa rgyud gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa rnam par mi 'jog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par tha dad pa rgyud gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa rnam par mi 'jog pa'i phyir /
translated: the ascertainment of inference does not posit a specific identity that is different from the specific characteristics that are its engaged object and that is not shared with other continuums.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa'i yul la ltos nas kyang spyi'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa'i yul la ltos nas kyang spyi'i yul can yin no //
translated: And inference is the subject that has a universal for its object, in relation to the object that is engaged.

original: mngon sum ni nges pa la ltos nas kyang khyad par gyi yul can yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni nges pa la ltos nas kyang khyad par gyi yul can yin no //
translated: And perception is the subject that has a particular for its object, in relation to the ascertainment.

original: rgyud gzhan med pa'i khyad par nyid du yul nges bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan med pa'i khyad par nyid du yul nges bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it ascertains the object as a particular that is not in a different continuum.

original: 'dir gzung bar bya ba la ltos nas spyi'i yul can nyid dam khyad par gyi yul can nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzung bar bya ba la ltos nas spyi'i yul can nyid dam khyad par gyi yul can nyid ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not in relation to the object that is grasped that it is the subject that has a universal for its object or the subject that has a particular for its object.

original: de ni skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not the context.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin na yang rtags ni spyi'i yul can du brjod de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin na yang rtags ni spyi'i yul can du brjod de /
translated: Even though the particular is the object, the reason is said to have a universal for its object,

original: tha dad gnas pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad gnas pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: because it does not abide in the different.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it will be explained that

original: 'di 'dra ba'i spyi'i tshul du lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te des na tshad ma gzhan srid pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshul du don rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes🔽bya bas bshad do //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i spyi'i tshul du lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa yin te des na tshad ma gzhan srid pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni spyi'i tshul du don rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas bshad do //
translated: This is an inference that comprehends a hidden object by means of a general rule. Therefore, it is said that “there is no other valid cognition because the comprehension of an object by means of a general rule is also inference.”

original: de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis kho na'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there are only two valid cognitions.

original: gal te 'di snyam du 'di 'dra ba'i rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du 'di 'dra ba'i rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa yin du chug na yang /
translated: If you think that even if such a cognition is inference,

original: rnam pa gzhan ni tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: another aspect would be another valid cognition,

original: gzhan du na rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan du na rtogs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that “it is not reasonable for another aspect to be a valid cognition because it is not reasonable for another aspect to be a valid cognition.”

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don mi 'khrul par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don mi 'khrul par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no nonerroneous cognition of a hidden object by means of another aspect.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir don ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: Because an object is only of two types:

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: directly perceptible and hidden.

original: mngon sum ni de snang ba nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni de snang ba nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur gyi rnam pa gzhan du ma yin la /
translated: Direct perception is the realization of an object through the appearance of that object itself, not through some other aspect.

original: de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: And that is not a valid cognition of direct perception.

original: lkog tu gyur pa yang rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa yang rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul gyis rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: An object that is hidden is realized through the mode of following a reason.

original: rtags la mi ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni the tshom nyid yin pas de'i yul yang thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: rtags la mi ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni the tshom nyid yin pas de'i yul yang thob par mi nus te /
translated: Conceptual thought that does not rely on a reason is doubt. Therefore, its object cannot be obtained.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang med pa'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang med pa'i phyir zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because it is not the nature of both, as has been explained.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul du rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul du rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Realization through the mode of following is inference.

original: des na shes pa gzhan la ni thob par bya ba'i yul 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na shes pa gzhan la ni thob par bya ba'i yul 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, there is no object to be obtained by any other consciousness.

original: tshad ma yin na yang yul gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma yin na yang yul gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Even if it is a valid cognition, because there is no other object, the reason is not unestablished.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul can nyid kyang /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul can nyid kyang /
translated: The subject of direct perception and inference

original: de'i mtshan nyid @17a * //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid @17a * //
translated: has that characteristic.

original: kho na yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kho na yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is only that.

original: ji ltar na tshad ma gzhan srid par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshad ma gzhan srid par 'gyur /
translated: How could another valid cognition be possible?

original: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa dag las rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa gang yin pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa dag las rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa gang yin pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t there also a cognition that is different from that which arises from words and so on?

original: ci ste sgra las rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sgra las rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition that arises from words is included in inference,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags la brten pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags la brten pa yin la /
translated: Because inference is based on a reason having the three modes,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i sgra dag las lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa ni tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i sgra dag las lkog tu gyur pa'i don la 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa ni tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and the cognition of a hidden object without error through the power of the relation of invariable concomitance is another valid cognition.

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says “that” and so on.

original: / de'i zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: / de'i zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: “That” is a word of intolerance.

original: sgra'i rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ma bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i nang du 'du'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ma bzod pa'o //
translated: It is intolerant of the statement “the cognition that arises from words is included in inference.”

original: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa kho na ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa kho na ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Because the definition of a reason is only a relation that has the nature of forward and reverse pervasion.

original: rang bzhin ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshul gzhan yang yod do zhes nges pa 'gog pa yin gyi 'brel pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma yin gyi 'on kyang tshul gzhan yang yod do zhes nges pa 'gog pa yin gyi 'brel pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a nature, but there is another mode, and it is a negation of certainty, not a statement that a relation is not the definition of a reason.

original: rang bzhin gzhan de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that other nature?

original: gzung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can zhes smos te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i chos can zhes smos te /
translated: It is the subject that possesses the property to be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos dag gi rten du gyur pa'i chos can la rtags yod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i chos dag gi rten du gyur pa'i chos can la rtags yod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the subject that is the basis of the property to be established and the property that establishes it, where the reason exists.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i yul can gyis yul yod pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i yul can gyis yul yod pa ston par byed do //
translated: The word seen indicates that the subject exists, as it is the object of seeing.

original: mthong ba ste tshad mas yul du byas pa'i yod pa nyid ni sgrub pa'i yan lag yin no zhes ci nas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ste tshad mas yul du byas pa'i yod pa nyid ni sgrub pa'i yan lag yin no zhes ci nas kyang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make it understood in every way, existence is a part of the proof, and it is seen by valid cognition that makes it an object.

original: de ni sgra rnams la med pa'i phyir ldog tu zin kyang tshul gnyis po 'di las rtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni sgra rnams la med pa'i phyir ldog tu zin kyang tshul gnyis po 'di las rtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, even though the reason is refuted, it is understood from these two methods.

original: yang ji ltar na phyogs kyi chos nyid med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na phyogs kyi chos nyid med ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is the property of the subject absent?

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu chos can yin na ni de la sgra 'ba' zhig yod kyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu chos can yin na ni de la sgra 'ba' zhig yod kyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: If the person is the subject, then only sound exists for it, not meaning,

original: gnyi ga'i rten yang chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rten yang chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the basis of both is the subject.

original: sgra'i bye brag chos can la sgra'i spyi gtan tshigs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i bye brag chos can la sgra'i spyi gtan tshigs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Sound-generality is not a reason for the subject, sound-particularity.

original: de don dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de don dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not related to meaning,

original: sgra don gyi 'brel pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra don gyi 'brel pa ni brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed ba yin la /
translated: because the relation of sound and meaning is that of the expressed and the expresser,

original: khyad par yang rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par yang rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the particular is not the expresser.

original: sgra'i spyi'i chos can la sgra'i khyad par gtan tshigs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i spyi'i chos can la sgra'i khyad par gtan tshigs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Sound-particularity is not a reason for the subject, sound-generality.

original: de yang snga @17b ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang snga @17b ma bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not related to the meaning to be established, just as before.

original: ci ste yang don gyi khyad par chos can la don gyi spyi bsgrub byar rtogs pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang don gyi khyad par chos can la don gyi spyi bsgrub byar rtogs pa de lta na yang /
translated: But even if one understands the meaning-universal to be the probandum, with respect to the subject, a particular meaning,

original: don gyi khyad par dang sgra lhan cig brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par dang sgra lhan cig brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir phyogs kyi chos nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: still, because there is no entity that is both the expression and the expressed, with respect to the particular meaning, it is not reasonable to be the property of the subject.

original: don gyi khyad par grub na yang don gyi spyi grub pa'i phyir rtags nye bar blangs pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par grub na yang don gyi spyi grub pa'i phyir rtags nye bar blangs pa don med pa yin no //
translated: And even if the particular meaning were established, the statement of the reason would be pointless, because the meaning-universal would be established.

original: don gyi spyi chos can yin na yang bsgrub par bya ba khyad par dang / rtags sgra 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rtags ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: don gyi spyi chos can yin na yang bsgrub par bya ba khyad par dang / rtags sgra 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rtags ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And if the meaning-universal is the subject, then because there is no relation between the probandum, the particular, and the reason, sound, it is not a correct reason.

original: chos can yang rtags kyi bya ba'i sngon rol du grub pa yin pa'i phyir sgra sbyor ba'i sngon rol du don grub na sgra sbyar bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: chos can yang rtags kyi bya ba'i sngon rol du grub pa yin pa'i phyir sgra sbyor ba'i sngon rol du don grub na sgra sbyar bas ci zhig bya /
translated: And because the subject is established prior to the activity of the reason, if the meaning is established prior to the statement of the sound, what is the point of stating the sound?

original: ma grub pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar chos can nyid yin na /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid yin na yang ji ltar chos can nyid yin na /
translated: But if it is not established, how can it be the subject?

original: de'i phyir sgra rnams la phyogs kyi chos yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra rnams la phyogs kyi chos yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, sound does not have the property of the position.

original: des na tshul gnyis kyi sgra las don 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa ni tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: des na tshul gnyis kyi sgra las don 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa ni tshad ma gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Therefore, the other party’s position is that the valid knowledge that nonerronenously comprehends the object from the words that have the two modes is another valid knowledge.

original: 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here we must analyze.

original: 'jug pa'i yul rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni tshad mar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: We assert that a valid knowledge is that which posits the object of engagement.

original: de la brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa yod du chug kyang tshig las don rtogs pa'i shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa yod du chug kyang tshig las don rtogs pa'i shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa des ni /
translated: Even if it were the case that there is a relationship with an external object that is the referent of the word, the consciousness that arises from the word comprehending the object

original: gang gis bum pa don du gnyer ba 'ga' zhig spangs nas 'ga' zhig la 'jug par 'gyur ba 'jug pa'i yul 'ga' zhig bzhag pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bum pa don du gnyer ba 'ga' zhig spangs nas 'ga' zhig la 'jug par 'gyur ba 'jug pa'i yul 'ga' zhig bzhag pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not posit any object of engagement that would cause someone who desires a pot to abandon one and engage in another.

original: 'di ltar yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i 'jug pa'i yul gyi dngos po dag ni skyes bu 'jug par spro'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i 'jug pa'i yul gyi dngos po dag ni skyes bu 'jug par spro'i /
translated: Thus, people are eager to engage in things that are objects of engagement that are related to the features of the object.

original: bum pa'i sgras ni yul 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du byas pa'i bum pa ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa'i sgras ni yul 'ga' zhig gis khyad par du byas pa'i bum pa ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the word pot does not indicate a pot that is qualified by some object,🔽how could one engage in it?

original: ji ltar na de la 'jug par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i don du de dag de la ma mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de la 'jug par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i don du de dag de la ma mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it says, If those are not seen in it.

original: sgra de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang 'brel par rung ba'i phyogs kyi khyad par chos can de la mthong ba ma yin na /
analyzed: sgra de dag bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po dang 'brel par rung ba'i phyogs kyi khyad par chos can de la mthong ba ma yin na /
translated: If those words are not seen in the subject, the particular locus that is suitable to be related to the object of affirmation,

original: gang la skyes bu 'jug par 'gyur ba don ci zhig bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis nye bar 'jog par byed /
analyzed: gang la skyes bu 'jug par 'gyur ba don ci zhig bsgrub pa'i tshul gyis nye bar 'jog par byed /
translated: then what is the point of engaging in it? In what way is it posited as something to be established?

original: 'ga' zhig tu rang gi dngos po mthong ba na der med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po nye ba yin par ston pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rang gi dngos po mthong ba na der med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po nye ba yin par ston pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin na /
translated: If one sees its own entity, then it is taught that the thing that is necessarily related to it is nearby.

original: skyes bu gang la sgra mthong ba de la ni don nye bar bsdu bar nus pa @18a * //🔽ma yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu gang la sgra mthong ba de la ni don nye bar bsdu bar nus pa @18a * // ma yin la /
translated: But sound is not capable of subsuming the object in the case of someone who sees the sound.

original: phyogs la sogs pa gang du bum pa gnas pa der ni sgra ma mthong ste /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa gang du bum pa gnas pa der ni sgra ma mthong ste /
translated: And the sound is not seen in the place where the pot is located.

original: des na sgra ni rang gi yul du bsgrub par bya ba'i don nye bar sdud pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'am ldog par byed ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra ni rang gi yul du bsgrub par bya ba'i don nye bar sdud pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'am ldog par byed ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, sound is not the means of subsuming the object to be established in its own domain, and so it is neither the means of engagement nor the means of disengagement.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig spong ba'i bdag nyid kyi 'jug pa'i yul du 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pa'i don gyis dben pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig ston par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig spong ba'i bdag nyid kyi 'jug pa'i yul du 'gyur ba sgrub par byed pa'i don gyis dben pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig ston par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the proof does not indicate any place devoid of the object of engagement that has the nature of exclusion.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: But is a word of intolerance.

original: sgra gang zhig phyogs kyi chos dang bral bas na phyogs 'ga' zhig mi bsgrub cing /
analyzed: sgra gang zhig phyogs kyi chos dang bral bas na phyogs 'ga' zhig mi bsgrub cing /
translated: The sound that is devoid of the property of the place does not establish any place.

original: 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i yan lag sdud pa ma yin pa tshad ma nyid du bdag gir byed ces bya ba de mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i yan lag sdud pa ma yin pa tshad ma nyid du bdag gir byed ces bya ba de mi bzod pa'o //
translated: because in some cases, some are not refuted, and because they do not include the factors of engagement and disengagement, they are not accepted as valid cognitions.

original: cig shos kyis kyang sgra rnams rjes su dpag pa dang mtshungs par mthong nas gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cig shos kyis kyang sgra rnams rjes su dpag pa dang mtshungs par mthong nas gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The other party, seeing that the words are similar to an inference, says, “What?”

original: gang zhig dang sgra sngar 'brel par mthong ba de la dran par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig dang sgra sngar 'brel par mthong ba de la dran par byed de /
translated: What one has seen previously in connection with the word is what one remembers.

original: des na de dag tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are valid cognitions.

original: gal te dran par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dran par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If they are not valid cognitions because they are memories, then it follows that inference is not a valid cognition,

original: de yang sngar mthong ba'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sngar mthong ba'i yul can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it also has the object of what was previously seen.

original: ci ste yang dran par bya ba de la yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa snga na med pa rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang dran par bya ba de la yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa snga na med pa rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the memory of that which is to be remembered realizes a previously non-existent connection with a particular object,

original: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa yang yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa yod do //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i rtogs pa yang yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa yod do //
translated: The cognition that arises from words is also related to a particular object.

original: dran par bya ba'i yul nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te der yang dran pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran par bya ba'i yul nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te der yang dran pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is not, because the object to be remembered is not ascertained, that is not so, because even in that case, the object of memory is related to a particular time.

original: dngos po la brten pa'i yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa yang dran pa la brten pa'i yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa las bye brag cung zad yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la brten pa'i yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa yang dran pa la brten pa'i yul gyi khyad par dang 'brel pa las bye brag cung zad yod pa yin no //
translated: And there is not the slightest difference between the relation to a particular object based on a thing and the relation to a particular object based on memory.

original: thams cad du rtags kyi bsgrub bya las snga na med pa cung zad cig rtogs par bya bar brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: thams cad du rtags kyi bsgrub bya las snga na med pa cung zad cig rtogs par bya bar brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: In every case, it must be said that the object to be proven by the reason is known prior to the reason.

original: de yang gnyi ga la khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gnyi ga la khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is not different in either case.

original: gang gi phyir sgra dang rtags dag mthong ba tsam la dran pa bskyed pa'i bya ba la ni bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra dang rtags dag mthong ba tsam la dran pa bskyed pa'i bya ba la ni bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no difference in the activity of producing memory from merely seeing words and reasons.

original: yul dang dus kyi khyad par yang don gyi shugs las yin pa'i yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i mes ni yul de na gnas pa'i du bskyed par mi byed @18b pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyi khyad par yang don gyi shugs las yin pa'i yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i mes ni yul de na gnas pa'i du bskyed par mi byed @18b pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, the particularities of place and time are implied by the meaning. This is because fire that exists in another place and time does not produce smoke that exists in that place.

original: don gyi shugs kyis khyad par rtog pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yul gyi khyad par dus kyi khyad par na gnas pa'i sgra las dran bzhin pa'i don de yul gyi khyad par dang dus kyi khyad par du dran pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don gyi shugs kyis khyad par rtog pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yul gyi khyad par dus kyi khyad par na gnas pa'i sgra las dran bzhin pa'i don de yul gyi khyad par dang dus kyi khyad par du dran pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as the particularities are conceived through the force of the meaning, in the same way, in this case, the object that is being remembered, which exists in a particular place and time, is the object of memory that is the domain of the memory of that object that exists in a particular place and time.

original: khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest difference.

original: sgra'i yul dang dus na gnas par bya ba dran par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra'i yul dang dus na gnas par bya ba dran par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the object of the sound that exists in a particular place and time is remembered,

original: yul dang dus gzhan du mthong ba dran pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan du mthong ba dran pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: the object of the memory of seeing in another place and time is connected to the particularities of place and time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa'i rang bzhin gnyi ga snga na med par rtogs pa yang bye brag med pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa'i rang bzhin gnyi ga snga na med par rtogs pa yang bye brag med pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the two, the nature of memory, are not previously existent, it is understood that there is no difference. Therefore, both would be valid cognitions or neither would be valid cognitions.

original: slob dpon gyis sgra dang rtas med par yang dran pa 'di 'dra ba bstan pa'i sgro nas sgra rnam tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis sgra dang rtas med par yang dran pa 'di 'dra ba bstan pa'i sgro nas sgra rnam tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The Acarya, in order to teach that sound is not a valid cognition, because this kind of memory is taught to occur even when there is no sound or sign,

original: sgra dang rtags med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra dang rtags med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: says, “Even when there is no sound or sign . . .”

original: ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu bsgrim pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu bsgrim pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ In some way” means “in some cases,” such as when one is attentive.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni sgra dang rtags med par dran pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni sgra dang rtags med par dran pa'o //
translated: “ Itself” means “without sound or sign.”

original: mi 'gyur ram ci skad du bshad pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ram ci skad du bshad pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: “ Would not occur” means “would not occur with the special characteristics explained.”

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: ji ltar de tshad ma ma yin pa bzhin du sgra las skyes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de tshad ma ma yin pa bzhin du sgra las skyes pa yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as it is not a valid cognition, so also that which arises from sound is not.

original: 'dir brgya la gzhan dag snyoms par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir brgya la gzhan dag snyoms par byed de /
translated: Here, some may be in equipoise.

original: re zhig dran pa 'di 'dra ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dran pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: re zhig dran pa 'di 'dra ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i dran pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no /
translated: For now, this kind of memory is not distinguished from inferential memory.

original: ji ltar dran pa 'di 'khrul pa de ltar ni rjes su dpag pa'i dran pa la yang 'khrul pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa 'di 'khrul pa de ltar ni rjes su dpag pa'i dran pa la yang 'khrul pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Just as this memory is mistaken, so too inferential memory is mistaken.

original: rang nyid dran par byed pa yang 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las du ba med par dran par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rang nyid dran par byed pa yang 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las du ba med par dran par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Even when one remembers oneself, one remembers without effort, etc., that there is no smoke.

original: de yang sgra'i dran pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /🔽des na de yang tshad mar khas blang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de yang sgra'i dran pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang mtshungs pa yin te / des na de yang tshad mar khas blang bar bya ba'am /
translated: And that is similar to inference, just as it is a memory of sound.🔽Therefore, that should also be accepted as valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon rang nyid kyis dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes slob dpon rang nyid kyis dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Or else, inference would not be valid cognition.

original: gnas skabs 'di gnyis la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di gnyis la zhes gsungs te /
translated: The master himself anticipates this qualm and says, “In these two situations.”

original: sgra dang 'bad rtsol la sogs pas dran pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyis la bye brag kyang yod dam ci /
analyzed: sgra dang 'bad rtsol la sogs pas dran pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyis la bye brag kyang yod dam ci /
translated: Are there also distinctions in these two situations of memory, such as sound and effort, etc.?

original: 'di skad du smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du smras pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dran pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyi ga yang dran par bya ba'i dngos po la brten pa'i khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma @19a * //
analyzed: dran pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyi ga yang dran par bya ba'i dngos po la brten pa'i khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma @19a * //
translated: In terms of memory, there is not the slightest difference between these two cases.

original: yin no // des na gnyi ga yang bye brag med par tshad ma'am ma ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yin no // des na gnyi ga yang bye brag med par tshad ma'am ma ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, both are either valid knowledge or not.

original: kho bo cag gi ni dran par bya ba'i dngos po la brten pa'i khyad par che ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ni dran par bya ba'i dngos po la brten pa'i khyad par che ste /
translated: But for us, there is a great difference in terms of the object of memory.

original: gang gi phyir gang du du ba mthong ba der rang skyed par byed pa'i me mi ldan pa rnam par bcad nas 'jog pa nas 'jug pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang du du ba mthong ba der rang skyed par byed pa'i me mi ldan pa rnam par bcad nas 'jog pa nas 'jug pa'i yan lag tu byed pa yin te /
translated: This is because when smoke is seen, it is posited by excluding fire that does not produce it as its cause.

original: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i mes yul de na gnas pa'i du ba mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i mes yul de na gnas pa'i du ba mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because fire that exists in another place does not produce smoke that exists in that place.

original: des na rang skyed par byed pa ston pa na /
analyzed: des na rang skyed par byed pa ston pa na /
translated: Therefore, when it shows its producer,

original: yul de na gnas pa'i me ston par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yul de na gnas pa'i me ston par byed pa yin la /
translated: it shows the fire that exists in that place.

original: de yang 'jug pa'i yan lag yin gyi 'bad rtsol las me dran pa ni snga na med pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i me 'jug pa'i yul du byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jug pa'i yan lag yin gyi 'bad rtsol las me dran pa ni snga na med pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel pa'i me 'jug pa'i yul du byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is a branch of engagement, but the recollection of fire from effort is not the object of engagement of fire related to a particular place and time that did not exist before.

original: des na snga na med pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel pa ma nges pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na snga na med pa'i yul dang dus kyi khyad par dang 'brel pa ma nges pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is not ascertained that it is related to a particular place and time that did not exist before, it is not a proof.

original: tshad ma ma yin pas sgra dag kho na tshad ma ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pas sgra dag kho na tshad ma ma yin no zhes mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude that because it is not a valid means of knowledge, sound alone is not a valid means of knowledge, he says:

original: de'i phyir 'di dag yul lam dus 'ga' zhig tu zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag yul lam dus 'ga' zhig tu zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, these are not valid cognitions in any place or time.

original: sgrub pa'am 'gog pa mi byed ba ste dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma 'brel pa rnam par mi gcod pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa'am 'gog pa mi byed ba ste dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ma 'brel pa rnam par mi gcod pa /
translated: They do not prove or refute, that is, they do not eliminate the non-relation of things and non-things.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: How are they not valid cognitions of anything?

original: 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means they do not reveal the object of engagement.

original: 'di snyam du ngag gi khyad par ni 'jug pa'i yul rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ngag gi khyad par ni 'jug pa'i yul rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
translated: One might think, “Speech is a valid cognition because it posits the specific object of engagement.”

original: 'di ltar phyogs ga ge mo zhig na bum pa yod do zhes yul gyi khyad par ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad nas bum pa 'jug pa'i yul du rtogs par byed do zhes dogs pa la de dag las zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs ga ge mo zhig na bum pa yod do zhes yul gyi khyad par ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad nas bum pa 'jug pa'i yul du rtogs par byed do zhes dogs pa la de dag las zhes smos te /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the connection with the specific object, it causes one to understand that a vase is the object of engagement.

original: ngag tu gyur pa de dag las spangs ba dang blang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag tu gyur pa de dag las spangs ba dang blang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: To respond: The object of engagement, which is characterized by the elimination of that which is to be abandoned and the adoption of that which is to be adopted, is not established from those words.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi mngon sum bzhin du don gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid mthong ba ni ma yin na gang zhig 'jug pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi mngon sum bzhin du don gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid mthong ba ni ma yin na gang zhig 'jug pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: Thus, like the direct perception of those words, the intrinsic reality of the object is not seen, so what would be the object of engagement?

original: des na dogs pa ma bsal ba'i sgra 'di dag pas yod dam 'o na te med ces don gcig tu nges par rtogs la thob par bya ba'i dngos po ma nges pa'i don kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dogs pa ma bsal ba'i sgra 'di dag pas yod dam 'o na te med ces don gcig tu nges par rtogs la thob par bya ba'i dngos po ma nges pa'i don kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, without eliminating that qualm, one understands the meaning of the words “It exists” or “It does not exist” with certainty, and there is no object of engagement that is an indefinite thing to be attained.

original: des sgra nye bar gzhag pa brtags pa'i don la spang ba'am spang bar bya ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des sgra nye bar gzhag pa brtags pa'i don la spang ba'am spang bar bya ba yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no object to be eliminated in the meaning of the examination of the sound that is placed nearby.

original: de dag las don 'grub par @19b ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag las don 'grub par @19b ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could the object be accomplished from those?

original: 'jug pa na spang ba la mi 'dzul bas na gdon mi za bar gang las cung zad cig thob par 'gyur ba 'thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa gzhan skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa na spang ba la mi 'dzul bas na gdon mi za bar gang las cung zad cig thob par 'gyur ba 'thob pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa gzhan skye ba yin no //
translated: Since one does not engage in the elimination when engaging, it is certain that another cognition arises as the reason for obtaining whatever is obtained.

original: 'di snyam du gal te rang gi ngo bo snang ba ma yin du chug kyang ci du ba la sogs pas me bzhin du yul de la nges pa tsam yang skyed par mi byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te rang gi ngo bo snang ba ma yin du chug kyang ci du ba la sogs pas me bzhin du yul de la nges pa tsam yang skyed par mi byed dam zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, “Even if the intrinsic nature is not an appearance, does it not generate mere ascertainment of that object, like smoke and so on with respect to fire?”

original: de dag der 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: de dag der 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, “Because their connection with that is not established.”

original: sgra de dag phyi rol gyi dngos po der de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de dag phyi rol gyi dngos po der de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the connection of those sounds with that external thing is not established by the characteristic of being of the same nature or arising from that.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i dngos po gzhan mthong ba nang gi ngo bo snang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i dngos po gzhan mthong ba nang gi ngo bo snang ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to ascertain that another thing is seen that is unrelated to the appearance of the internal nature.

original: dogs pa ma bzlog pa'i phyi rol gyi don med kyang don de la ngag sbyor ba ma mthong ste /
analyzed: dogs pa ma bzlog pa'i phyi rol gyi don med kyang don de la ngag sbyor ba ma mthong ste /
translated: Even though external objects are not refuted, it is not seen that speech is applied to those objects.

original: dper na chu klung gi ngogs na bu ram gyi shing rta bdal ba yod do zhes bya ba 'bral pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu klung gi ngogs na bu ram gyi shing rta bdal ba yod do zhes bya ba 'bral pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “There is a sugar-cane tree on the bank of the river,” even though there is no connection.

original: ngag gi skabs kyi skyon 'di ni tshig la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi skabs kyi skyon 'di ni tshig la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: This fault in the context of speech is also the same for words.

original: d'i ltar don de yod pa ma yin yang de'i tshig sbyor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: d'i ltar don de yod pa ma yin yang de'i tshig sbyor bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, even though that object does not exist, it is seen that its words are applied.

original: tshig gi don rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gi don rnam pa thams cad du med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the words is not completely nonexistent,

original: de de ltar bden na yang dper na med dang du ba bzhin du sgra rnams blo'i bar chad la mi ltos par dngos po dang lhan cig 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar bden na yang dper na med dang du ba bzhin du sgra rnams blo'i bar chad la mi ltos par dngos po dang lhan cig 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: even though that is true, like the word “nonexistent” and smoke, words are not related to things without depending on the interruption of cognition.

original: 'on kyang blos bar du chod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang blos bar du chod pa nyid do //
translated: But the meaning is obstructed by the mind.

original: 'di ltar don yod na de mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar don yod na de mthong ba yin la /
translated: If the meaning exists, it is seen.

original: de las de bstan pa'i bsam 'byung zhing /
analyzed: de las de bstan pa'i bsam 'byung zhing /
translated: From that, the thought of teaching arises.

original: de las brjod par 'dod pa de las ni sgra 'byung ba yin no //🔽de'i phyir gang gi tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i don mthong ba'am /
analyzed: de las brjod par 'dod pa de las ni sgra 'byung ba yin no // de'i phyir gang gi tshe mngon par 'dod pa'i don mthong ba'am /
translated: From that, the sound that is desired to be expressed arises.🔽Therefore, when one employs a word without the thought of seeing or understanding the desired meaning, then there is error.

original: rtogs pa'i bsam pa med par tshig sbyor ba de'i tshe 'khrul pa yin la don gzhan bstan par bsam pa na yang gsal bar 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bsam pa med par tshig sbyor ba de'i tshe 'khrul pa yin la don gzhan bstan par bsam pa na yang gsal bar 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: And when one intends to teach another meaning, there is also clear error.

original: sngar ni de ltar sgra rnams bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel pa khas blangs nas phyogs kyi chos nyid med pas tshad ma yin pa spangs pa yin la /
