original: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa mngon sum du bya ba lus dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po med pa mngon sum du bya ba lus dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the non-existence of the entity is not directly perceived.

original: des na dngos po med pa 'dzin par byed pa ni nges pa gang yin pa 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa 'dzin par byed pa ni nges pa gang yin pa 'di nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this very ascertainment is what apprehends the absence of entity.

original: yang gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa mngon sum du snang ba ma yin pa dang / ma dmigs kyang yod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa 'khrul par dogs pa de'i phyir shugs kyis dngos po med pa gzung du zin kyang mngon sum gyi tha snyad du byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa mngon sum du snang ba ma yin pa dang / ma dmigs kyang yod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa 'khrul par dogs pa de'i phyir shugs kyis dngos po med pa gzung du zin kyang mngon sum gyi tha snyad du byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, because of the absence of intrinsic reality, the non-entity does not appear in perception, and even though it is not observed because it exists, there is the doubt that non-observation is mistaken. Therefore, even though the non-entity is grasped by implication, it cannot be designated as perception.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pas ni nus te /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pas ni nus te /
translated: But it can be by the non-observation of appearance.

original: de yang gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis phyogs 'ga' zhig dmigs pa de'i phyir mngon sum nyid kyi byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'di na de yod pa ma yin no zhes tha snyad du phyed pa yin pas snga na med pa nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis phyogs 'ga' zhig dmigs pa de'i phyir mngon sum nyid kyi byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'di na de yod pa ma yin no zhes tha snyad du phyed pa yin pas snga na med pa nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir
translated: And that is because perception observes some part of it, and therefore, following the activity of perception itself, one determines conventionally, “It is not here.” Since prior non-existence is not ascertained,

original: tha snyad sgrub par byed par 'dod kyi dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad sgrub par byed par 'dod kyi dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that non-existence is established.

original: gang du khyab par bya ba med pa mngon sum gyis mi rtogs pa der ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa bsgrub ste /
analyzed: gang du khyab par bya ba med pa mngon sum gyis mi rtogs pa der ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa bsgrub ste /
translated: Where the pervaded is not apprehended by perception, there non-existence is established by the non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: dper na shing med pa'i phyir shing sha pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing med pa'i phyir shing sha pa med do zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “Because there is no tree, there is no śimśapā tree.”

original: 'dir grub pa'i phyir tha snyad sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir grub pa'i phyir tha snyad sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Here, because of establishment, there is the establishment of a convention.

original: mngon sum gyis dngos po med pa grub pa de'i phyir /🔽tshad ma gcig gi bya ba ni de yongs su gcod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dbang po'i blo rtog pa dang bral bar sgrub par @26a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis dngos po med pa grub pa de'i phyir / tshad ma gcig gi bya ba ni de yongs su gcod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / dbang po'i blo rtog pa dang bral bar sgrub par @26a * //
translated: Because non-existence is established by perception,🔽the function of one valid cognition is to eliminate that, and so on, and the establishment of the cognition of the sense faculty as free from conceptuality

original: byed pa ni mngon sum nyid do zhes bya ba dang / dngos po med pa ni bum pa dang bral ba'i phyogs dang de'i shes pa nyid yin no zhes de dang der bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni mngon sum nyid do zhes bya ba dang / dngos po med pa ni bum pa dang bral ba'i phyogs dang de'i shes pa nyid yin no zhes de dang der bshad pa yin no //
translated: is perception itself, and the non-existence is the cognition of the place devoid of the pot itself, as explained in those and other passages.

original: gang zhig tha snyad la zhugs kyang rtog gi ngan pa 'ba' zhig goms pa las khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po la rmongs te dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gzhan yin par rtogs pa de ni rmongs ba yin par brjod de
analyzed: gang zhig tha snyad la zhugs kyang rtog gi ngan pa 'ba' zhig goms pa las khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po la rmongs te dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gzhan yin par rtogs pa de ni rmongs ba yin par brjod de
translated: Someone who engages in conventions but is confused about the nature of the pervasion and the pervaded due to habituation to only bad thoughts, who realizes that the cause of the convention of nonexistence is something else, is said to be confused.

original: / gzhan du na yod pa nyid kyis khyab par byed pa med pa las dngos po med pa'i tha snyad byed pa ji ltar na rmongs pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: / gzhan du na yod pa nyid kyis khyab par byed pa med pa las dngos po med pa'i tha snyad byed pa ji ltar na rmongs pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be confusion to use the convention of nonexistence from the absence of an existent that pervades?

original: de yang gang gi tshe rab tu grub pa'i yul gyi rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe rab tu grub pa'i yul gyi rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: Moreover, when one follows the object of thorough accomplishment,

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni mi dmigs pa nyid tsam yin no zhes rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni mi dmigs pa nyid tsam yin no zhes rtogs par byas te /
translated: one should understand that the cause of the convention of nonexistence is mere nonapprehension.

original: shes par 'dod pa'i yul la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du rang nyid kyis rtogs sam gzhan gyis bstan kyang rung ste /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa'i yul la dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du rang nyid kyis rtogs sam gzhan gyis bstan kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether one understands by oneself the convention of nonexistence with regard to the object one wishes to know or whether it is taught by another,

original: de'i tshe ni mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni mi dmigs pa rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: At that time, non-apprehension is a logical argument from the nature of things.

original: dmigs pa ni snang ba nyid kyis khyab par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni snang ba nyid kyis khyab par byed pa yin la /
translated: Apprehension is pervasion by appearance.

original: snang ba yang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa sngon du song ba las de'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med par nges pa las nges par byed de /
analyzed: snang ba yang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa sngon du song ba las de'i yul can gyi shes pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba med par nges pa las nges par byed de /
translated: And appearance is ascertained from the absence of incompleteness of the cause of the cognition that has as its object the entity that is mixed into a single cognition, which is preceded by the apprehension of that.

original: de'i phyir snang ba'i dngos po gzhan dang de'i mthong ba shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba'i dngos po gzhan dang de'i mthong ba shes pa dang shes bya'i ngo bo nyid ni mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the entity of appearance, which is other than that, and the cognition that sees it, which is the nature of the object of knowledge, is non-apprehension.

original: des ni dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: And by that, the suitability of the convention of non-existence is established.

original: rab tu grub pa'i yul ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa'i yul ni dpe yin te /
translated: The object of a well-established cognition is an example.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: yul yod na yang rmongs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yul yod na yang rmongs pa'i phyir //
translated: Even when the object exists, because of delusion,

original: gzhan dag rjes su mi brjod pa //
analyzed: gzhan dag rjes su mi brjod pa //
translated: Others do not express it.

original: grub pa dang ni chos mthun las //
analyzed: grub pa dang ni chos mthun las //
translated: From what is established and what is similar,

original: brda dran byed pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: brda dran byed pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is merely a reminder of the convention.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig gang la ma rmongs pa de ni de la khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gang la ma rmongs pa de ni de la khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du byed la /
translated: Therefore, when someone is not confused about something, he is said to conventionally designate the nonexistence of the pervasion by means of nonapprehension.

original: gang zhig gang la rmongs pa de ni de la mi dmigs pa de nyid rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la ;
analyzed: gang zhig gang la rmongs pa de ni de la mi dmigs pa de nyid rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin la ;
translated: When someone is confused about something, that very nonapprehension is a natural reason.

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du rab tu grub pa nyid kyang dpe yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du rab tu grub pa nyid kyang dpe yin te /
translated: And the example is the very establishment as the object of the designation of nonexistence.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan nyid du rab tu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan nyid du rab tu 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the establishment of that mere reason.

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi med pa'i tha snyad ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi med pa'i tha snyad ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no designation of nonexistence that is preceded by perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di 'ga' zhig tu 'gog par byed pa yang @26b mngon sum gyis ni bya bar rigs pa ma yin te zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes de dang de dag tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di 'ga' zhig tu 'gog par byed pa yang @26b mngon sum gyis ni bya bar rigs pa ma yin te zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes de dang de dag tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also explained in other places that it is not right to refute it by perception, as will be explained in the line, “Perception is not right to do anything,” and that all refutations are from nonapprehension.

original: mngon sum du snang ba'i yul gyi dngos po la yang /
analyzed: mngon sum du snang ba'i yul gyi dngos po la yang /
translated: Also, with regard to a thing that is an object that appears in a direct perception,

original: rmongs pa la ni mtshan nyid pa'i rjes su dpag pa las tha snyad du 'gyur /
analyzed: rmongs pa la ni mtshan nyid pa'i rjes su dpag pa las tha snyad du 'gyur /
translated: for one who is confused, a convention is from an inference that is in accordance with reality.

original: rmongs pa ma yin pa ni mngon sum nyid las so //
analyzed: rmongs pa ma yin pa ni mngon sum nyid las so //
translated: For one who is not confused, it is from a direct perception itself.

original: khyad par can gyi shing gi rnam pa 'ga' zhig las shing gi tha snyad zhugs su zin kyang lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam nyid tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin par ni ma nges te mthong ba'i rnam pa de nyid la yang rgyu mtshan nyid
analyzed: khyad par can gyi shing gi rnam pa 'ga' zhig las shing gi tha snyad zhugs su zin kyang lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam nyid tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan yin par ni ma nges te mthong ba'i rnam pa de nyid la yang rgyu mtshan nyid
translated: Even though the convention “tree” is engaged in relation to some particular aspect of a tree, it is not ascertained that mere possession of leaves and so on is the reason for the convention.

original: yin par the tshom za ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yin par the tshom za ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: With regard to that very aspect that is seen, there is doubt as to whether it is the reason.

original: de'i rnam pa dang bral ba mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la tha snyad kyi yul nyid du mi dran pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang bral ba mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid la tha snyad kyi yul nyid du mi dran pa yin te /
translated: When one sees that which is free from that aspect, one does not recall it as the object of the convention.

original: dper na ba lang chung du dgal ba lang gi tha snyad zhugs kyang ba lang chen po la mi dran pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang chung du dgal ba lang gi tha snyad zhugs kyang ba lang chen po la mi dran pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though the convention “ox” is engaged in relation to a young ox, it is not recalled in relation to a large ox.

original: rmongs pa de yang ci zhig ltar rab tu grub pa'i yul gyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: rmongs pa de yang ci zhig ltar rab tu grub pa'i yul gyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Moreover, that delusion follows the object that is established in some way.

original: de tsam nyid rgyu mtshan yin par rig par byas te /
analyzed: de tsam nyid rgyu mtshan yin par rig par byas te /
translated: It is known that that alone is the reason.

original: 'dod pa'i don la tha snyad du rang nyid kyis khong du chud dam gzhan gyis de la rtogs par byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don la tha snyad du rang nyid kyis khong du chud dam gzhan gyis de la rtogs par byas kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether one understands the desired object conventionally by oneself or causes another to understand it,

original: rjes su dpag pa las tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: one acts conventionally on the basis of inference.

original: rgyu mtshan nges pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum kho nas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nges pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum kho nas 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is ascertained as a reason is only by direct perception.

original: don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba med par rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid mthong ba'i don du zhen par byas pa de'i tha snyad ni mngon sum du 'gro ba yin gyi dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni de ltar nam
analyzed: don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba med par rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i tha snyad du rung ba nyid mthong ba'i don du zhen par byas pa de'i tha snyad ni mngon sum du 'gro ba yin gyi dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni de ltar nam
translated: The conventional that is seen as suitable for the appearance in thought without following another object is conceived for the purpose of seeing the object. That conventional proceeds by direct perception. The conventional of non-entity is never like that.

original: yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin no //
translated: It is never preceded by direct perception.

original: ma dmigs kyang yod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa la rtag tu 'khrul par dogs pas /
analyzed: ma dmigs kyang yod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa la rtag tu 'khrul par dogs pas /
translated: But since it is not the case that it does not exist even though it is not perceived, it is not always possible to be mistaken about nonperception.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pas dngos po med par tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of an entity is conventionally expressed by the nonperception of an appearance, not by direct perception.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dmigs pa med pa la ni rmongs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dmigs pa med pa la ni rmongs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: And since there is no confusion about the nonapprehension of an object of knowledge,

original: rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa yang dag par rigs pa nyid kyis nges pa des na mngon sum gyis tha snyad du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu nges pa'i shes pa yang dag par rigs pa nyid kyis nges pa des na mngon sum gyis tha snyad du byed pa yin te /
translated: it is certain that the cognition is correct. Therefore, the conventional expression is made by direct perception.

original: des na mngon sum de nyid la mi dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes kyang bshad zin to //
analyzed: des na mngon sum de nyid la mi dmigs pa zhes bya'o zhes kyang bshad zin to //
translated: And it is that direct perception that is called nonapprehension.

original: de bzhin du yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni dmigs pa yin te /🔽des na rgyu med pa'i phyir @27a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni dmigs pa yin te / des na rgyu med pa'i phyir @27a * //
translated: Similarly, the cause of the conventional expression of existence is apprehension.

original: ma dmigs kyang de la 'jug par byed pa bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma dmigs kyang de la 'jug par byed pa bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no cause, the engagement in that is stopped even though it is not apprehended.

original: dmigs pa nyid don rnams kyi yod pa yin pas de med na yod pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par bya ba ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid don rnams kyi yod pa yin pas de med na yod pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par bya ba ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: Since the object itself is the existence of things, if it does not exist, it cannot be engaged in the convention of existence.

original: pha ma yin pa 'ga' zhig la skyed byed ma yin par smra bas pha'i tha snyad 'jug pa zlog par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pha ma yin pa 'ga' zhig la skyed byed ma yin par smra bas pha'i tha snyad 'jug pa zlog par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like, for example, the case of someone who is a father but is not a progenitor, where the convention of “father” is negated.

original: mjug bsdu ba ni de'i phyir rang gis grub pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba ni de'i phyir rang gis grub pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The conclusion is: Therefore, it is not established by itself.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa la brtan nas rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa ma nges pa ni bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste go bar byed pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa la brtan nas rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa ma nges pa ni bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i sgrub par byed pa ste go bar byed pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: In dependence on a perceptual cognition, the non-ascertainment of non-establishment by own nature is established by a proof that is related to the self, that is, by a means of knowledge.

original: go bar byed pa de yang ji lta bu'i khyad par can zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: go bar byed pa de yang ji lta bu'i khyad par can zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of means of knowledge is it?

original: mi 'khrul pa zhes bya bas go bar byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad de /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa zhes bya bas go bar byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bshad de /
translated: “Non-erroneous” explains the nature of the means of knowledge.

original: go bar bya ba'i don la 'khrul pa med pa gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: go bar bya ba'i don la 'khrul pa med pa gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa'o //
translated: That which is non-erroneous with regard to the object to be known is a means of knowledge.

original: de yang de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is related to such a self.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'i bdag nyid dag gis ma 'brel pa la ni mi 'khrul pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'i bdag nyid dag gis ma 'brel pa la ni mi 'khrul pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not related by the identity of being the same or being a product is not nonerroneous.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don te /
translated: The word “because” means the reason.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i dngos po ni bdag dang 'brel pa can kho na las rtogs par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ma yin pa'i dngos po ni bdag dang 'brel pa can kho na las rtogs par bya ba yin la /
translated: Because a thing that is not directly perceived is to be understood only from that which is related to the self.

original: 'brel pa la brten nas lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa la brten nas lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: And the understanding of a hidden object based on a relation is inference.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is not direct perception

original: tshad ma gang zhig mngon sum las tha dad pa de ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma gang zhig mngon sum las tha dad pa de ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: is not different from inference,

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: but is just inference.

original: gang zhig mngon sum las tha dad cing rjes su dpag pa las kyang gzhan du gyur pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum las tha dad cing rjes su dpag pa las kyang gzhan du gyur pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Whatever is different from direct perception and also different from inference is not a valid cognition.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba nyid stongs btab pa nyid du bsams nas grangs gnyis nyid kyang dgag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa spang bar 'dod nas smras pa /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa gsum la sogs pa'i grangs bsal ba nyid stongs btab pa nyid du bsams nas grangs gnyis nyid kyang dgag pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa spang bar 'dod nas smras pa /
translated: The Lokāyatas and so on, thinking that the refutation of the existence of the three—the past, the future, and so on—is itself refuted, and wishing to refute inference in order to refute the existence of two valid cognitions, say:

original: mngon sum ma yin pa mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa mngon sum las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no //
translated: “That which is not direct perception is not a valid cognition other than direct perception.”

original: gang gi phyir de ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo po la phyin ci log gi rnam pa can yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo po la phyin ci log gi rnam pa can yin la /
translated: Because it is a mistaken form with regard to the nature of things.

original: phyin ci log kyang tshad ma nyid yin na ni tshad ma rnams kyi nges pa gang las yin /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang tshad ma nyid yin na ni tshad ma rnams kyi nges pa gang las yin /
translated: If a mistake were a valid cognition, then what would be the point of valid cognitions?

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni mi gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni mi gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Likewise, an effect as a logical reason is not tenable.

original: autpala las skyes pa'i autpala ni ba lang gi lci ba las kyang mthong la /
analyzed: autpala las skyes pa'i autpala ni ba lang gi lci ba las kyang mthong la /
translated: A lotus born from an utpala flower is seen to grow from cow dung.

original: de @27b bzhin du me dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las kyang me yin no //
analyzed: de @27b bzhin du me dang gtsub shing gtsubs pa las kyang me yin no //
translated: Likewise, fire is also produced from the rubbing together of sticks.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang de'i bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyang de'i bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Even though the reason of intrinsic nature is not distinguished in terms of its nature, the arising of the effect immediately after the exertion is the proof of impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni 'di'i ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni 'di'i ma yin no //
translated: Impermanence is not the proof of that.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also unreasonable.

original: rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction in the reason.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kho na de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kho na de'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The arising of the effect immediately after the exertion is not the intrinsic nature of the effect.

original: 'brel pa ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation is based on two things.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'di gnyis nges par mi gnas pa des ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs 'di gnyis nges par mi gnas pa des ni rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because these two, the effect and intrinsic nature reasons, are not ascertained, it is unreasonable to say that inference is not a valid form of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis kyang gzung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid ni thob par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum gyis kyang gzung ba'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid ni thob par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Because direct perception cannot obtain the very thing that is apprehended,

original: skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary.

original: 'on kyang tha dad pa med par lhag par zhen par byas pa dngos po de nyid kyi rgyu 'jug pa'i yul yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha dad pa med par lhag par zhen par byas pa dngos po de nyid kyi rgyu 'jug pa'i yul yin la /
translated: However, the cause of the engagement of that very thing that is the object of superimposition is the object of engagement that is the cause of the superimposition.

original: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i 'jug pa'i yul thob par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i 'jug pa'i yul thob par byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang bye brag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And the object of engagement that is the cause of the superimposition is obtained by inference as well, without any difference.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyi de thob par nus pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yang de med na mi 'byung ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyi de thob par nus pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan yang de med na mi 'byung ba kho na yin la /
translated: Thus, the very reason that direct perception is able to obtain it is that it is a cause that is necessarily concomitant with it.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is not different in inference either. This will be explained.

original: de'i phyir dngos po snang ba'i dbang gis ni 'ga' zhig kyang tshad mar rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po snang ba'i dbang gis ni 'ga' zhig kyang tshad mar rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nothing is posited as valid knowledge by the power of the appearance of a thing.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The inference of a result is also tenable.

original: rgyu tha dad pa thams cad la 'bras bu tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa thams cad la 'bras bu tha dad pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that all different causes have different effects.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, there is no error.

original: de bzhin du nges pa'i don ni go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nges pa'i don ni go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, the definitive meaning is that which causes understanding.

original: nges pa yang don 'ga' zhig ni so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor nges par byed de /
analyzed: nges pa yang don 'ga' zhig ni so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bor nges par byed de /
translated: And that which is definitive is that which causes ascertainment of some object as having a nature that is ascertained individually.

original: dper na shing sha pa la shing gi ngo bor nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing sha pa la shing gi ngo bor nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the ascertainment of the nature of a śimśapā as a tree.

original: yang 'ga' zhig ni nges pa na de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bor nges par byed de /
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig ni nges pa na de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bor nges par byed de /
translated: Moreover, when some object is ascertained, it causes ascertainment of the nature of that object as both that and not that.

original: dper na shing nyid la shing sha ba dang shing sha pa ma yin ba'i ngo bor nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shing nyid la shing sha ba dang shing sha pa ma yin ba'i ngo bor nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the ascertainment of the nature of a tree as both a śimśapā and not a śimśapā.

original: de la mi rtag pa tsam gyi ngo bor nges pa'i brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ni de'i go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa tsam gyi ngo bor nges pa'i brtsal ma thag tu byung ba ni de'i go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: With regard to that, the momentariness that is ascertained as the nature of impermanence is that which causes understanding.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i ngo bor nges pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyis go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i ngo bor nges pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid kyis go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of delusion, the impermanence that is ascertained as the nature of both is not understood by the mere occurrence of the investigation.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i ngo bo'i khyad par gyi @28a * //🔽mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni rtags med par nges par mi nus la /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i ngo bo'i khyad par gyi @28a * // mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni rtags med par nges par mi nus la /
translated: The impermanence that is the special nature of the mere occurrence of the investigation🔽cannot be ascertained without a reason.

original: nges nges na yang rtags nye bar blangs pa don med pa yin te /
analyzed: nges nges na yang rtags nye bar blangs pa don med pa yin te /
translated: And if it is ascertained, then the acceptance of the reason is pointless.

original: des na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nges par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nges par nus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a reason of nature is able to ascertain.

original: gzhan yang de spong bar byed pas de nyid khas blangs par mi rigs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la skur pa 'debs pa khyod kyis rjes su dpag pa khas len pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de spong bar byed pas de nyid khas blangs par mi rigs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la skur pa 'debs pa khyod kyis rjes su dpag pa khas len pa 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable for you, who deprecate inference, to accept inference, because you accept it in order to refute it.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
translated: He shows this with “because” and so on.

original: tshad ma dang cig shos de dag spyi'i tshul du bzhag pa gnas par byed pa ni spyi bzhag ste de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma dang cig shos de dag spyi'i tshul du bzhag pa gnas par byed pa ni spyi bzhag ste de'i phyir ro //
translated: The establishment of the general rule that valid cognitions and their objects exist is the establishment of the general rule.

original: spyi smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: spyi smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is the general rule mentioned?

original: 'di la shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi yul ni nyams su myong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi yul ni nyams su myong ba yin no //
translated: Some cognitions are the objects of experience.

original: nyams su myong ba 'ga' zhig ni yul nyams su myong ba med kyang yul dang dus dang gsal byed kyi khyad par dang / goms pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i dus nyid ni mngon sum nyid kyis tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par nges par nus pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba 'ga' zhig ni yul nyams su myong ba med kyang yul dang dus dang gsal byed kyi khyad par dang / goms pa'i dbang gis skye ba'i dus nyid ni mngon sum nyid kyis tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par nges par nus pa nyid yin te /
translated: Some experiences arise by the power of the object, the time, the particular manifesting agent, and the habit, even without the experience of the object. The time of their arising is capable of being ascertained as valid cognition or invalid cognition by direct perception itself.

original: 'khrul par dogs pa ni yul thag ring po'i shes pa'i gsal ba nyid la 'gyur gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dang po nyid du brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'khrul par dogs pa ni yul thag ring po'i shes pa'i gsal ba nyid la 'gyur gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang dang po nyid du brjod zin to //
translated: The doubt of error would occur only in the case of the cognition of a distant object, not in all cases. This has already been stated earlier.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa med par ni nyams su myong ba dang ma myong ba rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa rnams la tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i spyi dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa med par ni nyams su myong ba dang ma myong ba rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa rnams la tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i spyi dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, without inference, there would be no valid cognition or invalid cognition in regard to the experiences and non-experiences in one’s own and another’s continuum. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: gzhan gyi blo shes par byed pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi blo shes par byed pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: And also because of the cognition of another’s mind.

original: lus las tha dad pa ni mngon sum gyis shes par mi nus so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lus las tha dad pa ni mngon sum gyis shes par mi nus so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not possible to cognize something different from the body by means of perception.

original: 'gog par zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa'i tha snyad la brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gog par zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa'i tha snyad la brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: “To be stopped” is to be expressed by the convention of cessation.

original: de'i phyir yang tshad ma gzhan srid par khyod nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang tshad ma gzhan srid par khyod nyid kyis khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, you yourself have accepted that another valid cognition is possible.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa med par ni dgag pa'i tha snyad du bya bar mi nus so zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa med par ni dgag pa'i tha snyad du bya bar mi nus so zhes bshad zin to //
translated: For thus, without inference, it is not possible to make the convention of cessation. This has already been explained.

original: de shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma gzhan srid pa'i gtan tshigs dang po 'chad do //
analyzed: de shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma gzhan srid pa'i gtan tshigs dang po 'chad do //
translated: The first reason for the possibility of another valid cognition is explained by “because of the cognition of that . . . ” and so forth.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa de mngon sum tshad ma ste slu ba med pa can yin la /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa de mngon sum tshad ma ste slu ba med pa can yin la /
translated: The Lokāyatas are those who have direct valid knowledge, which is nondeceptive.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni nye bar ston pa sma ba'i rnam pa ston te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni nye bar ston pa sma ba'i rnam pa ston te /
translated: This shows that they are teachers who have a form of teaching that is not inference.

original: 'dis ni tshu rol mdzes pa la spyi'i tshul du khyad par can gyi nye bar bstan pa'i rnam par tshad ma dang cig shos 'jog @28b par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshu rol mdzes pa la spyi'i tshul du khyad par can gyi nye bar bstan pa'i rnam par tshad ma dang cig shos 'jog @28b par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the Lokāyatas have a form of valid knowledge that is a special kind of teaching that is a general method.

original: da ni 'di ltar nye bar ston pa las ni ci nas kyang rjes su dpag pa nges par khas blang bar bya'o zhes de ltar ston pa nye bar ston pa na nye bar ston pa'i rgyu dang dgos pa 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: da ni 'di ltar nye bar ston pa las ni ci nas kyang rjes su dpag pa nges par khas blang bar bya'o zhes de ltar ston pa nye bar ston pa na nye bar ston pa'i rgyu dang dgos pa 'chad par byed do //
translated: Now, in order to show that inference must definitely be accepted, he explains the cause and purpose of the teaching.

original: dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig mi slu ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig mi slu ba ste /
translated: Some cognitions that are based on the sense faculties are nondeceptive.

original: don yod pa thob par nus pa dang / yid kyis shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig slu bar dmigs nas te /
analyzed: don yod pa thob par nus pa dang / yid kyis shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig slu bar dmigs nas te /
translated: They are able to obtain a real object. Some cognitions that are mental are seen to be deceptive.

original: shes nas smra ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: shes nas smra ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i rgyu ston to //
translated: The phrase “having understood, one speaks” shows the cause of understanding the definition of valid knowledge.

original: slu ba dang mi slu ba yongs su ma shes par ni de'i mtshan nyid shes par mi nus la /
analyzed: slu ba dang mi slu ba yongs su ma shes par ni de'i mtshan nyid shes par mi nus la /
translated: One cannot understand the definition of valid knowledge without understanding what is deceptive and what is nondeceptive.

original: slu ba dang mi slu ba can shes na ni mtshan nyid gang yin pa de shes te /
analyzed: slu ba dang mi slu ba can shes na ni mtshan nyid gang yin pa de shes te /
translated: If one understands what is deceptive and what is nondeceptive, then one understands whatever is its definition.

original: yongs su ma shes na mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa mtshan nyid du 'dus pa des na rang gi sgras ma brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes na mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa mtshan nyid du 'dus pa des na rang gi sgras ma brjod do //
translated: Since it is not the definition if it is not understood, the definition is included in the understanding. Therefore, it is not expressed by the word “itself.”

original: de'i mtshan nyid la khyab pa ni gsal ba ma lus pa yongs su zin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid la khyab pa ni gsal ba ma lus pa yongs su zin pa ste /
translated: The pervasion of its definition is the complete possession of every instance.

original: de rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: Since it is the cause of that.

original: 'di skad du re zhig shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig la slu ba dang mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de shes nas rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa de'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa ma lus pa la thob bar nus pa'i mi slu
analyzed: 'di skad du re zhig shes pa'i gsal ba 'ga' zhig la slu ba dang mi slu ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de shes nas rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa de'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa ma lus pa la thob bar nus pa'i mi slu
translated: In this way, having understood what is deceptive and what is nondeceptive in some instance of understanding, one is able to extend that understanding of the definition to every instance of understanding in one’s own and others’ continuums.

original: ba dang / cig shos la de las bzlog par shes par byas te /
analyzed: ba dang / cig shos la de las bzlog par shes par byas te /
translated: and the other is the opposite of that.

original: des na yul ma lus pa la nye bar ston par byed do zhes brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na yul ma lus pa la nye bar ston par byed do zhes brjod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that he teaches all objects without exception.

original: 'dis ni nye bar ston pa'i rgyu brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye bar ston pa'i rgyu brjod do //
translated: This explains the cause of teaching.

original: gal te 'di snyam du ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i yul gyi shes pa nyid nye bar ston par byed do snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i yul gyi shes pa nyid nye bar ston par byed do snyam na bshad pa /
translated: If one thinks that the consciousness of an object that is experienced teaches, then it is said:

original: ji ltar nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: As it is taught.

original: nye bar bstan pa las ma 'das par slob ma 'jug pa na mi 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa las ma 'das par slob ma 'jug pa na mi 'khrul pa ste /
translated: When the student is engaged in what is taught, without going beyond the teaching, there is no error.

original: mi slu bar bya ba'i don dgos pa smra ba'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi slu bar bya ba'i don dgos pa smra ba'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni de lta bu'o //
translated: That which has the nature of speaking for the purpose of the object to be taught is like that.

original: 'dis ni smras pa'i dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni smras pa'i dgos pa bstan to //
translated: This explains the purpose of speaking.

original: 'di skad du ston pa po gang yin pa de ni nye bar ston pa gang gis don byed pa don du gnyer ba gzhan dag slu bar mi 'gyur ba de nyid bstan par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad du ston pa po gang yin pa de ni nye bar ston pa gang gis don byed pa don du gnyer ba gzhan dag slu bar mi 'gyur ba de nyid bstan par bya ba yin na /
translated: This is what is said: The teacher is that by which the student is engaged in the teaching, without going beyond the teaching, so that the one who seeks the purpose is not deceived.

original: ston pa po rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa las ni gzhan dag mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston pa po rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa las ni gzhan dag mi 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because others are not engaged by the valid knowledge or invalid knowledge that exists in the mindstream of the teacher.

original: de dag la 'jug pa na slu ba dang mi slu ba thob pa dang spang ba'i don du /
analyzed: de dag la 'jug pa na slu ba dang mi slu ba thob pa dang spang ba'i don du /
translated: When they are engaged, it is for the purpose of obtaining nondeception and abandoning deception.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa nye bar bstan pas ci zhig bya /🔽de'i @29a * //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa nye bar bstan pas ci zhig bya / de'i @29a * //
translated: What is the point of teaching the valid knowledge or invalid knowledge that exists in one’s own mindstream?

original: phyir rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa spyir tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa spyir tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par bstan par bya ba yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it is taught that in general, the valid knowledge or invalid knowledge that exists in one’s own and others’ mindstreams should be taught.🔽“🔽As it is” is as it is taught. “

original: ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nye bar bstan par bya ba de ltar bsgrubs pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nye bar bstan par bya ba de ltar bsgrubs pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: As it is established” is ascertained.

original: bsgrubs pa skyes bu rang gi shes pa'i yul du nye bar son cing nges par ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa nyid la bsgrubs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa skyes bu rang gi shes pa'i yul du nye bar son cing nges par ston par byed pa yin pa'i phyir nges pa nyid la bsgrubs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because that which is established is that which is ascertained and is taught as having arrived at the object of the person’s own consciousness, it is called “established.”

original: ma nges pa ni ston par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar nye bar ston pa rang gis shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni ston par byed mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar nye bar ston pa rang gis shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The uncertain is not capable of teaching, so how can it be a means of knowing?

original: de yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: And how is that known?

original: chos mthun pa mthong ba las so //
analyzed: chos mthun pa mthong ba las so //
translated: From seeing a similar instance.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: That means a valid cognition or an invalid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir gsal ba 'ga' zhig tu mtshan nyid de la mi slu ba nyid kyis khyab par nges te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal ba 'ga' zhig tu mtshan nyid de la mi slu ba nyid kyis khyab par nges te /
translated: Because the nature of a valid cognition is ascertained to be nondeceptive in some instances,

original: des na khyab par bya ba srid pa'i gsal ba thams cad la khyab par byed pa yang srid bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyab par bya ba srid pa'i gsal ba thams cad la khyab par byed pa yang srid bar byed pa yin no //
translated: then it is possible that it is nondeceptive in all possible instances.

original: 'ga' zhig tu khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nges par byas te khyab par bya ba nges pa sngon du song ba can gyi yod pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba las ma 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nges par byas te khyab par bya ba nges pa sngon du song ba can gyi yod pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba las ma 'das pa yin la /
translated: Having ascertained the relation of pervasion in some instances, the existence of the pervaded in a particular instance is necessarily inferred.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
translated: And that which is to be inferred is the object of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yang tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that inference is not established as valid cognition.

original: des na tshad ma ma yin pas yul du byas pa gang yin pa de yang bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma yin pas yul du byas pa gang yin pa de yang bden pa ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, since it is not valid cognition, whatever is taken to be its object is not true, so what is the use of teaching it?

original: smig rgyu'i shes pa'i yul ni bden pa nyid du nye bar bstan par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i shes pa'i yul ni bden pa nyid du nye bar bstan par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: The object of the cognition of a mirage is not suitable to be taught as true.

original: 'di la ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is taught that there is an inference for one’s own benefit that engages by the power of the thing.

original: 'dir mi slu bas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir mi slu bas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the definition of being pervaded by nondeception?

original: de la tshu rol mdzes pa pas ni don 'dzin pa de'i mtshan nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: de la tshu rol mdzes pa pas ni don 'dzin pa de'i mtshan nyid du 'dod la /
translated: In this regard, the Cārvāka assert that the definition of that apprehension of an object is that it is not deceptive.

original: kho bo cag ni don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du'o //
translated: We assert that it is the nonarising of an object when it does not exist.

original: kho bo cag gi ltar na don med na mi 'byung ba tsam nyid don thob par nus pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ltar na don med na mi 'byung ba tsam nyid don thob par nus pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: According to us, the mere nonarising of an object when it does not exist is the reason for the ability to attain the object.

original: gzhan gyi ltar na don 'dzin pa tsam rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltar na don 'dzin pa tsam rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: According to the other party, the reason is the mere apprehension of the object.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis 'dod pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba dang / pha rol gyi don 'dzin pa nyid la gzhan la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis khyab bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gis 'dod pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba dang / pha rol gyi don 'dzin pa nyid la gzhan la ltos pa med pa nyid kyis khyab bo //
translated: Therefore, the absence of the object that we accept is pervaded by the absence of dependence on another, and the apprehension of the object of the other party is pervaded by the absence of dependence on another.

original: gal te de yod na yang thob par nus pa med na ni /
analyzed: gal te de yod na yang thob par nus pa med na ni /
translated: If it exists, but one is unable to attain it,

original: gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas ltos pa med @29b pa nyid de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas ltos pa med @29b pa nyid de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would depend on another, and so the absence of dependence would be contradicted.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na rjes su 'gro ba grub pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na rjes su 'gro ba grub pas /
translated: Therefore, since the observation of a contradiction in the pervader establishes the concomitance,

original: khyab par bya ba don med na mi 'byung ba nyid dang don 'dzin pa nyid yod pa na khyab par byed pa tshad ma nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni kho bo cag gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba don med na mi 'byung ba nyid dang don 'dzin pa nyid yod pa na khyab par byed pa tshad ma nyid yod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni kho bo cag gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: the pervaded, the absence of the object that we accept, and the apprehension of the object of the other party, are pervaded by the existence of the pervader, valid knowledge. This is our syllogism of the nature of the two.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i yul la yang rgyu mtshan med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i yul la yang rgyu mtshan med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the object of nonvalid cognition is also without reason.

original: de tsam nyid la ltos pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de tsam nyid la ltos pa'i tshad ma med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition that depends on that alone.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rjes su dpag pa kho nas tshad ma ma yin pa rtogs nas nye bar ston pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rjes su dpag pa kho nas tshad ma ma yin pa rtogs nas nye bar ston pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, having understood nonvalid cognition only through inference, he teaches it.

original: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa cung zad kyang nye bar bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ma grub pa'i phyir tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa cung zad kyang nye bar bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: And because that is not established, he does not teach valid cognition and nonvalid cognition at all.

original: gal te rang gi rgyud la yod pa nye bar bstan par bya ba yod pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la /🔽yul nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyud la yod pa nye bar bstan par bya ba yod pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa la / yul nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you doubt that he does not teach what exists in his own mindstream,🔽he says, “The object of experience, etc.

original: nyams su myong ba'i yul can gang yin pa dag go ;
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i yul can gang yin pa dag go ;
translated: ” The object of experience is the subject.

original: / rnam pa gnyis kyis yul nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: / rnam pa gnyis kyis yul nyams su myong ste /
translated: The object is experienced in two ways:

original: don thob pa dang goms pa'i dbang gis don med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i shes pa ni yul nyams su myong ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don thob pa dang goms pa'i dbang gis don med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i shes pa ni yul nyams su myong ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The cognition that is ascertained not to occur without the object by the power of obtaining the object and by the power of cultivation is called the experience of the object.

original: yul nyams su myong ba ma gtogs pa zhes smras pa na yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i gsal ba rnams ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par grub par smras pa ste /
analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba ma gtogs pa zhes smras pa na yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i gsal ba rnams ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par grub par smras pa ste /
translated: If it is said that the clarity of the consciousness that experiences the object is a valid cognition or not a valid cognition,

original: de dag kyang rjes su dpag pa las tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par khong du chud pa yin na ni ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rjes su dpag pa las tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin par khong du chud pa yin na ni ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the words “except for” are not tenable, because if it is understood that it is a valid cognition or not a valid cognition through inference, then it is understood that it is a valid cognition or not a valid cognition through inference.

original: de la mngon sum de nyid kyis don med na mi 'byung ba gzung ba nges pa nyid 'di tsam zhig ni mngon sum gyi bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la mngon sum de nyid kyis don med na mi 'byung ba gzung ba nges pa nyid 'di tsam zhig ni mngon sum gyi bya ba yin la /
translated: With regard to that, the mere apprehension of the object that does not occur if the object does not exist is just the activity of direct perception.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa gzhan gyis ni the tshom sel ba yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i shes pa gzhan gyis ni the tshom sel ba yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: It has already been said that a later consciousness that arises eliminates doubt.

original: brdzun pa'i don can gyi mtshan nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid kyang shes pa snga ma'i yul la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa phyi mas nges par byed pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis nges pa yin gyi rjes su dpag pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i don can gyi mtshan nyid tshad ma ma yin pa nyid kyang shes pa snga ma'i yul la gnod par byed pa'i shes pa phyi mas nges par byed pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis nges pa yin gyi rjes su dpag pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The definition of a nonvalid cognition is also ascertained by direct perception, because a later cognition that invalidates the object of a prior cognition determines that the prior cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: gang zhig rtogs pa'i dus nyid na gang rtogs pa de dag ni rtags dang rtags can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rtogs pa'i dus nyid na gang rtogs pa de dag ni rtags dang rtags can ma yin te /
translated: But at the time of understanding, the object and the cognition are not the signifier and the signified,

original: dper na sa phyogs dang bum pa med pa dag rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir go bya go byed ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa phyogs dang bum pa med pa dag rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir go bya go byed ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the place and the absence of a pot are not the signifier and the signified, because they are not understood separately.

original: de bzhin du gnod par byed @30a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod par byed @30a * //
translated: Similarly, the object of invalidation is understood,

original: pa'i yul yod par rtogs pa nyid kyi tshe snga mas don mi bden pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa mngon sum gyis khor du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i yul yod par rtogs pa nyid kyi tshe snga mas don mi bden pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa mngon sum gyis khor du chud pa yin no //
translated: and at the time of understanding the object of invalidation, the prior cognition is understood to be false, so the nonvalidity is understood by direct perception.

original: de dag ni gsal ba las yod pa yin la de yang bstan par nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bstan du med pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: de dag ni gsal ba las yod pa yin la de yang bstan par nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bstan du med pa zhes smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they exist by way of clarity and that they cannot be demonstrated, he says, “indemonstrable.”

original: bstan par mi nus pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: bstan par mi nus pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dag go //
translated: They are characterized as not being able to be demonstrated.

original: rjes su dpag pa spangs pas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyi chos med pa'i phyir mi slu bas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid dang cig shos gang yin pa dag bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa spangs pas khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa nyid kyi chos med pa'i phyir mi slu bas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid dang cig shos gang yin pa dag bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no object of inference, there is no pervasion, and because there is no pervasion, there is no valid cognition.

original: ji ltar de nye bar ston par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar de nye bar ston par byed /
translated: How can they be demonstrated?

original: ci ste yul nyams su myong ba'i gsal ba cung zad cig nye bar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan du brtags pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: ci ste yul nyams su myong ba'i gsal ba cung zad cig nye bar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan du brtags pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if one imagines that some slight clarity of the experience of objects is demonstrated,

original: nye bar bstan pa de dag ni cung zad kyang nye bar mkho ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni rang gi rgyud la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa de dag ni cung zad kyang nye bar mkho ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni rang gi rgyud la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: in that case, those demonstrations are not at all necessary.

original: de dag gis kyang 'di gzhan las tha snyad bya bar mi dbang ste /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang 'di gzhan las tha snyad bya bar mi dbang ste /
translated: They are not fit to be the subject of conventions with others,

original: gzhan la tha snyad rjes su rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la tha snyad rjes su rtogs par mi nus pa'o //
translated: because they are not able to understand conventions with others.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa ste 'jug par byed pa nyid du gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa ste 'jug par byed pa nyid du gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not the object of indication, they are not known by others as the instigator.

original: ci'i phyir mtshon par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshon par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not the object of indication?

original: gang gi phyir ston pa po rang gi rgyud la yod pa de ni shes par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis 'jug par byed pa nyid du mtshon par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pa po rang gi rgyud la yod pa de ni shes par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyis 'jug par byed pa nyid du mtshon par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the teacher who exists in his own continuum is not the object of knowledge, therefore others are not able to indicate him as the instigator.

original: nye bar bstan par bya ba ni 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bstan par bya ba ni 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid yin te /
translated: That which is to be indicated is a limb of engagement.

original: des na 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa de dag ni nye bar bstan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin pa de dag ni nye bar bstan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore those that are not limbs of engagement are not the object of indication. This is the result of valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir pha rol pos gzhan 'jug pa'i yan lag tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol pos gzhan 'jug pa'i yan lag tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise that reveals valid knowledge and invalid knowledge is not a means of engaging others.🔽If it were to do so,

original: byed na yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos byed na yang /
analyzed: byed na yang zhes bya ba ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos byed na yang /
translated: then even if one were to compose a treatise that reveals valid knowledge and invalid knowledge,

original: rang nyid kyi tshad ma dang cig shos nye bar ston pa'i 'jug pa la co 'dri bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyi tshad ma dang cig shos nye bar ston pa'i 'jug pa la co 'dri bar byed pa yin te /
translated: one would be ridiculed for engaging in the revelation of one’s own valid knowledge and the invalidity of that of others.

original: bzhad gang du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhad gang du byed pa yin no //
translated: One would be the object of laughter.

original: 'di ltar nye bar ston pa'i dgos pa ni gang zhig nye bar bstan pa las mngon sum tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar ston pa'i dgos pa ni gang zhig nye bar bstan pa las mngon sum tshad ma yin la /
translated: The purpose of revelation is for the opponent to understand that the one who is revealed is a valid perception,

original: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes pha rol pos rtogs pa 'di nyid yin na /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes pha rol pos rtogs pa 'di nyid yin na /
translated: whereas the other is not.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes smras pa na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par bya bas /
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes smras pa na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par bya bas /
translated: If one says that inference is not a valid form of knowledge, then by making inference not a valid form of knowledge,

original: gzhan rtogs par @30b bya ba'i don du mngon sum tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs par @30b bya ba'i don du mngon sum tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: the purpose of revealing the other is to make him understand.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa de nyid rang nyid kyis bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa de nyid rang nyid kyis bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then he would be contradicting himself, because he himself has already said that it is not inference.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs nas de skad brjod pa yin pa des na de tshad ma ma yin na de yang med par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pas rtogs nas de skad brjod pa yin pa des na de tshad ma ma yin na de yang med par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is not a valid cognition, then it would be pointless to say that one understands something through inference and then says something about it.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes smras pa ni gang bdag gis brjod pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes smras pa ni gang bdag gis brjod pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur la /
translated: So when he says that inference is not a valid cognition, he is saying that what I have said is not so, but that is not the case.

original: de lta na yang rang gi 'jug pa la co dris par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rang gi 'jug pa la co dris par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, he is contradicting his own position.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshad dang cig shos zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nye bar bkod pa'i gtan tshigs gzhung btsugs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshad dang cig shos zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nye bar bkod pa'i gtan tshigs gzhung btsugs nas /
translated: So, having thus established the first reason, “because it is a valid cognition or not,”

original: gtan tshigs gnyis pa gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyis pa gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: he explains the second reason, “because it is a valid cognition or not,” in order to establish the second reason.

original: gzhan de blo dang ldan pa khong du chud pa ni skabs kyi bstan bcos kyi don rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan de blo dang ldan pa khong du chud pa ni skabs kyi bstan bcos kyi don rtogs pa'o //
translated: The intelligent reader understands the meaning of the treatise from the context.

original: de'i don ni /
analyzed: de'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: de'i ched dam de grub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa ste 'god pas ji ltar rjes su dpag pa spangs pa yin /
analyzed: de'i ched dam de grub par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa ste 'god pas ji ltar rjes su dpag pa spangs pa yin /
translated: The treatise is composed in order to establish that, or in order to accomplish that, and thus how can it be the case that inference is rejected?

original: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it unreasonable?

original: smras pa / rjes su dpag pa de spong na bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rjes su dpag pa de spong na bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug pa 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: If inference is rejected, then engaging in the composition of a treatise is pointless.

original: rjes su dpag pa spangs pa'i phyir des nges par byas pa gzhan gyi sems kyang med par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa spangs pa'i phyir des nges par byas pa gzhan gyi sems kyang med par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since inference is rejected, it is also said that the ascertainment of the minds of others does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi sems med par dogs kyang gzhan bstan bcos kyi don khong du chud par the tshom za ba las bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems med par dogs kyang gzhan bstan bcos kyi don khong du chud par the tshom za ba las bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if one doubts the nonexistence of the minds of others, it is also unreasonable to engage in the composition of a treatise because of doubt that others will understand the meaning of the treatise.

original: smig rgyu'i shes pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pas nges pa'i don ni don med par nges pa'i phyir don du mi 'gyur bar the tshom za ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i shes pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pas nges pa'i don ni don med par nges pa'i phyir don du mi 'gyur bar the tshom za ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The meaning ascertained by inference is not ascertained to be meaningless, like the consciousness of a mirage, and thus it is not the case that doubt arises that it is meaningless.

original: don yod par the tshom za ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la bsnyon pas 'bras bu med pa'i bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don yod par the tshom za ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la bsnyon pas 'bras bu med pa'i bstan bcos byed pa la 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to compose a treatise that is a refutation of inference, since the meaning is doubtful.

original: mi spong na ni rjes su dpag pa med du zin kyang don yod par the tshom za ba las 'jug pa yin te zhing rmo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mi spong na ni rjes su dpag pa med du zin kyang don yod par the tshom za ba las 'jug pa yin te zhing rmo ba bzhin no //
translated: If one does not reject it, then even if inference does not exist, one would engage in it because the meaning is doubtful, just as one does with plowing a field.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa'i rjes su dpag pas spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos byed pa'i rjes su dpag pas spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to reject it with an inference that is the basis of a treatise.

original: gal te 'di snyam du blo ni lus las tha dad pa med pa yin /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du blo ni lus las tha dad pa med pa yin /
translated: If one thinks, “The mind is not separate from the body.

original: mthong ba na yang lus 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum de nyid de nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di la rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: mthong ba na yang lus 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum de nyid de nyid kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di la rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: When it is seen, the direct perception that apprehends the body also apprehends it. What is the use of inference in this case?”

original: smras pa / lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / lus nyid ni blo ma yin te /
translated: We say: The body itself is not the mind.

original: lus de grub ste mngon @31a * //
analyzed: lus de grub ste mngon @31a * //
translated: The body is established and ascertained by direct perception.

original: sum gyis nges kyang /
analyzed: sum gyis nges kyang /
translated: However, the mind is not like that.

original: blo'i rnam par brtag pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: blo'i rnam par brtag pa zhes bya ba /
translated: It is called “the one that is to be analyzed by the mind.”

original: blo nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pas blo gzhan las rnam par brtag par bya zhing khyad par du bya ba yin pas blo'i rnam par brtag pa ni blo'i khyad par te /
analyzed: blo nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pas blo gzhan las rnam par brtag par bya zhing khyad par du bya ba yin pas blo'i rnam par brtag pa ni blo'i khyad par te /
translated: The mind is to be distinguished, that is, differentiated, from other minds by the aspects of desire, etc.

original: de la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of the mind is the particular mind, because there is doubt about it.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ni khyad par yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba ni khyad par yin te /
translated: The object of direct perception is the particular,

original: spyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal is not a real entity.

original: blo yang mngon sum gyis rtogs na ni khyad par nyid nges par 'gyur na khyad par nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: blo yang mngon sum gyis rtogs na ni khyad par nyid nges par 'gyur na khyad par nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If the mind were understood by direct perception, then the particular itself would be ascertained, but the particular is not ascertained,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i the tshom nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i the tshom nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because doubt about it, which is contrary to that ascertainment, is seen.

original: spyir rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: spyir rtogs pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: The understanding of the universal is inference.

original: gal te shing grub kyang de nyid las tha dad pa med pa'i shing sha pa nyid la the tshom za la /
analyzed: gal te shing grub kyang de nyid las tha dad pa med pa'i shing sha pa nyid la the tshom za la /
translated: Even if a tree is established, there is doubt about the tree itself, which is not different from the oak tree.

original: sngon po nges kyang sngon po las tha dad pa med pa'i skad cig ma nyid ma grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po nges kyang sngon po las tha dad pa med pa'i skad cig ma nyid ma grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Even if blue is ascertained, is not the momentariness, which is not different from blue, not established?

original: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gyi rnam grangs rnam par brtag par bya ba'i sgra sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir khyad par gyi rnam grangs rnam par brtag par bya ba'i sgra sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the term “distinction” is to be supplied.

original: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa de grub pa na khyad par cig shos grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa de grub pa na khyad par cig shos grub pa kho na'o //
translated: When one is established as not different from the other, then the other is established as a distinction.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma nyid dang shing sha pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni mthong ba'i rang bzhin de nyid yin la de yang nges pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma nyid dang shing sha pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni mthong ba'i rang bzhin de nyid yin la de yang nges pa kho na'o //
translated: The nature of the seen is just that, the characteristic of momentariness and the distinction of the śimśapā tree, and that is ascertained.

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma nyid du ma nges pa yin la ma nges pa yang spyi'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir spyi'i rnam pa'i skad cig ma nyid ma grub pa yin gyi khyad par gyi rnam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma nyid du ma nges pa yin la ma nges pa yang spyi'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir spyi'i rnam pa'i skad cig ma nyid ma grub pa yin gyi khyad par gyi rnam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: However, momentariness is not ascertained, and because the non-ascertained is a general aspect, the momentariness of the general aspect is not established, but not the distinction.

original: mthong ba sngon po'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i skad cig ma nyid kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba sngon po'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i skad cig ma nyid kyi khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the distinction of momentariness is not different from the nature of the seen blue.

original: 'ga' zhig grub pa na khyad par gang zhig ma grub cing ma mthong ba de ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba de las gzhan nyid yin pas gcig pa nyid kyi tha snyad la ni de grub na grub pa nyid kyis khyab pa
analyzed: 'ga' zhig grub pa na khyad par gang zhig ma grub cing ma mthong ba de ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba de las gzhan nyid yin pas gcig pa nyid kyi tha snyad la ni de grub na grub pa nyid kyis khyab pa
translated: If something is established, then that which is not established and not seen as a particular is a phenomenon that possesses contradictory properties. Therefore, it is different from what is seen. If it is established, it is pervaded by being established.

original: yin la / khyab par byed pa de med pa nyid ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yin la / khyab par byed pa de med pa nyid ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The absence of that pervader is the reason.

original: gang zhig grub pa na /
analyzed: gang zhig grub pa na /
translated: If something is established,

original: gang gi khyad par ma grub pa de dag ni gcig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi khyad par ma grub pa de dag ni gcig nyid ma yin te /
translated: then that which is not established as a particular is not the same.

original: dper na dro ba dang sra ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dro ba dang sra ba dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like heat and solidity.

original: lus grub pa na blo'i khyad par grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus grub pa na blo'i khyad par grub pa ma yin no //
translated: When the body is established, the particular of the mind is not established.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: gang gi phyir chags pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rnam par nges pa dang 'gal ba ni the tshom yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chags pa la sogs pa'i blo'i rnam par nges pa dang 'gal ba ni the tshom yin la /
translated: Because the ascertainment of the mind of attachment and so on is doubt, which is contradictory.
