original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yang chags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / 'gal ba la sogs @31b pa'i rnam pa yin par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir rtsod pa yod pa ma yin pas lus grub kyang sra ba la sogs pa bzhin du the tshom za ba'i phyir ji ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par yang chags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / 'gal ba la sogs @31b pa'i rnam pa yin par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir rtsod pa yod pa ma yin pas lus grub kyang sra ba la sogs pa bzhin du the tshom za ba'i phyir ji ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin /
translated: The specific nature of consciousness is established by experience as having the aspect of attachment and so on, and the aspect of aversion and so on. Since there is no dispute, how can the reason be unestablished, like the body being doubted to be hard and so on?

original: de'i phyir sems pa ni chang gi nus pa dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems pa ni chang gi nus pa dang 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, intention is not like the potency of alcohol.

original: nus pa can dag las nus pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa can dag las nus pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because potency is not different from the potent.

original: chang las nus pa tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: chang las nus pa tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: Potency is not different from alcohol.

original: shes pa yod pa ni lus las tha dad pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa yod pa ni lus las tha dad pa'i khyad par can gyi rnam par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the existence of consciousness is established as having the distinction of being different from the body.

original: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nyid yang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nyid yang grub pa nyid do //
translated: The relation of pervaded and pervader is also established.

original: thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Everything is twofold:

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang bral ba dang de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang bral ba dang de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: free from contradictory properties and possessing them.

original: de la gcig nyid kyi tha snyad ni de dang bral ba la mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la gcig nyid kyi tha snyad ni de dang bral ba la mthong ngo //
translated: The term “one” is seen to be applied to that which is devoid of that.

original: gal te de dang ldan pa la 'jug na ni yul nges pa med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te de dang ldan pa la 'jug na ni yul nges pa med par 'gyur bas /
translated: If it were applied to that which possesses that, then the object would not be ascertained.

original: yul nges pa nyid kyis kyang khyab ste /
analyzed: yul nges pa nyid kyis kyang khyab ste /
translated: And because the object is ascertained, it is pervaded.

original: des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa na /🔽de dang bral ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'i phyir khyab pa grub bo //
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa na / de dang bral ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyis khyab pa'i phyir khyab pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the preclusion of the property of the counter-pervasion is due to the non-apprehension of the pervader,🔽the object that is devoid of that is pervaded by the nature of the object that is devoid of the property of the counter-pervasion. Thus the pervasion is established.

original: gang grub kyang gang ma grub pa de la ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa las khyab par byed pa de dang bral ba'i yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang grub kyang gang ma grub pa de la ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa las khyab par byed pa de dang bral ba'i yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were established, then that which is not established would not have the object that is devoid of the pervader due to the property of the counter-pervasion.

original: gal te 'di snyam du rjes su dpag pa la bsnyon pa la rjes su dpag pa'i sbyar ba 'thad pa ma yin no snyam na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du rjes su dpag pa la bsnyon pa la rjes su dpag pa'i sbyar ba 'thad pa ma yin no snyam na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks that the application of the inference is not tenable in the case of the refutation of inference, that is illogical.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa pa de'i 'byung ba rnams la tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can nyid yin la /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa pa de'i 'byung ba rnams la tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can nyid yin la /
translated: The Lokāyatas’ convention of difference is based on the reason of possessing contradictory properties.

original: gcig snang ba na mthong ba gzhan snang ba med pa 'di la yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid yod pa des na rgyu mtshan srid pa ni tha snyad 'jug par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gcig snang ba na mthong ba gzhan snang ba med pa 'di la yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa nyid yod pa des na rgyu mtshan srid pa ni tha snyad 'jug par bya ba yin la /
translated: When one is seen, the other is not seen. This also possesses contradictory properties. Therefore, the reason is possible, and the convention is engaged.

original: ma yin na ni gzhan la yang 'jug par mi bya'o zhes gzhan dag tha dad pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin na ni gzhan la yang 'jug par mi bya'o zhes gzhan dag tha dad pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: If it is not so, then it should not be engaged with respect to others. Thus others engage the convention of difference.

original: gal te yang 'di rjes su dpag pa yin pa de lta na yang pha rol gyis spangs pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di rjes su dpag pa yin pa de lta na yang pha rol gyis spangs pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Even if this is an inference, it is not rejected by the opponent.

original: 'on kyang pha rol rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang pha rol rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: However, the opponent merely asserts that it is not an inference.

original: 'di snyam du de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: Even if it is like that, the reason is not established.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi lus grub na rang gi blo grub pa yod pa yin la /🔽khyad par du 'phags pa'i skyes bus ni gzhan gyi lus grub pa @32a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi lus grub na rang gi blo grub pa yod pa yin la / khyad par du 'phags pa'i skyes bus ni gzhan gyi lus grub pa @32a * //
translated: Because when one’s own body is established, one’s own mind exists.

original: na yang gzhan gyi blo nges pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: na yang gzhan gyi blo nges pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: In particular, a superior person ascertains another’s mind when another’s body is established.

original: de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond to that qualm, he says, “That”

original: the tshom du gyur pa'i blo'i rnam par brtag pa de bzhin dang 'brel pa gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa ni skyes bu tha mal pa skyes bu tsam de'i mngon sum gyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa'i blo'i rnam par brtag pa de bzhin dang 'brel pa gzhan gyi rgyud la gnas pa ni skyes bu tha mal pa skyes bu tsam de'i mngon sum gyis mi rtogs so //
translated: and so on. The analysis of the mind that is the object of doubt is connected with “that” and exists in another’s continuum. Ordinary people, who are just people, do not understand that by means of their direct perception.

original: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i blo'i rnam par brtag pa ni rtag tu the tshom gyi yul yin pa de'i phyir phal pa'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i blo'i rnam par brtag pa ni rtag tu the tshom gyi yul yin pa de'i phyir phal pa'i mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the analysis of the mind that exists in another’s continuum is always the object of doubt, therefore it is not apprehended by the direct perception of ordinary people.

original: mngon sum gyis bzung ba ni khyad par yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bzung ba ni khyad par yin la /
translated: What is apprehended by direct perception is a specific instance.

original: khyad par bzung na the tshom med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par bzung na the tshom med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: When a specific instance is apprehended, there is no doubt.

original: gang yang skyes bu khyad par du 'phags pa 'ga' zhig gi shes pas gzhan gyi lus dang blo bzung ba de lta na yang lus 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gcig gis ma bzung bas kyang tha dad par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gang yang skyes bu khyad par du 'phags pa 'ga' zhig gi shes pas gzhan gyi lus dang blo bzung ba de lta na yang lus 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gcig gis ma bzung bas kyang tha dad par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Even if the consciousness of some special person apprehends the body and mind of another, still, because it is not apprehended by a single direct perception that apprehends the body, they are different.

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The reason for their difference is that they possess contradictory attributes.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de ni gcig gis ma bzung na yang grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de ni gcig gis ma bzung na yang grub pa'i phyir /
translated: And that they possess contradictory attributes is established even if one of them is not apprehended.

original: yang 'ga' zhig gis gcig tu bzung bas ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'ga' zhig gis gcig tu bzung bas ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that they are not different because someone apprehends them as one.🔽This is the reasoning.

original: dgag pa byed phyir yang zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gsum ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dgag pa byed phyir yang zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gsum ba gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: The third reason, “because of the negation,” is stated in order to present the treatise.

original: dgag pa ste dgag pa'i tha snyad mngon sum gyis ni bya bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa ste dgag pa'i tha snyad mngon sum gyis ni bya bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: The negation, that is, the term “negation,” is not suitable to be a direct perception.

original: 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gang yin par dgag pa'i tha snyad byed pa gang yin pa de thams cad mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gang yin par dgag pa'i tha snyad byed pa gang yin pa de thams cad mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
translated: “In some cases” means that all the expressions of negation that are made in regard to some things that are seen or not seen do not necessarily precede from perception.

original: dngos po so sor snang ba nyid nges pa nyid kyis dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir med pa ni mngon sum de'i yul nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po so sor snang ba nyid nges pa nyid kyis dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir med pa ni mngon sum de'i yul nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the individual appearances of things are ascertained, and because the apprehension of things is incompatible with the object of nonperception.

original: gang zhig mngon sum gyis de snang ba nyid kyis gzung ba de la ni mngon sum gyis tha snyad du byed pa yin na dngos po med pa ni de'i gzung ba ma yin pa des ni de la mngon sum gyis tha snyad du byed pa ma yin no
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum gyis de snang ba nyid kyis gzung ba de la ni mngon sum gyis tha snyad du byed pa yin na dngos po med pa ni de'i gzung ba ma yin pa des ni de la mngon sum gyis tha snyad du byed pa ma yin no
translated: That which is apprehended by perception through the appearance of that object is designated by perception, but nonthings are not apprehended by perception, and therefore perception does not designate them.

original: zhes lan mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes lan mang du bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: med pa yul yin par 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: med pa yul yin par 'gal ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the incompatibility of nonthings as objects, it is said:

original: de ni don te yul gyi nus pa la ltos pas so //
analyzed: de ni don te yul gyi nus pa la ltos pas so //
translated: Because it depends on the potency of the object.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni gzung ba'i don gyis bskyed pa yin la de'i phyir med @32b pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni gzung ba'i don gyis bskyed pa yin la de'i phyir med @32b pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Because direct perception is generated by the object that is apprehended, therefore it does not apprehend what is nonexistent.

original: gang zhig mngon sum gyi yul yin pa de ni de bskyed par nus pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum gyi yul yin pa de ni de bskyed par nus pa yin na /
translated: That which is the object of direct perception is capable of generating it.

original: med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral bas ji ltar de'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa ni nus pa thams cad dang bral bas ji ltar de'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: But since the nonexistent is devoid of all capacity, how could it be its object?

original: ci ste yang mngon sum don gyi nus pa la mi ltos par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di don la mi ltos na ni chod pa la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang mngon sum don gyi nus pa la mi ltos par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di don la mi ltos na ni chod pa la sogs pa'i don gang yin pa ste /
translated: But if direct perception does not depend on the capacity of the object, then at that time, if it does not depend on the object, then any object, even one that is obstructed, and so on,

original: rgyang ring po na gnas pa dang shin tu nye ba na gnas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de de la yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyang ring po na gnas pa dang shin tu nye ba na gnas pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de de la yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: would be its object, because it would follow that it would arise in regard to things that are distant, or very close, and so on.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: rang gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i mngon sum gyis gal te dngos po yod pa tsam nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud dang 'brel pa'i mngon sum gyis gal te dngos po yod pa tsam nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni /
translated: If direct perception that is related to one’s continuum apprehends the mere existence of an object,

original: de'i tshe dngos po nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir chod pa dang thag ring po la sogs pa thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur na gzung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir chod pa dang thag ring po la sogs pa thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur na gzung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, since there is no difference in the entity, everything, near and far, would be apprehended, but it is not apprehended.

original: des na mngon sum rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don la ltos pa ni de las skyes pa yin par khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mngon sum rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i don la ltos pa ni de las skyes pa yin par khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that the arising of cognition depends on the object that is present in the field of perception.

original: gzhan du na myu gu ni sa bon dang 'brel par rnam par gzhag mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na myu gu ni sa bon dang 'brel par rnam par gzhag mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible to posit the sprout as related to the seed.

original: mngon sum ngo bo nyid kyis nye ba'i don 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ngo bo nyid kyis nye ba'i don 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that perception apprehends the object by its own nature,

original: zhing yang ngo bo nyid kyis sa bon dang nye ba'i myu gu bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir sa bon rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhing yang ngo bo nyid kyis sa bon dang nye ba'i myu gu bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir sa bon rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the field would not be the cause of the seed, because it would generate the sprout by its own nature, which is near to the seed.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig gang gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par ram yod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i dngos po de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig gang gi gnas skabs kyi khyad par ram yod pa'i rjes su byed pa'i dngos po de ni de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni gcig tu nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that whatever thing conforms to the specific state or existence of something else is the effect of that thing.

original: des na don nye ba la ltos pa ni don gyis bskyed pa yin pa des na med ba ni yul nyid du 'gal lo //
analyzed: des na don nye ba la ltos pa ni don gyis bskyed pa yin pa des na med ba ni yul nyid du 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, that which depends on the proximity of an object is produced by the object. Thus, it is contradictory that it is an object that does not exist.

original: de'i phyir gang las dgag pa rtogs pa de ni tshad ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las dgag pa rtogs pa de ni tshad ma gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which comprehends a negation is a different kind of valid cognition.

original: gal te yang mngon sum dngos po med pa mi 'dzin pa de lta na yang tha snyad byed par nus pa yin no zhes gzhan dag dogs pa bsu nas dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum dngos po med pa mi 'dzin pa de lta na yang tha snyad byed par nus pa yin no zhes gzhan dag dogs pa bsu nas dgag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Even though direct perception does not apprehend a non-thing, it is still able to make a designation.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis dngos po med par nges pa zhes bya ba ni med par nges pa'i byed pa po nyid ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis dngos po med par nges pa zhes bya ba ni med par nges pa'i byed pa po nyid ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: The phrase “direct perception itself ascertains the non-existence” means that the agent that ascertains non-existence is direct perception itself.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis med par nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis med par nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that direct perception itself ascertains non-existence.

original: log pa las zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid las so //
analyzed: log pa las zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid las so //
translated: The phrase “from the absence” means “from the mere absence.”

original: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: The following is explained.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa de nyid 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa dang 'ga' zhig las ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa de nyid 'ga' zhig tu 'jug pa dang 'ga' zhig las ldog pa yin la /
translated: That very consciousness that is direct perception engages in some things and disengages from other things.

original: 'jug pa'i yul ni bsgrub pa'i tha snyad dang / ldog @33a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul ni bsgrub pa'i tha snyad dang / ldog @33a * //
translated: The object of engagement is the term “to be established.”🔽

original: pa'i yul la ni dgag pa'i tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i yul la ni dgag pa'i tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: The object of engagement is the basis of the term “established,” and the object of cessation is the basis of the term “excluded.”

original: des na 'dir don ni mngon sum thams cad ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin la 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag gi sgo nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir don ni mngon sum thams cad ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin la 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag gi sgo nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning here is that all perception has a dual nature and that the conventions of the world engage in terms of engagement and cessation.

original: gal te yang mngon sum ldog pa la ltos nas dngos po med par nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum ldog pa la ltos nas dngos po med par nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that perception is ascertained as the nonexistence of an object in dependence on cessation,

original: de med pa yang yin la des rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de med pa yang yin la des rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: then it would not be tenable to say that it is both nonexistent and realized by that.

original: pha rol gyis rtogs par dam bca' ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pha rol gyis rtogs par dam bca' ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The opponent does not assert that it is realized by the other,

original: 'on kyang de ldog pas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ldog pas yin no //
translated: but rather that it is by its own cessation.

original: ldog pa las med pa nges par smras pa na mngon sum gyi bya ba'i khyad par ma yin par brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir don 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa las med pa nges par smras pa na mngon sum gyi bya ba'i khyad par ma yin par brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir don 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: When you say that nonexistence is ascertained from cessation, you are not describing a specific function of perception, so this is not the meaning.

original: nyams su len pa ni 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su len pa ni 'gal ba'o //
translated: Practice is contradictory.

original: 'gal ba nyid ston pa ni de med pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni yul gang la mngon sum ldog pa nyid kyis mngon du gnas pa'i yul de la ni mngon sum de yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid ston pa ni de med pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni yul gang la mngon sum ldog pa nyid kyis mngon du gnas pa'i yul de la ni mngon sum de yod pa ma yin la /
translated: He shows that they are contradictory: “It does not exist there” means that where there is the mere negation of perception, that is, where the object of perception is absent, perception does not exist there.

original: med na yang ji ltar 'ga' zhig nges pa'i rgyu nyid dam 'dzin par byed pa yin par 'gyur /🔽nges pa'i byed pa po don 'dzin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: med na yang ji ltar 'ga' zhig nges pa'i rgyu nyid dam 'dzin par byed pa yin par 'gyur / nges pa'i byed pa po don 'dzin par byed pa'am /
translated: And how could the absence of perception be a cause of ascertainment or apprehension?

original: skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were a cause of ascertainment, it would be a cause of the apprehension of an object or of the generation of an object.

original: mngon sum med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'am dngos po med pa 'dzin par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'am dngos po med pa 'dzin par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: But that which is the absence of perception does not apprehend an existent or nonexistent object,

original: nges pa bskyed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa bskyed par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it able to generate ascertainment.

original: gang zhig 'dzin par byed pa'am nges pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas nges par bya ba'i don nges pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de las ji ltar na nges pa yin par rjod par byed /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dzin par byed pa'am nges pa bskyed pa'i sgo nas nges par bya ba'i don nges pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de las ji ltar na nges pa yin par rjod par byed /
translated: How could that which is not a cause of ascertainment of an object to be ascertained, either through apprehension or through the generation of ascertainment, be said to ascertain it?

original: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni byed pa por 'gyur ba'am 'ga' zhig gir rgyur gyur pa des rtogs pa ste yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni byed pa por 'gyur ba'am 'ga' zhig gir rgyur gyur pa des rtogs pa ste yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The one who teaches this is the agent, or the one who has the cause, and he understands it, that is, he fully knows it.

original: 'di snyam du mngon sum ldog pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid dam skyed bar byed pa nyid kyis nges pa'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mthong ba med par nges pa na dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du mngon sum ldog pa 'dzin par byed pa nyid dam skyed bar byed pa nyid kyis nges pa'i rgyu ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mthong ba med par nges pa na dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: One might think that the ascertainment of the negation of perception is not by the apprehension or the production of the negation, but rather that it is simply the making of the convention of nonexistence when there is no perception.

original: gang gi phyir de 'jug pa na yod pa'i tha snyad dang / ldog pa na med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i phyir tha snyad thams cad de dang 'brel par brjod pa yin gyi ldog pa mngon sum du bya ba 'ga' zhig gi tha snyad byed pa po nyid dam skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'jug pa na yod pa'i tha snyad dang / ldog pa na med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i phyir tha snyad thams cad de dang 'brel par brjod pa yin gyi ldog pa mngon sum du bya ba 'ga' zhig gi tha snyad byed pa po nyid dam skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because when it occurs, one makes the convention of existence, and when it does not occur, one makes the convention of nonexistence, therefore all conventions are said to be related to it, but it is not the case that the ascertainment of the negation is the producer or the agent that makes the convention of some object that is perceived.

original: de ltar med par nges pa ni mngon sum ldog par nges pa sngon du @33b 'gro ba can yin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar med par nges pa ni mngon sum ldog par nges pa sngon du @33b 'gro ba can yin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: The ascertainment of nonexistence is preceded by the ascertainment of the cessation of perception.

original: bshad pa 'di ldog na ni ste mngon sum log pa'i phyir gang las med do zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di ldog na ni ste mngon sum log pa'i phyir gang las med do zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur /
translated: If this explanation is reversed, that is, if perception ceases, then how could one ascertain that something does not exist because of the cessation of perception?

original: gal te de las mngon sum log tu zin kyang de lta na yang dngos po yod pa yang srid pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de las mngon sum log tu zin kyang de lta na yang dngos po yod pa yang srid pa yin no //
translated: Even if perception does cease, it is still possible that an entity exists.

original: mngon sum log pas dngos po med pa mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum log pas dngos po med pa mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not see the nonexistence of an entity because of the cessation of perception.

original: de ni mthong ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of nonseeing is not seeing.

original: des na nges pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma dang mi ldan par med par rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: des na nges pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma dang mi ldan par med par rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Therefore, because there is no ascertainment, one merely understands nonexistence without a valid cognition.

original: mthong ba ni rang gi yul la tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba ni rang gi yul la tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Seeing is not a valid cognition in regard to its object, and therefore there is ascertainment.

original: ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po med par nges pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa de'i phyir dngos po med par nges pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Nonseeing is not a valid cognition, and therefore there is no ascertainment of the nonexistence of an entity.

original: ci ste yang nges pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang nges pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But if there is ascertainment,

original: yod na ni nges pa srid pa de nyid 'khrul pa med pa med na mi 'byung ba'i mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod na ni nges pa srid pa de nyid 'khrul pa med pa med na mi 'byung ba'i mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: then if it exists, that very possible ascertainment is non-mistaken non-observation of the imperceptible.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: mthong ba log pas dngos po med pa ma bzung yang /
analyzed: mthong ba log pas dngos po med pa ma bzung yang /
translated: Although the negation of seeing does not apprehend the non-existence of the thing,

original: nges pa yin na ni 'khrul pa med pa nyid du gtan la phab pas med par nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa yin na ni 'khrul pa med pa nyid du gtan la phab pas med par nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: if there is ascertainment, then since it is determined to be non-mistaken, it ascertains non-existence.

original: des na 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it is non-mistaken, it is valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum yang ma yin pas rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa med par med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mngon sum yang ma yin pas rjes su dpag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa med par med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: But since it is not direct perception, it is inference. Thus, how could there be the convention of non-existence without inference?

original: mngon sum nyid dngos po med pa nges par 'byed pa yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid dngos po med pa nges par 'byed pa yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Or how could direct perception itself ascertain non-existence?

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says:

original: de ni des zhes bya ba ni mi 'khrul pa'i nges pa ma yin gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni des zhes bya ba ni mi 'khrul pa'i nges pa ma yin gyi mngon sum gyis ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to non-mistaken ascertainment, not direct perception.

original: med pa grub par byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo nges pa nyid kyis med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rtags nyid yin no //
analyzed: med pa grub par byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo nges pa nyid kyis med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa'i rtags nyid yin no //
translated: The proof of nonexistence is the very sign that makes the designation of nonexistence by ascertaining its own nature.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: mngon sum log pa ni med na mi 'byung bar gtan la phebs pa nas dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum log pa ni med na mi 'byung bar gtan la phebs pa nas dngos po med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yin gyi /
translated: When the cessation of perception is ascertained to be a necessary condition for nonexistence, it makes the designation of nonexistence.

original: de mngon sum gyi rnam pa nyid kyis dngos po med par 'dzin par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de mngon sum gyi rnam pa nyid kyis dngos po med par 'dzin par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the cessation of perception itself apprehends nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba can dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni rtags can yin gyi mngon sum gyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba can dngos po med pa'i tha snyad ni rtags can yin gyi mngon sum gyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the designation of nonexistence, which is preceded by that, is a sign, but it is not produced by perception.

original: mngon sum log pa rang gi ngo bos ni cung zad byed pa ma yin la ldog pa yang mthong ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas med na mi 'byung ba yod na ni med par nges pa'i rtags yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum log pa rang gi ngo bos ni cung zad byed pa ma yin la ldog pa yang mthong ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas med na mi 'byung ba yod na ni med par nges pa'i rtags yin la /
translated: The cessation of perception does not do anything by its own nature, and cessation is not seen to have the nature of nonexistence. Therefore, when there is a necessary condition for nonexistence, it is a sign that ascertains nonexistence.

original: med na ni the tshom za ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med na ni the tshom za ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: But when there is no necessary condition, there is doubt.

original: de ltar @34a * //
analyzed: de ltar @34a * //
translated: Thus,

original: bden te rjes su dpag pa 'ga' zhig khas blang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: bden te rjes su dpag pa 'ga' zhig khas blang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is true that some inferences are accepted.🔽But some are not, because they are deceptive.

original: 'ga' zhig las zhugs pa ni mi slu bas rjes su dpag pa 'ga' zhig mi slur zin kyang ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las zhugs pa ni mi slu bas rjes su dpag pa 'ga' zhig mi slur zin kyang ste /
translated: Even though some inferences are known to be nondeceptive,🔽and even though they are capable of establishing the desired object,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don thab par nus su zin kyang de lta mod kyi de'i rang bzhin can te tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa mi slu ba las 'khrul pa mthong ba de'i phyir thams cad du de tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la yid brtan🔽du med de /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don thab par nus su zin kyang de lta mod kyi de'i rang bzhin can te tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa mi slu ba las 'khrul pa mthong ba de'i phyir thams cad du de tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la yid brtan du med de /
translated: nevertheless, we see that those that are deceptive arise from a reason that has the nature of the three modes. Therefore, we cannot rely on all those that have just that characteristic.

original: tshad ma ma yin par dogs so //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin par dogs so //
translated: We suspect that they are not valid cognitions.

original: gang gi phyir de 'dra ba nyid 'khrul pa yin pa de'i phyir de tshad ma ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'dra ba nyid 'khrul pa yin pa de'i phyir de tshad ma ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because such a reason is deceptive, it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig gis zhugs pa na thob pa'i mi slu ba gang yin pa de ni bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las mi slu ba yin gyi gzhan la yid brtan du med pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te zhes bya
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig gis zhugs pa na thob pa'i mi slu ba gang yin pa de ni bya rog dang ta la'i tshul du rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las mi slu ba yin gyi gzhan la yid brtan du med pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te zhes bya
translated: But some say: That which is nondeceptive when it is obtained by engagement is nondeceptive due to some reason, like a crow and a palm tree, but it is not reliable with respect to others.

original: ba ni yid brtan du med pa'i rgyu zlog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ba ni yid brtan du med pa'i rgyu zlog par byed pa ste /
translated: This is the refutation of the reason that it is not reliable.

original: de'i mtshan nyid la ni 'khrul pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid la ni 'khrul pa yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that error does not exist in its definition.

original: gal te de'i bu nyid la sogs pa la 'khrul par mthong la de la yang tshul gsum mthong ba nyid ma yin nam de ji ltar na 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bu nyid la sogs pa la 'khrul par mthong la de la yang tshul gsum mthong ba nyid ma yin nam de ji ltar na 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If you see error in its being a son and so on, then is it not the case that the three modes are seen in that? How could it be nonerroneous?

original: gang zhig 'khrul pa de la ni tshul gsum nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'khrul pa de la ni tshul gsum nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is erroneous does not have the three modes.

original: mthong ba nor ba ni de'i rang bzhin te rtags de'i rang bzhin ma mtshon pa las yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba nor ba ni de'i rang bzhin te rtags de'i rang bzhin ma mtshon pa las yin la /
translated: Erroneous seeing is its nature, since it does not indicate the nature of the reason.

original: nor ba las kyang khyod 'khrul pa nyid du dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nor ba las kyang khyod 'khrul pa nyid du dogs pa yin no //
translated: But you fear that there is error even in the case of a correct reason.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid mtshon pa de'i phyir de nyid med kyang yod par rtogs nas 'khrul pa srid par dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid mtshon pa de'i phyir de nyid med kyang yod par rtogs nas 'khrul pa srid par dogs pa yin no //
translated: Since you have defined a correct reason, you fear that there is error even when it exists.

original: de'i bu nyid la sogs pa la gang zhig med kyang 'khrul par dogs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bu nyid la sogs pa la gang zhig med kyang 'khrul par dogs pa'i rtags kyi mtshan nyid de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of a reason that you fear is erroneous even when it does not exist, as in the case of being the son of a barren woman?

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa nyid de 'brel pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa nyid de 'brel pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'o //
translated: Natural relation is the relation of nature.

original: 'dis ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba brjod la de nyid ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid de tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba brjod la de nyid ni rtags kyi mtshan nyid de tshul yin no //
translated: This expresses identity and origination, and that is the definition of a reason, the mode of a reason.

original: mtshan nyid 'dis mtshon pa'i rtags de la ni 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'dis mtshon pa'i rtags de la ni 'khrul pa med do //
translated: There is no error in a reason that is defined by this definition.

original: gang zhig gang du de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas 'brel pa de ni de la 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang du de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung bas 'brel pa de ni de la 'khrul pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no error in that which is related to that by identity or origination.

original: mi 'khrul pa yang gang las she na /
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa yang gang las she na /
translated: Moreover, from what is there non-deception?🔽In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / de zhes bya ba ni yul gang la rtags 'brel pa de ni shugs kyis nye bar gzhag pa'i @34b rtags can ni zhes bya bas smos so //
analyzed: bshad pa / de zhes bya ba ni yul gang la rtags 'brel pa de ni shugs kyis nye bar gzhag pa'i @34b rtags can ni zhes bya bas smos so //
translated: “That” refers to the object to which the evidence is related. “By implication” means that the evidence is indirectly presented.

original: de med na rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na rtags kyi rang gi ngo bo med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if that does not exist, the evidence’s own nature would not exist.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang des bskyed pa de ji ltar na de med par yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang des bskyed pa de ji ltar na de med par yod par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is of the nature of that and that which is produced by that exist without that?

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni tshul gsum las skyes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni tshul gsum las skyes pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, whatever is deceptive is not produced from the trimodal evidence.

original: des bskyed pa ni 'khrul pa med pa nyid pas rtags kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba la 'bad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des bskyed pa ni 'khrul pa med pa nyid pas rtags kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba la 'bad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir yid brtan du med pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is produced by it is nondeceptive. Therefore, since it is the evidence’s characteristic that is to be understood, one should strive to understand it. Thus it is not unreliable.

original: de'i phyir sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis khyod kyis rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya ba yin gyi yid brtan par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis khyod kyis rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya ba yin gyi yid brtan par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, as explained earlier, you should accept inference. It is not that it is unreliable. This is the point.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum tshad mar khas len pas rjes su dpag pa gdon mi za bar tshad mar khas blang bar byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum tshad mar khas len pas rjes su dpag pa gdon mi za bar tshad mar khas blang bar byas te /
translated: Moreover, since you accept direct perception as valid knowledge, you must also accept inference as valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa mngon sum las tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mngon sum las tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the reason for the validity of inference and direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni don te chad ma'i 'jug pa'i yul med na mi srid na mi 'byung ba las te 'dis ni ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum ni don te chad ma'i 'jug pa'i yul med na mi srid na mi 'byung ba las te 'dis ni ldog pa bstan to //
translated: Because direct perception is impossible without an object, it arises from an object. This indicates the negative pervasion.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid kyang shugs kyis brjod de /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid kyang shugs kyis brjod de /
translated: The positive pervasion is also indirectly stated:

original: mngon sum yod pa ni de med par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis de yod pa nyid na yod pa nyid yin no zhes de yod na yod pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yod pa ni de med par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i shugs kyis de yod pa nyid na yod pa nyid yin no zhes de yod na yod pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: If direct perception exists, it exists. If it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar mngon sum yang de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul thob par nus par gnas pa ma tshad ma zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar mngon sum yang de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul thob par nus par gnas pa ma tshad ma zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, because direct perception is also the result of that, it is said that it exists as valid knowledge that is able to obtain the object of engagement.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid ni rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid ni rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The result of that is not different in inference either.

original: khyad par med pa de nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: khyad par med pa de nyid ston par byed do //
translated: He shows that there is no difference.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtags gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa de'i rgyu nyid yin par gyur pa na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis mtshungs so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtags gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa de'i rgyu nyid yin par gyur pa na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis mtshungs so //
translated: When the reason that is the nature of the object to be established is the cause of that inference, then direct perception and inference are the same.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum don las skye ba yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtags shes pa las yin zhing shes pa de yang rtags las te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum don las skye ba yin pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi rtags shes pa las yin zhing shes pa de yang rtags las te /
translated: Just as direct perception arises from the object, in the same way inference is from the knowledge of the reason that is the nature of the connection, and that knowledge is from the reason.

original: rtags kyang kha cig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: rtags kyang kha cig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Some reasons are the nature of the object to be established,

original: kha cig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang de'i 'bras bur khyad par med pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang de'i 'bras bur khyad par med pas /
translated: and some are the result of the object to be established. Therefore, since both are the result of that, there is no difference.

original: khyad par med pa de thob par nus par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med pa de thob par nus par byas pa yin no //
translated: That difference is made possible by obtaining it.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyi don 'brel pa ni mngon sum yang don la mi @35a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di nyid kyi don 'brel pa ni mngon sum yang don la mi @35a * //
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows: Perception is not a valid cognition with regard to its object, because it is deceptive with regard to the object.

original: slu ba ste thob par nus pa nyid las tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: slu ba ste thob par nus pa nyid las tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is a valid cognition only in the sense that it is capable of obtaining the object.

original: yang gi sgras ni kho bo cag 'ba' zhig rjes su dpag pa don med na mi 'byung ba las tshad mar 'dod par ma zad kyi khyod kyis kyang 'di nyid kyi mngon sum tshad ma yin par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni kho bo cag 'ba' zhig rjes su dpag pa don med na mi 'byung ba las tshad mar 'dod par ma zad kyi khyod kyis kyang 'di nyid kyi mngon sum tshad ma yin par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no
translated: The word “also” indicates that not only do we maintain that inference is a valid cognition only in the sense that it is capable of obtaining its object, but you also maintain that perception is a valid cognition only in the sense that it is capable of obtaining its object.

original: // mi slu ba de ni don de las bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: // mi slu ba de ni don de las bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is nondeceptive because it obtains its own nature from that object.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum gang yin pa de don des bskyed pa yin pa de thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum gang yin pa de don des bskyed pa yin pa de thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: That is, whatever is perception is produced by that object, and it obtains that object.

original: yang ji ltar gzhan las skyes pas kyang de thob par mi nus she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gzhan las skyes pas kyang de thob par mi nus she na /
translated: How is it that it is not capable of obtaining that object if it arises from something else?

original: bshad pa / gzhan las byung ba ste skyes ba'i yod ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhan las byung ba ste skyes ba'i yod ba ste /
translated: It is said: “The existence of something that arises from something else”

original: ldog pa ni de la mi slu ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa ni de la mi slu ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not reasonable, because it is not nondeceptive with regard to that.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyang rgyur gyur pa ma yin pa ltos pa med pa gang yin pa la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyang rgyur gyur pa ma yin pa ltos pa med pa gang yin pa la /
translated: And that which is not a cause, which is not dependent, is not the nature of that.🔽

original: gzhan las skyes pa gang yin pa de 'khrul pa med par ji ltar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan las skyes pa gang yin pa de 'khrul pa med par ji ltar gyur te /
translated: And how could that which is not a cause, which is not dependent, and which is produced from another be nonerroneous?

original: dper na rab rib can gyi shes pa nges par byas pa'i don la 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyi shes pa nges par byas pa'i don la 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the object ascertained by the cognition of one who has an eye disease.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa med pa la mi slu ba med par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa med pa la mi slu ba med par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that there is no nondeception without concomitance.

original: ma byung ba ni de las shes par bya ba las ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ma byung ba ni de las shes par bya ba las ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: The nonarisen is dependent on the object to be known.

original: gang zhig gang las ma byung ba de ni de dang 'brel pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las ma byung ba de ni de dang 'brel pa med pa yin la /
translated: That which does not arise from something is not related to it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: And for that very reason, it is not erroneous.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa la mi slu ba med par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa la mi slu ba med par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This shows that there is no nondeception without positive concomitance.

original: rnam pa 'dis ni 'brel pas mi 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis ni 'brel pas mi 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: By this method, there is nonerroneous by means of relation.

original: mi 'khrul pas na de thob par nus zhes bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pas na de thob par nus zhes bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: And because it is nonerroneous, it is established that it is able to attain its object.

original: nges par zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rigs pa'i khyad par te mi slu ba mi rigs par nges pa'o //
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rigs pa'i khyad par te mi slu ba mi rigs par nges pa'o //
translated: “Certainly” is a particular non-erroneous, i.e., certain, non-erroneous cognition.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i shes pa las ni bya rog dang ta la tsam yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i shes pa las ni bya rog dang ta la tsam yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that there is no cognition of a connection between a crow and a palm tree.

original: 'di mi slu ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'di mi slu ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa spang ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to refute the idea that perception is a non-erroneous sign, it is said:

original: mngon sum ni don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum ni don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Perception is not a non-erroneous cognition of an object, because it does not occur without an object.

original: don gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pas don la mi slu bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pas don la mi slu bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the effect of the object, so it is not a non-erroneous cognition of the object.

original: 'o na mi slu ba gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi slu ba gang las yin zhe na /
translated: Then, from what is it non-erroneous?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Nevertheless, it is said:

original: 'on kyang don mthong ba las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don mthong ba las yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is from seeing the object.

original: gang gi phyir don gyi rang bzhin mngon sum du mthong ba de'i phyir don thob par byed pa yin no /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gyi rang bzhin mngon sum du mthong ba de'i phyir don thob par byed pa yin no /
translated: Because the nature of the object is seen directly, therefore it is what obtains the object.

original: rjes su dpag pas ni don cung zad kyang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ni don cung zad kyang ma mthong ste /
translated: Inference does not see any object at all.

original: des na ji ltar thob par byed pa yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar thob par byed pa yin /
translated: So how can it obtain it?

original: thob par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir tshad @35b ma ma yin no //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir tshad @35b ma ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not cause the attainment of the object, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyis don gyi rang bzhin mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par gzhag pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan gyis don gyi rang bzhin mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag las tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa rnam par gzhag pa na /
translated: Thus, when the establishment of valid cognition and non-valid cognition is based on the seeing and not seeing of the nature of the object by another,

original: slob dpon gyis don mthong ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthong ba nyid rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis don mthong ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthong ba nyid rtog par mdzad do //
translated: the Acarya [Dharmakirti] analyzes the very seeing of the object in the statement beginning with that seeing.

original: mthong ba'i sgras mthong bar bya ba ste mthong ba'i don na ma mthong bar byed pa ste mthong ba po nyid yod pa gtan tshigs su len grang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i sgras mthong bar bya ba ste mthong ba'i don na ma mthong bar byed pa ste mthong ba po nyid yod pa gtan tshigs su len grang /
translated: The word seeing refers to the object of seeing, and the word not seeing refers to the seer.

original: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ni mthong ba'i don yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs kyi don ni mthong ba'i don yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is because the object of seeing exists.

original: de'i ngo bor gyur pa mthong zhes bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de'i yod pa ni dngos su na de nyid kyi yod pa yin la de yang gtan tshigs su nye bar blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bor gyur pa mthong zhes bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de'i yod pa ni dngos su na de nyid kyi yod pa yin la de yang gtan tshigs su nye bar blangs pa yin no //
translated: The existence of that which becomes its nature, that is, the existence of the object of seeing, is directly the existence of that [seer], and that is what is taken as the reason.

original: de bzhin du lta ba'i shes pa yang lta ba po nyid du yod pa gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba'i shes pa yang lta ba po nyid du yod pa gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Likewise, the knowledge of seeing is the reason for the existence of the seer.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i don can gyi ngag sbyar ba gzhan dag tu yang rnam par rtog pa 'di nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i don can gyi ngag sbyar ba gzhan dag tu yang rnam par rtog pa 'di nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: In other similar statements, this same idea should be examined.

original: dper na gang gi phyir mngon sum don mthong ba dang 'dzin pa dang shes pa de'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par mthong ba la sogs pa yang bya ba dang byed pa don dang shes pa dag gi chos yin no
analyzed: dper na gang gi phyir mngon sum don mthong ba dang 'dzin pa dang shes pa de'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par mthong ba la sogs pa yang bya ba dang byed pa don dang shes pa dag gi chos yin no
translated: For example, “Because direct perception sees the object, apprehends it, and knows it, therefore it is valid cognition.” In such statements, seeing and so on are properties of the object and the cognition.

original: // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni yod du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar thal pas 'jigs nas /
analyzed: // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni yod du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar thal pas 'jigs nas /
translated: Even though the relation of cause and effect does exist, fearing that inference would be valid cognition,

original: pha rol gyi mngon sum pa tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan tu bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol gyi mngon sum pa tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan tu bstan par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: the opponent does not teach direct perception to be the reason for valid cognition.

original: lhag mar gyur pa gnyi ga 'brel pa'i bya ba gang yin pa blang bar bya ba yin la de ni sngar brjod pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das so //🔽phyin ci ma log pa yang gzung bar bya ba dngos po yin pa'am /
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pa gnyi ga 'brel pa'i bya ba gang yin pa blang bar bya ba yin la de ni sngar brjod pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das so // phyin ci ma log pa yang gzung bar bya ba dngos po yin pa'am /
translated: The remaining two are related to the action of taking, but that is not beyond the conception that was mentioned earlier.

original: 'dzin par byed pa shes pa yin zhes gnyi ga'i chos las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa shes pa yin zhes gnyi ga'i chos las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the nonerroneous object either the thing that is apprehended or the consciousness that apprehends.🔽Thus, it is not beyond the two attributes.

original: don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object is the meaning,

original: de'i tshe ngag gi don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ngag gi don 'di yin te /
translated: then the meaning of the statement is this:

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i don yod pa yin pa de'i phyir de mngon sum gyis thob par byed do zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i don yod pa yin pa de'i phyir de mngon sum gyis thob par byed do zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: “Because the object of seeing exists, it is obtained by direct perception.”

original: don 'di bstan pa na yang rnam par brtag par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: don 'di bstan pa na yang rnam par brtag par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don ni yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: But when this meaning is presented, the object that is to be imagined and is hidden does not exist.

original: des na de rjes su dpag pas thob pa ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur zhing de las kyang don gang zhig mngon sum gyur pa de kho na yod pa yin pa'i phyir don thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de rjes su dpag pas thob pa ma yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur zhing de las kyang don gang zhig mngon sum gyur pa de kho na yod pa yin pa'i phyir don thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is not obtained by inference. And since the object that is perceived exists, all objects would be perceived.

original: de'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad thams cad kyis mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And therefore, everything would be seen by everything.

original: 'di ltar ni pha rol gyis 'dod @36a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ni pha rol gyis 'dod @36a * //
translated: But this is not the intention of the opponent,

original: pa'am rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'am rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: nor is it logical.

original: gzhan gyis lkog tu gyur pa'i don khas blang ba'i phyir dang / rigs pa 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis lkog tu gyur pa'i don khas blang ba'i phyir dang / rigs pa 'thad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the object that is hidden from others is accepted, and because it is logical that it is tenable.

original: mthong ba nyid ni don thams cad kyi byed ba po nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid ni don thams cad kyi byed ba po nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that seeing itself is the agent of all objects,

original: mthong ba med kyang rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba med kyang rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because even without seeing, the object exists in relation to its cause.

original: gang las lkog tu gyur pa sel bar byed /
analyzed: gang las lkog tu gyur pa sel bar byed /
translated: From what is the hidden object eliminated?

original: shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is by consciousness,

original: gal te mthong bar byed pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid la mthong ba'i sgrar brjod na de lta na yang gang gi phyir mthong ba shes pa yod pa de'i phyir mthong bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no
analyzed: gal te mthong bar byed pa'i shes pa yod pa nyid la mthong ba'i sgrar brjod na de lta na yang gang gi phyir mthong ba shes pa yod pa de'i phyir mthong bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no
translated: If you say that the word “seeing” refers to the existence of the consciousness that sees, then even in that case, the meaning of “that which is seen” is established as the object that is the basis of the existence of the seeing consciousness.

original: // gzhan yod pa na 'brel pa med pa gzhan yod pa ste /
analyzed: // gzhan yod pa na 'brel pa med pa gzhan yod pa ste /
translated: If the other exists, the other that is not related to it does not exist.

original: 'byung bar nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar nges pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not certain that it will arise.

original: gang gis thob par 'gyur pa gzhan yod pa na 'brel pa med pa gzhan gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis thob par 'gyur pa gzhan yod pa na 'brel pa med pa gzhan gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the other that is related to it exists, the other that is not related to it does not necessarily exist.

original: 'di snyam du gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig yod pa na gzhan nges par yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gzhan gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig yod pa na gzhan nges par yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: You might think that if any other exists, the other does not necessarily exist.

original: 'on kyang shes pa'i bdag nyid yod pa na 'brel pa med kyang mthong ba'i shes bya yod par rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa'i bdag nyid yod pa na 'brel pa med kyang mthong ba'i shes bya yod par rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: However, when the consciousness that has the nature of seeing exists, even though it is not related to it, the object of seeing is said to exist.

original: des na shes pas don bzung ba las yod par rnam par 'jog go zhe na /
analyzed: des na shes pas don bzung ba las yod par rnam par 'jog go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object is posited as existent on the basis of the consciousness apprehending the object.

original: dgos pa de nyid bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: dgos pa de nyid bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
translated: The purpose of this is explained:

original: mthong ba'i phyir te gang gi phyir mthong ba de'i phyir yod pa de dngos por grub par khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir te gang gi phyir mthong ba de'i phyir yod pa de dngos por grub par khas len no zhe na /
translated: Because it is seen. If it is asked, “Why is it seen? Because it exists. Therefore, it is accepted that it is established as a thing,”

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.🔽Because seeing itself was previously refuted and examined,

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba nyid sngar brgal zhing brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i 'dri bas ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba nyid sngar brgal zhing brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i 'dri bas ston par byed do //
translated: as indicated by the question, “Isn’t that so?”

original: sngar brgal zhing brtags pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ni 'dir lan du btab pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar brgal zhing brtags pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ni 'dir lan du btab pa yin no //
translated: The seeing that was previously refuted and examined is here the response.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa de nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo ston par byed pa ni mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa de nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo ston par byed pa ni mthong ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The response to that refutation and examination is indicated by the question, “What is this so-called seeing?”

original: ji skad brjod pa bzhin te mthong ba la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo las tha dad pa'i chos su khas blangs pa na 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nam shes bya'i rang bzhin du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa bzhin te mthong ba la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo las tha dad pa'i chos su khas blangs pa na 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin nam shes bya'i rang bzhin du 'gyur grang na /
translated: As it has been said, if one accepts that seeing and so on are phenomena that are different from the nature of cause and effect, then they would be the nature of the consciousnesses such as apprehension or the nature of the objects of consciousness.

original: de la yang skyon brjod zin to //
analyzed: de la yang skyon brjod zin to //
translated: But the errors in this have already been explained.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: “ Therefore” concludes the argument.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa spangs na don gzhan du gyur pa'i shes pas don gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa spangs na don gzhan du gyur pa'i shes pas don gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If one abandons the relation of cause and effect, then because a consciousness that is a different object does not ascertain an object that is a different object, how could one obtain it?

original: de'i phyir don @36b gzhan du gyur pa'i shes pa yod pa las don gzhan du gyur pa'i yul zhes bya ba yod par nges pa dang ldan par 'dod pas gzhag par bya ba dang 'jog bar byed pa dag 'brel par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir don @36b gzhan du gyur pa'i shes pa yod pa las don gzhan du gyur pa'i yul zhes bya ba yod par nges pa dang ldan par 'dod pas gzhag par bya ba dang 'jog bar byed pa dag 'brel par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because one asserts that the existence of an object that is a different object is ascertained by the existence of a consciousness that is a different object, one must accept that the object and consciousness are related as that which is established and that which establishes.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa de nyid kyang de las skyes pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa de nyid kyang de las skyes pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The grasping of the intrinsic reality of things is also to be established by its arising from that.

original: skyes pa spangs nas ni gzung ba tha dad pa la nges par 'dzin pa zhes pa 'di nyid rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa spangs nas ni gzung ba tha dad pa la nges par 'dzin pa zhes pa 'di nyid rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: For, apart from what has arisen, this very grasping of a separate object is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid kyang de'i 'bras bu yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar de spong bar byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa nyid kyang de'i 'bras bu yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar de spong bar byed /
translated: Therefore, since the grasping of its intrinsic reality is also the effect of that, how could it abandon that?

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyis nges par byas pa'i don thob par nus pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyis nges par byas pa'i don thob par nus pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason for the ability to attain the object ascertained by perception is its being the effect of that.

original: gang yang mngon sum 'brel pa zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis tshad ma yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gang yang mngon sum 'brel pa zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis tshad ma yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so zhes 'brel to //
translated: And whatever is the reason for being a valid cognition because of being the effect of that, which is called “being related to perception,” that is the same in the case of inference, is what is implied.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa la yang de'i 'bras bu nyid yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa la yang de'i 'bras bu nyid yod pa nyid do //
translated: Because the effect of that exists in the case of inference as well.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dag las zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dag las zhes bya ba 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /
translated: The phrase “from the evidence of effect and of nature” is the seventh reason.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags dang rang bzhin gyi rtags kyi rgyu mtshan las rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de la yang 'brel pa de mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags dang rang bzhin gyi rtags kyi rgyu mtshan las rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de la yang 'brel pa de mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The inference that is based on the evidence of effect and of nature is also similar to the relation.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du don gyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du don gyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: This passage means that because the evidence of effect and of nature are the causes of inference, they are the effect of the object, just like perception.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This is because the evidence of effect and of nature do not occur if the object does not exist.

original: 'dis ni 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid de rgyu yin phyir zhes bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid de rgyu yin phyir zhes bya ba de rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: This passage explains the nature of the relation, which is “because it is the cause.”

original: rtags smos pa ni 'di skad ston te rtags nyid du nges pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rtags smos pa ni 'di skad ston te rtags nyid du nges pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The mention of “evidence” indicates that the effect and the nature that are ascertained as evidence are the causes of inference.

original: rtags nyid nges pa yang 'bras bu yi ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges pa yin zhing /
analyzed: rtags nyid nges pa yang 'bras bu yi ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por nges pa yin zhing /
translated: The sign itself is ascertained as the effect of the reason, and is ascertained as the entity of the effect of the reason.

original: rang bzhin gyi ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis khyab par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ni bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyis khyab par nges pa yin no //
translated: And the nature of the reason is ascertained as pervaded by the nature of the probandum.

original: des na phyogs kyi chos rang gis bsgrub par bya bas khyab par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas shes pa'i rtags nyid du nges pa de las rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skye pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phyogs kyi chos rang gis bsgrub par bya bas khyab par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad mas shes pa'i rtags nyid du nges pa de las rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa skye pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sign is ascertained as the knowledge by means of the valid knowledge that proves the property of the subject by the pervasion of the probandum by itself. From that, inferential knowledge arises.

original: shes par byed pa'i tshad ma de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag @37a * //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i tshad ma de yang bsgrub par bya ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba yin pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag @37a * //
translated: That valid knowledge that causes knowledge is not produced without the object of the probandum. Therefore, inference

original: pa ni rtags kyi shes pas bar chod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don nyid las 'byung pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: pa ni rtags kyi shes pas bar chod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don nyid las 'byung pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: arises from the object of the probandum itself, interrupted by the knowledge of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol pos de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis mngon sum tshad mar khas blang bar bya ba yin la de'i 'bras bu ni rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol pos de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis mngon sum tshad mar khas blang bar bya ba yin la de'i 'bras bu ni rjes su dpag pa la yang khyad par med de /
translated: Because the opponent must accept that direct perception is a valid cognition because it is the result of that, and its result is not different from inference.

original: des na de yang tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na de yang tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that also must be accepted as a valid cognition.

original: gang zhig gang las gang gi nus pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa de ni de las de'i nus pa khyad par med pa can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las gang gi nus pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa de ni de las de'i nus pa khyad par med pa can yin te /
translated: That which is not different from the cause of the capacity for something from something is not different from the capacity for that from that.

original: dper na tha mar gyur pa myu gu bskyed par nus pa tshogs pa gcig gis sa bon las rgyu khyad par med pa can tha mar gyur cing tha ma'i gnas skabs thob pa myu gu bskyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa tshogs pa gnyis pa'i sa bon bzhin
analyzed: dper na tha mar gyur pa myu gu bskyed par nus pa tshogs pa gcig gis sa bon las rgyu khyad par med pa can tha mar gyur cing tha ma'i gnas skabs thob pa myu gu bskyed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa tshogs pa gnyis pa'i sa bon bzhin
translated: For example, the seed that is not different from the cause of the capacity to produce the final sprout from the collection of causes is not different from the capacity to produce the final sprout from the seed that has obtained the final state, which is endowed with the capacity to produce the final sprout.

original: no // gang gi phyir gyu khyad par med pa nyid ni rgyu tshogs pa brjod la /
analyzed: no // gang gi phyir gyu khyad par med pa nyid ni rgyu tshogs pa brjod la /
translated: Because the nondifference of cause is stated in the collection of causes,

original: de la ni ltos pa med pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni ltos pa med pa nyid kyis khyab pa yin no //
translated: and that is pervaded by the absence of dependence.

original: gal te de yod kyang nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin na ni ltos pa med pa rgyu tshogs pa nyid dang 'gal ba gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de yod kyang nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin na ni ltos pa med pa rgyu tshogs pa nyid dang 'gal ba gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists but is not endowed with the capacity, then it would follow, absurdly, that it would be dependent on something else, which would be incompatible with the mere collection of causes, which is not dependent on anything else.

original: des na khyab par byed pa ni dmigs pas rgyu khyad par med pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na nus pa khyad par med pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa ni dmigs pas rgyu khyad par med pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa na nus pa khyad par med pa dang ldan pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the pervader is the cause that is not different from the object, which is endowed with the capacity to be the opposite of the discordant class.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang don gyis 'bras bu zhes bya ba mngon sum las don thob par nus pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang don gyis 'bras bu zhes bya ba mngon sum las don thob par nus pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Also, in the case of inference, the so-called object is the cause that is not different from the object that is capable of being obtained from perception.

original: ma grub pa nyid kyang spangs ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid kyang spangs ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The fact that it is not established has just been refuted.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du las su gyur pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang byed pa por gyur pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid yin la /
