analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du las su gyur pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang byed pa por gyur pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyis khyab pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, like direct perception, inference that has become the object is also pervaded by the definition of valid cognition that has become the agent. Therefore, inference is also valid cognition.

original: de dag las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Other than those two, there is no other valid cognition.

original: de ni ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: de ni ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag las mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to explain the definition of direct perception from among the two, direct perception and inference, as they have been taught, he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba de dag gi tshogs las mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rigs dmigs kyis dgar ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba de dag gi tshogs las mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rigs dmigs kyis dgar ba'o //
translated: Among those, direct perception is to be distinguished by its type in order to teach its definition from among the collection of direct perception and inference.

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach its definition, he says:

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi rjes su brjod pa ste mngon sum gyis brjod par bya ba mngon sum du byed pa'i @37b shes pa rab tu grags pa de ni rtogs pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o zhes de ltar mngon sum rjes su brjod nas
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni mtshan gzhi rjes su brjod pa ste mngon sum gyis brjod par bya ba mngon sum du byed pa'i @37b shes pa rab tu grags pa de ni rtogs pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o zhes de ltar mngon sum rjes su brjod nas
translated: “Direct perception” is the basis of the term. The direct object of a term is the object that is directly perceived. The consciousness that directly perceives it is well known. It is free from conceptuality and is non-mistaken. Having thus described direct perception,

original: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: the definition of being free from conceptuality and so on is established.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa rab tu grub pa log par rtogs pas ma shes pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba la sogs pa shes par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa rab tu grub pa log par rtogs pas ma shes pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba la sogs pa shes par byed pa yin te /
translated: Because the consciousness that directly perceives it is well known, the object that is free from conceptuality and so on is known.

original: des na shes par 'gyur ba'i mngon du byed pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi sgras rjes su brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: des na shes par 'gyur ba'i mngon du byed pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi sgras rjes su brjod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the direct object of consciousness is what is described by the term “direct perception.”

original: mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The definition of the object that is not known is established as the object of knowledge.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid grub pa la ni mtshan nyid rjes su brjod nas mtshan gzhi nyid shes par byed la /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid grub pa la ni mtshan nyid rjes su brjod nas mtshan gzhi nyid shes par byed la /
translated: When the illustration and the definition are established, then having stated the definition, the illustration itself is understood.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ma grub pa'i ngag la ni mtshan nyid sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ma grub pa'i ngag la ni mtshan nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: But in a statement where the entity of the illustration and the definition are not established, the definition is established.🔽For example, in the statement “The sign of a wandering ascetic is his topknot,” the wandering ascetic is stated and the topknot is established.

original: dper na kun du rgyu'i rtags ni gtsug phud yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag la kun du rgyu rjes su brjod pa dang gtsug phud bsgrub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa shes par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ma shes pa bsgrub pa
analyzed: dper na kun du rgyu'i rtags ni gtsug phud yin no zhes bya ba'i ngag la kun du rgyu rjes su brjod pa dang gtsug phud bsgrub pa de bzhin du 'dir yang mngon sum du byed pa'i shes pa shes par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ma shes pa bsgrub pa
translated: Similarly, here, the definition of consciousness is the awareness that is the direct perceiver.

original: yin no // mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid shes pa las ni mngon sum ni rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: yin no // mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid shes pa las ni mngon sum ni rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: From the knowledge of the illustration and the definition, it is stated here and there that direct perception is nonconceptual,

original: 'di ni rtog pa med pa ma yin no zhes de dang der brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtog pa med pa ma yin no zhes de dang der brjod pa yin no //
translated: but this is not nonconceptual.

original: ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa yang skabs su bab pa ma yi pa nyid de /
analyzed: ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa yang skabs su bab pa ma yi pa nyid de /
translated: The connection between the name and the one who has the name is also not relevant.

original: grangs la sogs pa brjod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa brjod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the occasion is for stating the number and so on.

original: dgos pa cung zad yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa cung zad yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any need for it,

original: mtshan nyid ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don yin no //
translated: because the purpose of the definition is to eliminate misconceptions.

original: rang gi 'dod pas ming btags na yang mngon sum gyi sgras brjod pa'i don la gzhan gyis log par rtogs pa ma bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas ming btags na yang mngon sum gyi sgras brjod pa'i don la gzhan gyis log par rtogs pa ma bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one were to designate the name according to one’s own wish, one would not eliminate the misconception of others with regard to the meaning expressed by the term perception.

original: ci ste dngos po de la rnam pa 'dis pha rol pos ming nyid gzhan du bya ba yin pa de lta na yang 'di dag nyid ni mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po de la rnam pa 'dis pha rol pos ming nyid gzhan du bya ba yin pa de lta na yang 'di dag nyid ni mngon sum gyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don ma yin te /
translated: Even if the opponent were to give a different name to that thing by this method, still these are not the meaning to be expressed by the term perception,

original: gang gi phyir mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon du byed pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum gyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: because the cognition that perceives is what is to be expressed by the term perception.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba dang ma 'khrul pa nyid ni de'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba dang ma 'khrul pa nyid ni de'i khyad par yin te /
translated: And being free from conceptuality and nonerroneous is its distinguishing feature.

original: dper na sgra rnams gzung bar bya ba'i bdag nyid rab tu grub pa sgra'i sgras brjod par bya ba de la sngar ma grub pa'i mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa yin gyi ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa sngar ma grub @38a * //
analyzed: dper na sgra rnams gzung bar bya ba'i bdag nyid rab tu grub pa sgra'i sgras brjod par bya ba de la sngar ma grub pa'i mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa yin gyi ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa sngar ma grub @38a * //
translated: For example, the expression “sound” is established as the nature of what is apprehended, and impermanence, which was not previously established, is established in relation to that.

original: pa byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: pa byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: But the relation between the name and the named is not made.🔽Similarly, the expression “perception” is well known to be perception itself, clear appearance itself, manifestation itself, and based on the sense faculty itself.

original: mngon sum gyi shes pa nyid dang / gsal bar snang ba nyid dang / mngon du byed pa nyid dang / dbang po la brten pa nyid du rab tu grags par gyur pa mngon sum du brjod par bya ba de rjes su brjod nas khyad par rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid ces bya ba sgrub pa yin gyi snga na med pa'i ming dang ming can🔽gyi 'brel pa bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes pa nyid dang / gsal bar snang ba nyid dang / mngon du byed pa nyid dang / dbang po la brten pa nyid du rab tu grags par gyur pa mngon sum du brjod par bya ba de rjes su brjod nas khyad par rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa nyid ces bya ba sgrub pa yin gyi snga na med pa'i ming dang ming can gyi 'brel pa bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: After that expression is repeated, the proof is “free from conceptual thought and non-erroneous.” But the relation between the name and the named is not made.

original: gang yang phyogs gzhan du rab tu grub pa 'di dag rjes su brjod par brtags nas /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs gzhan du rab tu grub pa 'di dag rjes su brjod par brtags nas /
translated: Also, the relation between the name and the named is not made in the case of the other terms.

original: mngon sum sgrub pa rtogs pa de dag gis kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid bsgrub pa'i ngag phyin ci log tu bstan par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum sgrub pa rtogs pa de dag gis kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid bsgrub pa'i ngag phyin ci log tu bstan par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: The statements of those who have realized the establishment of perception are also taught to be fallacious in the establishment of the illustration and the definition.

original: sgra dang mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa'i ngag ni 'jig rten na de ltar ma mthong ngo zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: sgra dang mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa'i ngag ni 'jig rten na de ltar ma mthong ngo zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that statements which establish the sound and the definition are not seen in that way in the world.

original: de ltar brtag par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar brtag par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not right to investigate in that way.

original: phyogs gzhan du khyad par de dag mngon sum nyid kyi gzhi la rab tu grub pa'am /🔽gzhi med par grub pa cig rjes su brjod grang /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du khyad par de dag mngon sum nyid kyi gzhi la rab tu grub pa'am / gzhi med par grub pa cig rjes su brjod grang /
translated: Is that distinction to be stated in terms of a basis of perception, or is it to be stated without a basis?

original: de la re zhig gzhi med par ni grub pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de la re zhig gzhi med par ni grub pa mi srid do //
translated: First, it is not possible to state it without a basis.

original: mngon sum nyid kyi gzhi la grub na ni ngag 'dis 'dir snga na med pa ci zhig bsgrub par 'dod /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyi gzhi la grub na ni ngag 'dis 'dir snga na med pa ci zhig bsgrub par 'dod /
translated: If it is to be stated in terms of a basis of perception, then what is it that this statement is supposed to establish that was not already established?

original: kho bo cag gis ni ngag 'di nyid kyis brjod pa'i khyad par rgyun phyi mas 'thad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni ngag 'di nyid kyis brjod pa'i khyad par rgyun phyi mas 'thad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: We maintain that this statement itself is a statement of the tenability of the subsequent continuum.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub pa dang rjes su brjod pa'i tshul 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub pa dang rjes su brjod pa'i tshul 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this method of proof and postulation is itself reasonable.

original: 'dir yang mtshan nyid gzhan rnam par bcad pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan nyid gzhan rnam par bcad pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don yin no //
translated: Here, too, it is not a matter of excluding other characteristics, but rather it is for the purpose of clearing away misconceptions.

original: des na rtog ba dang bral ba smos pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa tha dad par byas mod kyi /
analyzed: des na rtog ba dang bral ba smos pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa tha dad par byas mod kyi /
translated: Thus, by the mere mention of being free from conceptuality, inference is distinguished.

original: ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni dbang po mig ser la sogs pas nyams par byas pa'i shes pa gzung bar bya ba la phyin ci log pa ni rtog pa dang bral pa yang dgag pa'i don du ste 'di ltar don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin la ma 'khrul🔽pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'khrul pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni dbang po mig ser la sogs pas nyams par byas pa'i shes pa gzung bar bya ba la phyin ci log pa ni rtog pa dang bral pa yang dgag pa'i don du ste 'di ltar don byed nus pa'i rang bzhin la ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni ma 'khrul pa yin na ni /
translated: The mention of being nonerroneous is for the purpose of excluding a consciousness that apprehends an object that is impaired by such things as jaundice, because in this way, that which is nonerroneous with regard to the nature that is able to perform a function is nonerroneous.

original: rab rib la sogs pas nyams pa'i shes pa ni gzung bar bya ba don med par bzod pa la 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas nyams pa'i shes pa ni gzung bar bya ba don med par bzod pa la 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
translated: If a consciousness is impaired by such things as cataracts, it is only erroneous with regard to the object that is apprehended, because it is not able to tolerate the objectlessness of the object.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin pa de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos pas rjes su dpag pa bsal mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin pa de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos pas rjes su dpag pa bsal mod kyi /
translated: Likewise, inference is mistaken because it apprehends what is not that as that. Therefore, by mentioning non-mistaken, inference is indeed excluded.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid ni log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But freedom from conceptuality is mentioned in order to exclude wrong conception.

original: des na mtshan nyid re res kyang rjes @38b su dpag pa rnam par bcad pa grub mod kyi /
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid re res kyang rjes @38b su dpag pa rnam par bcad pa grub mod kyi /
translated: Thus, by each of the characteristics, inference is indeed excluded.

original: gnyi ga smos pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga smos pa ni log par rtogs pa bsal pa'i don du'o //
translated: But both are mentioned in order to exclude wrong conception.

original: 'di ltar ma 'khrul pa smos pa las mig ser gyis nyams pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni don bya ba med pa'i gzung ba la phyin ci log pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par shes la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'khrul pa smos pa las mig ser gyis nyams pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa ni don bya ba med pa'i gzung ba la phyin ci log pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par shes la /
translated: Thus, from mentioning non-mistaken, it is understood that the eye consciousness impaired by jaundice is not direct perception because it is mistaken with respect to the apprehended object that does not perform a function.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no //🔽tshad ma gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin no // tshad ma gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not inference because it is not produced from a reason having the three modes.🔽It is not another valid cognition because it is not non-deceptive with respect to what appears.

original: ji ltar snang ba la mi slu bas tshad mar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba la mi slu bas tshad mar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It is valid knowledge because it is nondeceptive with regard to the way things appear.

original: ji ltar zhen pa las yin grang na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhen pa las yin grang na /
translated: If it is from adherence,

original: 'di la ni snang ba dang zhen pa dag la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //🔽ma 'khrul ba smos pa med na ni kha cig rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can gyi yid du lhag par zhen nas tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la ni snang ba dang zhen pa dag la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no // ma 'khrul ba smos pa med na ni kha cig rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa can gyi yid du lhag par zhen nas tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
translated: then it is not a valid cognition, because neither the appearance nor the adherence is nondeceptive.

original: don tsam la mi slu ba dang rtog pa med pa nyid du lhag par zhen pas mngon sum nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don tsam la mi slu ba dang rtog pa med pa nyid du lhag par zhen pas mngon sum nyid du rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not mention nonerroneous, some would posit that a conceptual mental cognition of this type is a valid cognition, or else they would posit it as direct perception, adhering to the mere object as nondeceptive and nonconceptual.

original: ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni thams cad spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni thams cad spangs pa yin no //
translated: The mention of nonerroneous excludes all of these.

original: gzhan dag mdo sde pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung bsdu ba'i don du mi slu par byed pa la ma 'khrul par shes pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag mdo sde pa bzhin du rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung bsdu ba'i don du mi slu par byed pa la ma 'khrul par shes pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: Others, like the Sautrantikas, do not mention nondeceptive in the definition of direct perception, but they do mention nonerroneous in order to include the Yogacaras.

original: gang gi phyir slob dpon gyis ma 'khrul pa'i sgra'i don de lta bur gyur pa yin pa ni mi bzhed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir slob dpon gyis ma 'khrul pa'i sgra'i don de lta bur gyur pa yin pa ni mi bzhed de /
translated: But that is not correct, because the Acarya does not accept that the term nonerroneous has such a meaning.

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci log tu snang ba bzhin no zhes de dang der gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci log tu snang ba bzhin no zhes de dang der gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of error is that it appears in a distorted way.

original: dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum ltar snang ba'o zhes gsungs na yang /
analyzed: dngos po mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni mngon sum ltar snang ba'o zhes gsungs na yang /
translated: Although it is said that conceptual thought is like direct perception because the thing does not appear,

original: mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba don byed pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la mi 'khrul pa yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni dngos po snang ba don byed pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin la mi 'khrul pa yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: it is said that direct perception is nonerroneous with regard to the appearance of things, the nature of which is causally effective.

original: gang yang rjes su dpag pa ni de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su dpag pa ni de ma yin pa la der 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur pa na /
translated: If you say that inference is erroneous because it apprehends what is not that as that,

original: gal te mngon sum de las bzlog pa mi bzhed na rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa nyid du brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum de las bzlog pa mi bzhed na rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa nyid du brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then if you do not accept that direct perception is the opposite of that, what is the point of saying that inference is erroneous?

original: bzlog par bzhed do zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog par bzhed do zhe na /
translated: If you accept that it is the opposite,

original: 'o na de ni gzung ba la phyin ci log pas 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na de ni gzung ba la phyin ci log pas 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: then it is erroneous because it is distorted with regard to the object.

original: de las bzlog pas mngon sum ma 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum bzung ba las phyin ci ma log pas ma 'khrul lo zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas mngon sum ma 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum bzung ba las phyin ci ma log pas ma 'khrul lo zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The opposite of that is non-mistaken perception. Therefore, it is established that it is non-mistaken because it is not erroneous with respect to what is grasped by perception.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dbye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i dbye ba nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, perception is a type of correct knowledge.

original: de la yang dag pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'i @39a * //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i shes pa rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'i @39a * //
translated: And correct knowledge is free from conceptuality and non-erroneous.

original: ngag la ma 'khrul pa'i sgras yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rnam grangs mi slu ba'i don nye bar len pa ni don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngag la ma 'khrul pa'i sgras yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rnam grangs mi slu ba'i don nye bar len pa ni don med pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase “non-erroneous” in the statement “non-erroneous perception” is a synonym for correct knowledge. It is pointless to take it to mean non-deceptive.

original: gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung yang thams cad du rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung yang thams cad du rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that the master Dignāga does not accept that inference is a valid means of knowledge.

original: slob dpon gyis rjes su dpag pa nyid gzung ba la phyin ci log pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dang / don gyi mthu stobs kyis skye pas rtog pa med pa nyid du gsungs par ci'i phyir rjes su 'jug par mi byed /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rjes su dpag pa nyid gzung ba la phyin ci log pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba dang / don gyi mthu stobs kyis skye pas rtog pa med pa nyid du gsungs par ci'i phyir rjes su 'jug par mi byed /
translated: Why does he not accept that the master [Dignāga] himself said that inference is erroneous with respect to its object and that it is non-conceptual because it arises by the power of the object?

original: de'i phyir rnam rig tsam du smra ba ni slob dpon bag chags brtan pa dang mi brtan pa dag gis rnam par 'jog pa mthong la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam rig tsam du smra ba ni slob dpon bag chags brtan pa dang mi brtan pa dag gis rnam par 'jog pa mthong la /
translated: Therefore, the Proponents of Mere Consciousness posit the existence of consciousness by the stability or instability of latent impressions.

original: 'di ni don med na mi 'byung ba las zhes de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pa na /
analyzed: 'di ni don med na mi 'byung ba las zhes de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pa na /
translated: When it is said, “This is from a nonerroneous cause,”

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi tshul nyid bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi tshul nyid bzhed pa yin no //
translated: it is asserted that external objects are the mode of existence.

original: de'i phyir sngar bshad pa nyid ma 'khrul pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar bshad pa nyid ma 'khrul pa'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the previous statement is not erroneous.

original: kha cig zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang cha 'ga' zhig la mi slu pa des na tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir de bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang cha 'ga' zhig la mi slu pa des na tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir de bzlog pa'i don du ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say that because the consciousness of a double moon and so on is nondeceptive with regard to some of its aspects, it is valid knowledge. Therefore it is not correct to say nonerroneous in order to refute that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang ma mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos kyang ma mdzad pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it was not done by Master Dignaga.

original: ci ste shes pa 'ga' zhig nges pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad la mi slu ba de tshad ma nyid yin pa'i don du mi slu ba smos na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste shes pa 'ga' zhig nges pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad la mi slu ba de tshad ma nyid yin pa'i don du mi slu ba smos na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that nondeception is stated to mean that some consciousness is nondeceptive with regard to the whole nature of its object, then that is also illogical.

original: gang gi phyir don gyi bdag nyid thams cad la mi slu ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes 'dzer to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gyi bdag nyid thams cad la mi slu ba'i rnam par shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes 'dzer to //
translated: Because there is no consciousness whatsoever that is nondeceptive with regard to the whole nature of its object.

original: gal te de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar gsungs pa ji ltar 'gyur te /🔽tha na byis pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa yan chad kyang cha 'ga' zhig tha na dngos po tsam la mi slu ba ma yin pa'i shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar gsungs pa ji ltar 'gyur te / tha na byis pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa yan chad kyang cha 'ga' zhig tha na dngos po tsam la mi slu ba ma yin pa'i shes pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If that is so, how could the master Dignāga have said that direct perception and inference are valid knowledge?🔽Because even the conceptions of children and so on are not at all nondeceptive consciousnesses with regard to some part of their object, not to mention being nondeceptive with regard to the whole nature of its object.

original: bdag nyid thams cad la mi slu bar byed pa yang 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad la mi slu bar byed pa yang 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is not even one that is nondeceptive with regard to the whole nature of its object.

original: des na tshad ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa 'ga' zhig gtan nas mi slu ba ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa 'ga' zhig gtan nas mi slu ba ma yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the certainty of valid cognition, it is explained that some conceptual consciousnesses are not at all deceptive.

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni thams cad la yang mi slu bar sbyar bar nus pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni thams cad la yang mi slu bar sbyar bar nus pa yin no //
translated: However, in the manner explained above, it is possible to apply the term “nondeceptive” to all consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /🔽don bya ba byed pa'i don gang zhig mdun du byas nas rtog ba dang ldan pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis 'jug pa'i cha @39b de thob pa la brten nas mi slu bar 'jog la mngon par 'dod pa thob na yang bdag nyid thams cad la mi
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa ni 'di yin te / don bya ba byed pa'i don gang zhig mdun du byas nas rtog ba dang ldan pa don du gnyer ba nyid kyis 'jug pa'i cha @39b de thob pa la brten nas mi slu bar 'jog la mngon par 'dod pa thob na yang bdag nyid thams cad la mi
translated: Therefore, this is the intended meaning:🔽When a person who is engaged in the pursuit of an object that performs a function has obtained the object that he has sought, then, in dependence on the attainment of that object, he is said to be nondeceptive.

original: slu ba yin no //
analyzed: slu ba yin no //
translated: But when he has obtained the object that he desires, he is not nondeceptive with respect to all objects.

original: 'di ltar thun mong gi chos gang cung zad brtag pa de thams cad ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis don byed bar nus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar thun mong gi chos gang cung zad brtag pa de thams cad ni khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis don byed bar nus pa yin te /
translated: Thus, any object that is a common object, that is to say, any object that is slightly investigated, is capable of performing a function by virtue of its specific nature.

original: khyad par rnams nyid don byed par nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnams nyid don byed par nus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the specific properties themselves are capable of performing a function.

original: de ni don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis yod pa yin na nges pa'i khyad par la bslus pa na yang spyi la ma bslus pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis yod pa yin na nges pa'i khyad par la bslus pa na yang spyi la ma bslus pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it exists by virtue of its own causal capacity, then when it is deceived with respect to a particular, it is not the case that it is not deceived with respect to the universal.

original: des na don byed par nus pa'i khyad par spangs pa na bdag nyid thams cad la bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don byed par nus pa'i khyad par spangs pa na bdag nyid thams cad la bslus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the particular that is capable of causal efficiency is rejected, the entire self is deceived.

original: khyad par la ni smig rgyu la ni chu'i rang bzhin spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par la ni smig rgyu la ni chu'i rang bzhin spangs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of a mirage, the nature of water is rejected.

original: nor bu'i 'od la ni nor bu'i yul spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la ni nor bu'i yul spangs pa yin no //
translated: In the case of the light of a gem, the gem itself is rejected.

original: rmi lam bden pa'i shes pa ni dus spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam bden pa'i shes pa ni dus spangs pa yin te /
translated: In the case of a dream, a true cognition is rejected.

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa gzhan pas dngos po gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa gzhan pas dngos po gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the difference in place, time, and aspect, it is a different thing.

original: des na yul dang dus dang rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la de las bzlog pa shes pa ni phan tshun spangs pa yin pas 'gal ba'i dngos po ma bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na yul dang dus dang rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa'i dngos po la de las bzlog pa shes pa ni phan tshun spangs pa yin pas 'gal ba'i dngos po ma bzung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, with respect to a thing that exists in a different place, time, and aspect, a cognition that is the opposite of that is mutually exclusive and does not apprehend a contradictory thing.

original: des na 'gal ba rnam pa gsum gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa na bdag nyid thams cad bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba rnam pa gsum gyi rang bzhin 'dzin pa na bdag nyid thams cad bslus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when it apprehends the nature of the three kinds of contradictions, it is deceived in all its aspects.

original: des na phyis pa la sogs pa'i yongs su spangs nas rnam par rtog pa rnams la rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig tshad mar bshad do //
analyzed: des na phyis pa la sogs pa'i yongs su spangs nas rnam par rtog pa rnams la rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig tshad mar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, having rejected the erroneous, etc., the Acarya has explained that only inference is a valid means of knowledge.

original: de bzhin du ser por shes ba ni don byed par bzod pa'i rnam pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser por shes ba ni don byed par bzod pa'i rnam pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the cognition of yellow is the rejection of the aspect of the capacity to perform the function of blue.

original: ljon shing 'gro bar mthong ba ni de'i yul ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ljon shing 'gro bar mthong ba ni de'i yul ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The perception of a tree as moving is the rejection of its object.

original: zla ba gnyis su shes pa ni yul dang rnam pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su shes pa ni yul dang rnam pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of two moons is the rejection of the object and the aspect.

original: rta rmis na dus spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rta rmis na dus spangs pa yin te /
translated: The dream of a horse is the rejection of time.

original: des na 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it apprehends the nature of contradictions,

original: ji ltar na 'di dag cha shas la yang mi slu ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di dag cha shas la yang mi slu ba yin /
translated: how can it be nondeceptive even in part?

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa bzhin du slob dpon 'di dag kyang spangs par bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa bzhin du slob dpon 'di dag kyang spangs par bzhed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as inference is distinguished from other conceptual thoughts, these Acaryas also accept that it is distinguished from other nonconceptual thoughts.

original: de'i don du mtshan nyid lhag ma ma 'khrul pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du mtshan nyid lhag ma ma 'khrul pa smos pa yin no //
translated: The term “non-erroneous” is added to the definition in order to indicate that.

original: gal te rang bzhin 'gal ba 'dzin pa 'khrul pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin 'gal ba 'dzin pa 'khrul pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it were to apprehend contradictory natures, it would be erroneous and therefore not a valid cognition.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba yang 'khrul par thal par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba yang 'khrul par thal par 'gyur te /
translated: It would also follow, absurdly, that the appearance of blue and so on would be erroneous,

original: rdul phra rab ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dres pa nyid du 'gal bar 'dzin pa'i @40a * //🔽phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dres pa nyid du 'gal bar 'dzin pa'i @40a * // phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it would be apprehending as mixed that which is not mixed, namely, the unmixed subtle atoms.

original: smras pa / 'dir re zhig phyi rol gyi tshul gyis rnam par shes pa de na 'dzin par byed pa dang rdul phra rab rnams phyogs cha tha dad pas byas pa'i 'gal ba dang mi ldan par khas blangs nas mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir re zhig phyi rol gyi tshul gyis rnam par shes pa de na 'dzin par byed pa dang rdul phra rab rnams phyogs cha tha dad pas byas pa'i 'gal ba dang mi ldan par khas blangs nas mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, first, in terms of the external mode of perception, one should state the definition of a valid cognition by accepting that the apprehending consciousness and the subtle atoms do not possess the contradiction that is created by their different directional parts.

original: de la sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa dang 'gal bar snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa dang 'gal bar snang ba ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, a consciousness that has the aspect of blue does not appear to contradict the way in which the object abides.

original: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab rnams kyi ma 'dres pa nyid rang bzhin tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phra rab rnams kyi ma 'dres pa nyid rang bzhin tha dad pa'am /
translated: If the atoms are unmixed, then either they have a different nature,

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyi yul spangs pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyi yul spangs pa'am /
translated: or they are devoid of an object that is different from their nature,

original: nam mkha' stong pa'i yul dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa'i yul dang ldan pa'am /
translated: or they have an empty space as their object,

original: dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung bas bar du bcad pa dang ldan pa yin grang na /
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung bas bar du bcad pa dang ldan pa yin grang na /
translated: or they are obstructed by the object of a different sense faculty.

original: de la snang ba na rang bzhin tha dad pa med par ni mi snang ste /
analyzed: de la snang ba na rang bzhin tha dad pa med par ni mi snang ste /
translated: If they appear, then they do not appear without a different nature,

original: gong du rdul phra rab tsam du snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du rdul phra rab tsam du snang bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that they would appear as just atoms, as was previously explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gzhan gyi yul spangs par snang pa yang grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin gzhan gyi yul spangs par snang pa yang grub bo //
translated: For that very reason, it is established that they appear devoid of an object that is different from their nature.

original: nam mkha' stong pa'i phyogs kyang dngos po med pas dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa'i phyogs kyang dngos po med pas dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: And empty space is not the object of a sense consciousness, because it is a non-thing.

original: dbang po gzhan gyis gzung bas bar du chod pa nyid ni rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig tu rgyu ba yod pa nyid yin la de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyis gzung bas bar du chod pa nyid ni rig pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig tu rgyu ba yod pa nyid yin la de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The fact that it is obstructed by the apprehension of other sense faculties is the existence of the simultaneous movement of the nature of cognition, etc., and that is not manifest to visual consciousness.

original: de la gal te reg pa la sogs pas stong par snang ba nyid la 'dres par snang ba nyid du brjod na /
analyzed: de la gal te reg pa la sogs pas stong par snang ba nyid la 'dres par snang ba nyid du brjod na /
translated: If it is said that the appearance of the empty form, etc. is the appearance of a mixture,

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: that is accepted.

original: de la reg pa la sogs pa snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la reg pa la sogs pa snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of contact, etc. is absent there.

original: reg pa la sogs pa mi snang ba yang mig gis gzung par bya ba'i rang bzhin ni 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa mi snang ba yang mig gis gzung par bya ba'i rang bzhin ni 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: The absence of the appearance of contact, etc. is not contradictory to the nature of being apprehended by the eye.

original: ci ste bar chad med par snang pa'i phyir gzugs reg pa'i yul na gnas par mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: ci ste bar chad med par snang pa'i phyir gzugs reg pa'i yul na gnas par mthong ba yin la /
translated: If it is thought that form is seen to be located in the domain of contact because it appears without obstruction,

original: de'i phyir yul la 'khrul pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul la 'khrul pa yin no snyam na /
translated: and therefore there is error regarding the object,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also unreasonable.

original: reg pa las tha dad pa'i yul 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: reg pa las tha dad pa'i yul 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Because there is no object separate from contact.

original: de mi snang na ji ltar na de'i yul na gzugs yod par snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de mi snang na ji ltar na de'i yul na gzugs yod par snang bar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not appear, how could form appear as its object?

original: de'i phyir 'dres par 'khrul pa 'di ni reg pa'i rdul phra rab dang bral ba'i gzungs kyi rdul phra rab rnams rang gi yul du shes pa gcig la snang ba la brten pa'i yid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dres par 'khrul pa 'di ni reg pa'i rdul phra rab dang bral ba'i gzungs kyi rdul phra rab rnams rang gi yul du shes pa gcig la snang ba la brten pa'i yid yin no //
translated: Therefore, this confusion of a mixture is the mental consciousness that is based on the appearance of the atoms of form that are not separated from the atoms of tangible objects in one cognition in its own object-field.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi yul na gnas pa'i gzugs snang ba yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa ni rang gi yul na gnas pa'i gzugs snang ba yin te /
translated: The sense consciousnesses appear as forms that exist in their own object-fields.

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa la 'khrul pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar ma 'dres @40b pa rnams la 'dres par snang ba yin /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa la 'khrul pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar ma 'dres @40b pa rnams la 'dres par snang ba yin /
translated: Since they are not confused about their object, time, and aspect, how could they appear as a mixture to those who are unconfused?

original: yul gzhan du 'dzin na ni 'dres par 'dzin par 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'dzin na ni 'dres par 'dzin par 'gyur na de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: If they apprehend a different object, they would apprehend a mixture, but that does not exist, as was previously established.

original: rags pa nyid dang phyogs cha tha dad pa'i mang po ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rags pa nyid dang phyogs cha tha dad pa'i mang po ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is contradictory for many things that are gross and have different directional parts to exist.

original: de'i phyir yod pa nyid kyi rgyu ni don bya ba byed pa yin la don bya ba byed pa yang khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa nyid kyi rgyu ni don bya ba byed pa yin la don bya ba byed pa yang khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of existence is the performance of a function, and the performance of a function is a distinguishing feature.

original: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa med na khyad par du snang bar dmigs pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad yod par khas blang bar bya bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa med na khyad par du snang bar dmigs pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad yod par khas blang bar bya bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if there is no sublation, it is reasonable to accept as existent all that is observed as appearing as a distinguishing feature.

original: don bya ba byed par nus pa'i yul la gnod par byed pa yod na ni dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad btang ba yin no //
analyzed: don bya ba byed par nus pa'i yul la gnod par byed pa yod na ni dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad btang ba yin no //
translated: If there is sublation with regard to the object that is able to perform a function, then all the nature of the thing is abandoned.

original: don byed par nus pa dmigs na ni nges par gyis don byed pa la bye bar mkho ba can gyin la /
analyzed: don byed par nus pa dmigs na ni nges par gyis don byed pa la bye bar mkho ba can gyin la /
translated: If one observes that which is able to perform a function, then it is definitely necessary to employ that which performs a function.

original: de de la tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de de la tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: But that is not a valid cognition.

original: gnod pa med pa'i cha don bya ba byed pa ni tshad ma'i yul yin pas chos can de la ma gnas pa'i rang bzhin yang tshad ma gzhan gyis sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i cha don bya ba byed pa ni tshad ma'i yul yin pas chos can de la ma gnas pa'i rang bzhin yang tshad ma gzhan gyis sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The object of a valid cognition is the performance of a function that is not sublated. Therefore, even the nature of a subject that does not abide in that is established by another valid cognition.

original: sngon po ma yin pa las log pa'i don yang gnas pa'i khyad par gyis don byed pa la nye bar mkho ba can yin la /
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa las log pa'i don yang gnas pa'i khyad par gyis don byed pa la nye bar mkho ba can yin la /
translated: The meaning of the opposite of non-blue is also the meaning of the particular of existence, which is necessary for the performance of a function.

original: de dang 'gal ba med pa du ma nyid dang ma 'dres pa nyid dang skad cig ma nyid ni mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan las khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba med pa du ma nyid dang ma 'dres pa nyid dang skad cig ma nyid ni mthong ba la tshad ma gzhan las khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: The many, the unmixed, and the momentary, which are not incompatible with that, are understood from another valid cognition in regard to seeing.

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa gzhan nyid ni gzhan la 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa gzhan nyid ni gzhan la 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The difference of place, time, and aspect is incompatible with another.

original: des na de lta bur gyur pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni cha thams cad la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba yin no //🔽gzhan dag ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba kho na ste 'on kyang dung gcig la ser por shes pa dbyibs kyi cha la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: des na de lta bur gyur pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni cha thams cad la 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba yin no // gzhan dag ma 'khrul pa smos par bya ba kho na ste 'on kyang dung gcig la ser por shes pa dbyibs kyi cha la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that apprehends such a thing is mistaken in regard to all its aspects, and so it is not to be called non-mistaken.🔽Others say that it is only to be called non-mistaken, but since the cognition of a conch as yellow is non-deceptive in regard to the aspect of shape, it is a valid cognition.

original: kha dog gi cha la phyin ci log tu gyur pas tshad ma ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: kha dog gi cha la phyin ci log tu gyur pas tshad ma ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is simply not a valid cognition in regard to the aspect of color because it is mistaken.

original: des na ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni 'di cha de la tshad ma yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin zhes ston par byed pa yin no zhes smra ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni 'di cha de la tshad ma yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin zhes ston par byed pa yin no zhes smra ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the statement “non-mistaken” is made in order to show that this is a valid cognition in regard to that part, but not in regard to others.

original: gang gi phyir cha gcig la 'jug pa'i yan lag gi tshad ma yin na ni cha gzhan la tshad ma ma yin par bsgrubs pa la cung zad kyang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir cha gcig la 'jug pa'i yan lag gi tshad ma yin na ni cha gzhan la tshad ma ma yin par bsgrubs pa la cung zad kyang 'bras bu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a correct response, because if it is a valid cognition in regard to one part, it is not established as a valid cognition in regard to another part.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin par bsgrub pa'i don du yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa ni 'jug pa'i yan lag ma yin par bsgrub pa'i don du yin na /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition, it is not established as a part of engagement.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid yin no //🔽'jug pa yin pa de ltar na yang yul @41a * //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid yin no // 'jug pa yin pa de ltar na yang yul @41a * //
translated: But it is a part of engagement.

original: de la tshad mar 'khrul par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshad mar 'khrul par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Even if it is engagement, it is not mistaken in regard to that object.

original: tha snyad nyid las tshad ma ma yin par rang kho nas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha snyad nyid las tshad ma ma yin par rang kho nas rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it that it is not a valid cognition because it is a convention?

original: de'i phyir cha 'di la tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir cha 'di la tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of saying, “It is not a valid cognition in regard to this part”?

original: de'i phyir rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa thams cad ma 'khrul par smos pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa thams cad ma 'khrul par smos pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, all consciousnesses of this type are to be rejected as non-erroneous.

original: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha dad par don byed nus pa ma yin pas nus pa'i kha dog de la 'khrul pa na de la ma 'khrul par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha dad par don byed nus pa ma yin pas nus pa'i kha dog de la 'khrul pa na de la ma 'khrul par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since shape is not a different object from color, it is not capable of a separate function. Therefore, when there is error with respect to the color that is capable of a function, how can there be non-error with respect to that?

original: don bya ba nus pa brjod pa'i dung gi sgra yang dbyibs kyi khyad par can gyi kha dog la 'jug la /
analyzed: don bya ba nus pa brjod pa'i dung gi sgra yang dbyibs kyi khyad par can gyi kha dog la 'jug la /
translated: The sound of a conch that is capable of a function is applied to the color that has the feature of shape.

original: kha dog rnams kyang rab tu dbye ba du ma yod pa nyid kyis na khyad par don du gnyer bas /
analyzed: kha dog rnams kyang rab tu dbye ba du ma yod pa nyid kyis na khyad par don du gnyer bas /
translated: Since colors have many different varieties, one should seek a specific one.

original: dkar po ser po gser po gser dngul zhes khyad par du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po ser po gser po gser dngul zhes khyad par du brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, “It is white, yellow, golden, gold, or silver,” and so on.

original: don byed pa thob pa ni shes pa gzhan kho na las yin gyi ser po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa thob pa ni shes pa gzhan kho na las yin gyi ser po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The attainment of a function is due to another consciousness, not due to the apprehension of the nature of yellow.

original: de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba bzlog pa'i don du yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'khrul pa smos pa ni 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba bzlog pa'i don du yin la /
translated: Therefore, the mention of non-error is for the purpose of countering the notion that it has a contradictory nature.

original: 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa de yang bdag nyid thams cad la slu bar byed pa yin no zhes gnas so //🔽phyi nas brjod kyang brjod par bya ba nyung bas ma 'khrul ba nyid dang por bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa de yang bdag nyid thams cad la slu bar byed pa yin no zhes gnas so // phyi nas brjod kyang brjod par bya ba nyung bas ma 'khrul ba nyid dang por bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And that contradictory nature is a deception with regard to all of its nature.🔽Since it is said later on, but since there is less to be said, non-error should be explained first.

original: rab rib dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rab rib dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “Even though it is said later on, since there is less to be said, non-error should be explained first.🔽”

original: rab rib mig la gnas pa dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu ste /🔽'dis ni mig la gnas pa'i dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: rab rib mig la gnas pa dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu ste / 'dis ni mig la gnas pa'i dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: The cause of the impairment of the sense faculty that resides in the eye is eye-disease.

original: mig ser la sogs pa mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: mig ser la sogs pa mtshon pa yin no //
translated: This indicates jaundice, etc., which is the cause of the impairment of the sense faculty that resides in the eye.

original: myur du bskor ba ni dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu yul la gnas pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: myur du bskor ba ni dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu yul la gnas pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The special activity of the cause of the impairment of the sense faculty that resides in the object is rapid rotation.

original: myur ba smos pa ni dal bus bskor bar bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: myur ba smos pa ni dal bus bskor bar bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word “quickly” is used to exclude the possibility that the object is turned slowly.

original: de ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: That is not the cause of error.

original: mgal me nyung ngu bskor bas rjes su 'gro ba'i mig gi 'bras bur 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: mgal me nyung ngu bskor bas rjes su 'gro ba'i mig gi 'bras bur 'gyur ba na /
translated: When a firebrand is turned slowly, the eye is not deceived by the impression of a circle.

original: mig nyams pas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mig nyams pas mig gi rnam par shes pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: But when the eye is defective, the visual consciousness is deceived.

original: 'dis ni mgal me yan man du g-yugs pa la sogs pa dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu yul la gnas pa rnams mtshon pa yin te /🔽mgal me phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyogs te /
analyzed: 'dis ni mgal me yan man du g-yugs pa la sogs pa dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu yul la gnas pa rnams mtshon pa yin te / mgal me phyogs gcig tu mngon du phyogs te /
translated: This example illustrates the causes that impair the sense faculties and that are located in external objects, such as the firebrand whirled in a circle.

original: myur du g-yugs pa na dbyug pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: myur du g-yugs pa na dbyug pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa skye ba yin no //
translated: When the firebrand is turned in one direction and whirled quickly, the impression of a wheel arises.

original: grur zhugs pa ni @41b grus 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: grur zhugs pa ni @41b grus 'gro ba ste /
translated: When one is in a boat, the boat moves on the water.

original: 'dug pa'i grur 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba des ni bya ba'i khyad par kho nas 'khrul ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'dug pa'i grur 'khrul par mi 'gyur ba des ni bya ba'i khyad par kho nas 'khrul ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: But when one is on dry land, the impression of movement does not arise.

original: 'di ni phyi rol gyi rten la gnas pa dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di ni phyi rol gyi rten la gnas pa dbang po nyams par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: These are the causes of error that are located in external objects and that impair the sense faculties.

original: gru 'gro bas lus bskyod pa na dbang po nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gru 'gro bas lus bskyod pa na dbang po nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the boat moves, the sense faculty is damaged.

original: 'dis kyang rta'i bzhon pa dang ldan pa dang / rlung la sogs pas 'khrugs pa dang / gnad mi bzad par bsnun pa dang / 'khrus pa dang / bskor gar la sogs pa rten la gnas pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu rnams nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rta'i bzhon pa dang ldan pa dang / rlung la sogs pas 'khrugs pa dang / gnad mi bzad par bsnun pa dang / 'khrus pa dang / bskor gar la sogs pa rten la gnas pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu rnams nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: This also illustrates the causes of error that are based on the sense faculty, such as riding a horse, being disturbed by wind, being struck by a weapon, being sick, and dancing.

original: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang grur zhugs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i dbang po'i 'gyur ba ni 'khrugs pa ste /
analyzed: rab rib dang myur du bskor ba dang grur zhugs pa rnams kyis byas pa'i dbang po'i 'gyur ba ni 'khrugs pa ste /
translated: The disturbance of the sense faculty is caused by cataracts, by quickly turning the eyes, and by being in a boat.

original: ji srid dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba ma byas pa de srid du dbang po las skyes pa rnam par bslad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid dbang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba ma byas pa de srid du dbang po las skyes pa rnam par bslad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as the sense faculty is not disturbed, the sense consciousness that arises from it is not erroneous.

original: de dag gis byas pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gis 'khrugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gis 'khrugs pa yin no //
translated: That which is caused by them is the disturbance of the sense faculty.

original: de la sogs pa dbang po'i yul na gnas pa dang / phyi rol gyi yul na gnas pa dang / rten la gnas pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu rnams kyis byas pa'i 'khrugs pa gzhan gang yin pa ste /🔽de la sogs pas gang du 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa ste /🔽sogs pa'i sgra'i mtha'i 'bru mang po bas drug pa'i bsdu ba yin pa de bas na la 'khrugs pas 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa'i shes pa de dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa dbang po'i yul na gnas pa dang / phyi rol gyi yul na gnas pa dang / rten la gnas pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyu rnams kyis byas pa'i 'khrugs pa gzhan gang yin pa ste / de la sogs pas gang du 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa ste / sogs pa'i sgra'i mtha'i 'bru mang po bas drug pa'i bsdu ba yin pa de bas na la 'khrugs pas 'khrul pa ma bskyed pa'i shes pa de dang 'brel pa yin no //
